finding: The N551K mutation in LRRK2 was identified as a homozygous variant in the twins studied, which was linked to the early onset of paucibacillary leprosy. This variant had also been recognized previously as a protective factor in Crohn's disease.
title: Early onset leprosy reveals a joint effect of LRRK2 and NOD2 variants

finding: The R1398H mutation in LRRK2 was another mutation found as homozygous in the affected twins, contributing to their early onset leprosy. This variant is notable for its established impact on LRRK2 protein activity and has been associated with protective effects against Crohn's disease.
title: Early onset leprosy reveals a joint effect of LRRK2 and NOD2 variants

finding: The SNP rs7302200 was identified as the lead variant in the 12q13.2 IKZF4-RPS26-ERBB3 locus with a strong association to type 1 diabetes risk, showing an odds ratio of 1.31 and a very low p-value, indicating strong significance.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: The rs597808 SNP in the SH2B3 locus was significantly associated with type 1 diabetes risk, yielding an odds ratio of 1.27, indicating a notable risk increase for this condition.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs11171747 near the ERBB3 gene was identified as significantly associated with age at onset of type 1 diabetes, with an odds ratio of 1.17 and a noteworthy p-value, suggesting its importance in this aspect.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: The rs1265564 SNP at the SH2B3 locus was linked to age at onset of type 1 diabetes, showing an odds ratio of 1.16, further supporting its potential role in the disease's pathology.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: An independent association at the chromosome 12 locus harboring ALDH2 designated as rs2074356 was discovered in the Korean cohort. It exhibited strong statistical significance when adjusted for known variants, reaffirming its association with alcohol flushing.
title: Genetic influences on alcohol flushing in East Asian populations

finding: The rs11049367 variant in the 12p11.22 region was linked to functional connectivity traits of the frontoparietal and default mode networks, with a notable association between areas in these networks under both resting and task fMRI conditions.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: This SNP in CCDC91 showed an age-dependent effect on lung function, indicating its relevance in differing age groups.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: This SNP represented a splicing variant in the gene KMT2D, specifically NM 003482:exon32:c.8047-2A>G, identified as a possible driver mutation in a tumor of a patient suffering from a mixed somato-lactotroph tumor. This variant disrupted the acceptor site of exon 33 and was predicted as pathogenic by various algorithms. Importantly, this mutation was absent in the germline sample, indicating its somatic nature.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing and single-cell transcriptomics identify KMT2D as a potential new driver for pituitary adenomas

finding: The index SNP rs3184504, located at the SH2B3 locus, was identified as a loss-of-function variant associated with chronic kidney disease (CKD). It was previously less recognized for its involvement in kidney function. Experiments in murine models with this minor allele demonstrated elevated blood pressure and worsened kidney dysfunction compared to control mice. This study represented the first linkage of this missense SNP to human kidney function.
title: A multi-phenotype approach implicates SH2B3 in the genetics of chronic kidney disease

finding: The locus at 12q24.12 (rs11066015) was specific to East Asian populations and shown to be associated with the ALDH2 gene, which has implications in metabolic traits.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs1059513 in the STAT6 gene was identified through the liability method for asthma but was not found in the binary method. This discovery was in line with prior literature indicating genetic associations with asthma.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs11055602 was characterized as a GR-response meQTL located on chromosome 12. It exhibited effects on methylation both before and after dexamethasone treatment, showing a notable decrease in individuals with major genotype and an increase in individuals with the minor allele genotype post-treatment, with a significant FDR of 5.1×10^-30.
title: Multi-omics analysis of the molecular response to glucocorticoids - insights into shared genetic risk from psychiatric to medical disorders

finding: The SNP rs6489896 was associated with a 310 bp Alu deletion located in an intron of TPCN1, showing significant linkage (R²=0.73).
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: Patients with the CD69 rs11052877 AA genotype had an increased response to tocilizumab compared to those with AG and GG genotypes, indicating that this SNP may enhance therapeutic efficacy.
title: Interleukin-6 receptor genetic variation and tocilizumab treatment response to COVID-19

finding: The variant rs7962636 was found to associate with an increase of 0.023 SD in expected baseline weight. This finding was significant at P = 3.7 × 10<sup>−12</sup> and highlighted the role of the nearest gene, MED13L, in the differentiation of white adipocytes.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: The rs7134559_C allele was associated with lower p-tau levels in a non-specific manner across diseases, relevant for understanding genetic links to p-tau variations in both AD and PD.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: Identified as the same SNP as rs2292912, it showed a mild positive association with late evening stroke similar to other findings reported. This relationship was significant within the context of the study cohort.
title: Clinical implication of time of stroke among post stroke survivors from eastern India: A circadian perspective

finding: SNP rs2657879 demonstrated a statistically significant association with glutamine, surpassing other glutamine instruments with a p-value of 3×10^-70, indicating a particularly robust association. This SNP is located within the genomic region of GLS2, which encodes the enzyme responsible for converting glutamine to glutamate. In analyses, glutamine exhibited a small protective causal effect on Alzheimer's Disease (AD), with an odds ratio of 0.80 and p-value of 0.002, further corroborated by post-hoc analyses that highlighted its influential role in mediating the glutamine-AD relationship.
title: Disentangling independent and mediated causal relationships between blood metabolites, cognitive factors, and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs3138142 demonstrated recessive effects in relation to retinal thickness measurements, indicating its relevance in understanding genetic factors influencing retinal morphology.
title: Autoencoder-based phenotyping of ophthalmic images highlights genetic loci influencing retinal morphology and provides epidemiologically informative biomarkers

finding: At the LLPH locus, the SNP rs117568227 was the only variant identified in the 95% credible set during fine-mapping studies, emphasizing its potential significance in understanding the genetic underpinnings of PCOS.
title: Genomic and proteomic evidence for hormonal and metabolic foundations of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: Identified as a significant genetic marker, rs1045542 in SUDS3 at 12q24.23 was crucial in studying genetic impacts on PSA values.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs76687508 exhibited a risk difference (RD) of 0.50 and was linked to phenylketonuria, a serious metabolic disorder that necessitates dietary restrictions.
title: Deleterious Variants Contribute Minimal Excess Risk in Large-Scale Testing

finding: The SNP rs7133378, a variant within DNAH10, was associated with lower HDL and higher TG, and it increased the risk of CAD, thus exhibiting adverse cardiometabolic effects.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs547590324 was associated with a significant association in the high African ancestry Ibadan dataset, showing genome-wide significance with a p-value of 3.8×10^-8, located within the ASCL1 gene at chromosome 12.
title: Extended genome-wide association study employing the African Genome Resources Panel identifies novel susceptibility loci for Alzheimer’s Disease in individuals of African ancestry

finding: This SNP was noted in the analysis of the top meta-analysis locus markers, appearing on African and Amerindian backgrounds but not on European backgrounds, although specific associations were not detailed in the abstract.
title: Extended genome-wide association study employing the African Genome Resources Panel identifies novel susceptibility loci for Alzheimer’s Disease in individuals of African ancestry

finding: Like rs556001137, this SNP was part of the meta-analysis of the top loci but specific results regarding its associations were not delineated in the abstract.
title: Extended genome-wide association study employing the African Genome Resources Panel identifies novel susceptibility loci for Alzheimer’s Disease in individuals of African ancestry

finding: This SNP was identified as significantly associated in the African Ibadan dataset, indicating its presence in West Africans and sparseness in other populations.
title: Extended genome-wide association study employing the African Genome Resources Panel identifies novel susceptibility loci for Alzheimer’s Disease in individuals of African ancestry

finding: This SNP showed significant association in the African Ibadan dataset, similar to rs144730555, suggesting regional prevalence in West African populations.
title: Extended genome-wide association study employing the African Genome Resources Panel identifies novel susceptibility loci for Alzheimer’s Disease in individuals of African ancestry

finding: The rs582975 variant at the PARP11-CCND2 locus indicated a protective role against DNMT3A-CH with an OR of 0.93 [0.91-0.95] and a P-value of 1.26 x 10^-8, marking it as a novel risk locus in the study.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs1431999695, associated with the gene ALG10B, revealed significant interaction with LTST for PP with a P-value of 2.5×10^-5, confirming its role in blood pressure variation.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The analysis continued to support rs7955964's interaction with LTST and its association with mean arterial pressure, previously established in a smaller cohort, with strong evidence reaffirmed in the current study.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs76904798, found on chromosome 12 at 40220632, was among those raising the probability of patients belonging to the 'moderate' progression subtype of PD.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: As a shared SNP between hypothyroidism and TSH levels, this variant contributed to a deeper understanding of thyroid genetics.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The rs10774671 variant was a <italic>cis</italic>-splice QTL for <italic>OAS1</italic>, showing that it had a risk allele which increased the expression of an alternative transcript associated with lower OAS1 protein abundance. This presented a conflicting effect in the context of lupus, opposing through <italic>cis</italic> and <italic>trans</italic> regulation mechanisms.
title: USP18 modulates lupus risk via negative regulation of interferon response

finding: The GNB3 rs5443 heterozygotes had an increased risk for MI/angina compared to CC homozygotes, indicating genetic susceptibility leading to adverse cardiovascular events (HR 1.07, 95% CI 1.01 to 1.13, p=0.02).
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The rs10774625 polymorphism, which is an intronic variant of the ATXN2 gene located at the 12q24.12 locus, was associated with various cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) including coronary artery disease (CAD) and was shown to have significant colocalization evidence with leukocyte telomere length (LTL) and multiple CVDs. It exhibited robust colocalization with a posterior probability higher than 0.7 for all CVDs investigated, excluding atrial fibrillation (AF) and peripheral artery disease (PAD). The finding underscores the genetic link between LTL and CVDs.
title: Contribution of leukocyte telomere length to major cardiovascular diseases onset: phenotypic and genetic insights from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The SNP rs11568563 indicated a significant association with PSP (OR[95%CI]=0.54[0.42–0.69]; p=1.17·10^-06), further validating its role in susceptibility.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: Intronic variant rs76895963 in CCND2 was significantly associated with pituitary gland volume (β = 0.24, MAF = 0.02) and had previous associations with testosterone, underpinning its role in reproductive functions.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs111970601 was associated with sensitivity to carbon monoxide (CO) exposure, showing an odds ratio of 6.58, indicating a significantly increased risk of asthma exacerbations following AAP spikes among those sensitive to CO. The gene implicated by this variant was identified as RIMBP2, which plays a significant role in asthma pathophysiology.
title: GWAS reveals Genetic Susceptibility to Air Pollution-Related Asthma Exacerbations in Children of African Ancestry

finding: This SNP (PRR4) was newly linked to the consumption of non-caffeine substances in coffee, highlighting its potential role in health.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SLCO1B1 variant rs4149056 was implicated in statin metabolism and demonstrated a frequency of 12.5% amongst Indonesians, consistent with previous reports of lower frequencies in the Singaporean population.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The SNP rs773111 in the RAB5B locus was reported as an eQTL impacting gene expression in both blood and digestive tissues. It was identified as being associated with both endometriosis and GPM, indicating its potential role in the shared mechanisms between these disorders.
title: Evidence of shared genetic factors in the aetiology of gastrointestinal disorders and endometriosis and clinical implications for disease management

finding: The intronic variant rs11172113 in <italic>LRP1</italic> had an estimated PIP of 1.00, indicating a strong association with migraine risk while being involved in vascular integrity and other diseases.
title: Fine-mapping a genome-wide meta-analysis of 98,374 migraine cases identifies 181 sets of candidate causal variants

finding: The loss-of-function variant rs4149056:Val174Ala was shown to result in increased plasma concentrations of statins, with homozygous carriers of the minor C allele exhibiting an increase of up to 221% in in vitro studies. This variant was significantly associated with a 3-to-17-fold increase in the odds of statin-related myopathy in post-hoc analyses of randomized controlled trials.
title: Common and rare variants in SLCO1B1 are associated with statin intolerance

finding: The gain-of-function variant rs11045819:Pro155Thr was independently associated with a 32% decrease in systemic exposure to simvastatin acid per allele. This finding supported the hypothesis that certain gain-of-function variants could mitigate the effects of statin pharmacokinetics.
title: Common and rare variants in SLCO1B1 are associated with statin intolerance

finding: The gain-of-function variant rs34671512:Leu643Phe was associated with a 36% decrease in systemic exposure to simvastatin acid per allele, indicating a potential role in reducing the risk of statin intolerance by lowering systemic exposure to the drug.
title: Common and rare variants in SLCO1B1 are associated with statin intolerance

finding: The gain-of-function variant rs2306283:Asn130Asp was identified as playing a role in statin response and adverse drug reactions (ADRs) when analyzed alongside the loss-of-function Val174Ala variant. It was recognized as a notable variant among the set tested.
title: Common and rare variants in SLCO1B1 are associated with statin intolerance

finding: The tolerated missense variant rs3184504 (allele T) was associated with increased TSH levels, which led to an increased risk of both hypothyroidism and hyperthyroidism. Additionally, this SNP was linked with increased risk of other autoimmune disorders and exhibited pleiotropic associations with many traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: The intronic variant rs2393717 (G allele) in SPPL3 was associated with increased TSH and showed a reduced risk of hypothyroidism, along with various metabolic changes including increased IGF-1 and altered lipid traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: As a missense variant in <italic>SH2B3</italic>, rs3184504 showed increased PIP after adjusting for the <italic>GC</italic> haplotypes, highlighting its importance in DBP concentration variability.
title: Genetic correlates of vitamin D-binding protein and 25 hydroxyvitamin D in neonatal dried blood spots

finding: The SNP rs11062170 was identified as a MPRA-positive variant located within a H3K27ac peak specific to neurons, relevant to the CACNA1C gene, which is associated with schizophrenia. The reference allele G induced higher gene expression than the alternative allele C, which disrupts the binding motif of transcription factor RFX5, resulting in lower expression.
title: Systematic investigation of allelic regulatory activity of schizophrenia-associated common variants

finding: As an intronic variant in SCARB1, rs11057853 was associated with reduced GEM and indicated a protective role against clonal hematopoiesis, highlighting its potential importance in blood trait modifications.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: This variant mapped to ATP23 and CYP27B1, showing association with increased ACEi-induced cough and reducing levels of urea and urate, thus indicating a potential metabolic connection.
title: Genomics of chronic cough unravels neurological pathways

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel locus associated with Parkinson's disease (PD) among MAPT H1/H1 carriers. The odds ratio (OR) was reported as 0.88, indicating a decreased risk for PD, with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.84-0.92 and a p-value of 1.80E-08. It was not associated with PD in the H2 haplotype analysis.
title: Genome-wide association study stratified by MAPT haplotypes identifies potential novel loci in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs1626329 in the P2RX7 gene was identified as the trans-ancestry lead variant associated with chronic alanine aminotransferase elevation (cALT). It was associated with metabolic liver disease and showed a significant linkage disequilibrium (LD) with another coding variant.
title: A genome-wide association study of chronic ALT-based non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in the Million Veteran Program with histological and radiological validation

finding: The SNP rs1169292 mapped to the HNF1A gene was identified as the lead variant specifically in European-only analyses. This SNP is implicated in metabolic liver disease and was linked with distinct coding variants.
title: A genome-wide association study of chronic ALT-based non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in the Million Veteran Program with histological and radiological validation

finding: The SNP rs11051131 demonstrated dominant effects, with significant differences in retinal thickness maps between heterozygotes and homozygotes. This indicated its involvement in genetic variation associated with retinal morphology.
title: Autoencoder-based phenotyping of ophthalmic images highlights genetic loci influencing retinal morphology and provides informative biomarkers

finding: The SNP rs28730284, located upstream of the KLRC2 gene, also showed significant association with CAA/L. This SNP has biological relevance since KLRC2 encodes a C-type lectin critical in natural killer (NK) cell function.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The variant rs2007044 was implicated as a candidate causal variant within the gene CACNA1C. It was identified as a secondary eQTL driving the expression of the gene, which is associated with schizophrenia (SZ) and bipolar disorder (BD). It was noted to influence transcription due to reduced promoter interaction.
title: Trans-ethnic eQTL meta-analysis of human brain reveals regulatory architecture and candidate causal variants for brain-related traits

finding: This index variant was located in an intronic region of NUAK1 at 12q23.3 and served as a multi-tissue eQTL for Lnc-NUAK1-1. It correlated with traits such as cortical thickness, surface area, and subcortical volume, thus linking this region with brain morphology.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The SNP rs12827878, associated with the gene XRCC6CP1 and INHBC, was found to be linked to decreased levels of urate and urea, indicating a multifaceted role in biological processes potentially relevant to ACEI-induced cough.
title: Genome-wide association study of ACE inhibitor-induced cough implicates neuropeptides and shows genetic overlap with chronic dry cough

finding: The SNP rs121913529 was associated with two mutations in the KRAS gene, specifically c.G35A (p.G12D) and c.G35T (p.G12V), which were found in tumor tissues from 68 and 65 patients, respectively. This indicated a recurrent mutation pattern in colorectal cancer tumors.
title: Spectrum of somatic mutational features of colorectal tumors in ancestrally diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs112445441 was associated with a mutation in the KRAS gene, specifically c.G38A (p.G13D), observed in tumor tissues from 59 patients. Its detection in multiple tumors highlights its relevance in colorectal cancer.
title: Spectrum of somatic mutational features of colorectal tumors in ancestrally diverse populations

finding: The common, non-coding, intergenic variant rs10774740 at 12q24.21 was associated with posterior urethral valves (PUV), reaching a statistically significant <italic>P</italic>-value of 7.8x10<sup>-12</sup> and an odds ratio of 0.4 in the mixed ancestry analysis. This variant was subsequently confirmed in an independent European cohort with a <italic>P</italic>-value of 1.9x10<sup>-3</sup> and an odds ratio of 0.78, suggesting it confers protection against PUV. The analysis linked this locus to the transcription factor <italic>TBX5</italic>, known for its role in congenital heart defects.
title: Mixed ancestry analysis of whole-genome sequencing reveals common, rare, and structural variants associated with posterior urethral valves

finding: The SNP rs6538618 was associated with the expression of both VEZT and FGD6 in endometrium and was highlighted as overlapping ten biofeatures in the putative bidirectional promoter associated with these genes. This SNP was part of the VEZT locus which was noted for its role in the shared risk for both endometriosis and epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC).
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The SNP rs7309252, identified at the VEZT locus, was in strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs6538618 (r²=0.99). The functional evidence highlighted its role in regulating the expression of the nearby genes VEZT and FGD6, which have been associated with endometriosis risk.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: This SNP was associated with status epilepticus and was also exclusively identified in individuals of Asian ancestry, making it significant in the context of epilepsy research for that demographic.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: This synonymous variant in the gene BRAP was identified as an Asian-exclusive variant. It has been associated with various conditions and deserved further exploration in the context of epilepsy.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: The GG haplotype of variant rs11171806 showed a protective effect against type 1 diabetes, confirming its relevance in the context of autoimmune diseases.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: Evidence indicated that rs2066808, in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs11171806, also provided a protective association with type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: In the study, rs2306547 showed variation in effect allele frequency (EAF) specifically in the MBRC cohort, indicating its relevance to birth weight assessments among South Asian populations compared to European counterparts. The study highlighted its importance within the context of fetal genetic score calculations affecting birth weight.
title: Associations of genetic scores for birth weight with newborn size and later Anthropometric traits and cardiometabolic risk markers in South Asians

finding: The previously noted variant rs7964859 within GNPTAB was associated with aspartate, corroborating earlier findings relating it to metabolite levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs12310399 located in the FGD6 gene was identified as a previously unknown risk locus for ruptured intracranial aneurysms (rIA). It reached genome-wide significance with a p-value of 3.19×10^−10 and an odds ratio of 1.16. Furthermore, rs12310399 was found to cause decreased FGD6 gene expression in arterial tissue, which highlights its potential role in increasing the risk for rIA.
title: Integrative genomics analysis implicates decreased FGD6 expression underlying risk of intracranial aneurysm rupture

finding: As an intronic variant within CNTN1, rs1442190 was associated with dementia but also explored for its potential contributions to PD, emphasizing its genetic relevance.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: The SNP rs10735079 was linked to less severe disease through haplotypes in the OAS1, OAS2, and OAS3 genes, although its protective effect was significantly less than that conferred by chromosome 3 loci.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The rs118078722 SNP was associated with endometriosis, with a significant p-value of 1.39E-08. This SNP was also recognized in the EUR meta-analysis, corroborating its significance in multiple ancestries.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The rs12581759 SNP at 12q24.32 was significantly associated with endometriosis, with a p-value of 2.64E-08. This finding adds to the existing loci associated with narrow phenotype definitions in the disease.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The study found that the missense variant rs59502379 (c.1463G>T, OATP1B1-Gly488Ala) was associated with an increased risk of statin-induced myopathy with an odds ratio of 2.45 (95% CI 1.04-5.78, P=0.04) specifically among Black participants. This finding highlighted the relevance of Afrocentric variants in the context of statin therapy.
title: SLCO1B1 functional variants and statin-induced myopathy in people with recent genealogical ancestors from Africa: a population-based real-world study

finding: The splice variant rs77271279 (c.481+1G>T) was identified as being significantly related to an increased risk of statin-induced myopathy with an odds ratio of 3.27 (95% CI 1.43-7.46, P=0.005) in Black participants. This variant was part of the analysis due to its functional impact on the OATP1B1 gene and its greater prevalence in the African superpopulation.
title: SLCO1B1 functional variants and statin-induced myopathy in people with recent genealogical ancestors from Africa: a population-based real-world study

finding: This SNP was included in the credible sets linked to alcohol intake, suggesting a significant contribution to the trait's genetic architecture.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: Like rs141043717, rs61055528 was also part of the credible sets for alcohol intake, reflecting its potential relevance to alcohol metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: Rs149178839 appeared in the credible sets associated with alcohol intake, contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on this trait.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: This SNP was part of the credible sets for alcohol intake, highlighting its significance in the genetic basis of the trait.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The study found that variations in the TPH2 gene, specifically the SNP rs4570625, influenced susceptibility to behavioral and neural dysregulations in response to acute tryptophan depletion (ATD). The GG carriers exhibited increased subjective anxious arousal and reduced ventromedial prefrontal cortex (vmPFC) reactivity towards threat-related stimuli during ATD compared to TT carriers. This highlighted that genetic variations in TPH2 rendered individuals susceptible to the anxiogenic effects of transient decreases in serotonin signaling.
title: A central serotonin regulating gene polymorphism (TPH2) determines vulnerability to acute tryptophan depletion-induced anxiety and ventromedial prefrontal threat reactivity

finding: SNP rs551123675, located in externalizing-specific regions associated with CT and in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs114949000, showed a striking association relevant to ADHD as documented in the literature.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The variant rs114949000, associated with externalizing-specific cortical thickness, presented evidence for being related to ADHD and showed a strong association with a p-value of 7.85×10^-9.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The SNP rs34673751 was associated with butyrylcarnitine levels, demonstrating that individuals carrying the A allele exhibited stable higher blood levels of this metabolite. This variant was found to be significant during a meta-GWAS analysis, indicating its strong genetic influence on fatty acid metabolism, specifically through the ACADS gene which encodes the enzyme responsible for short-chain fatty acid beta-oxidation.
title: Longitudinal analysis of genetic and environmental interplay in human metabolic profiles and the implication for metabolic health

finding: The SNP rs7970695 in the HNF1A locus exhibited a significant association with hs-CRP levels, with a P-value of 2.32e-29. This finding implied that HNF1A genetic differences might influence inflammation.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The study identified rs7294478 as a female-biased tag eSNP located in an intron of C1RL-AS1 on chromosome 12. The differential GR-response eQTL effect was observed only in females with respect to TAPBPL expression, which is located over 700 kb downstream. The major allele of this SNP was associated with higher expression following dexamethasone administration in females, contrasting with the opposite effect in males. This SNP was linked to significant gene expression regulation in females, suggesting its role in stress response and potential implication in psychiatric disorders.
title: Autosomal sex-biased genetic regulation of the stress response

finding: The SNP rs934891 was analyzed for its influence on gene expression, showing a significant effect in females with an FDR of 0.049 indicative of its involvement in the transcriptional response following GR stimulation. This finding suggests that rs934891 could be pivotal in understanding sex-based differences in gene expression related to stress responses.
title: Autosomal sex-biased genetic regulation of the stress response

finding: The rs267607448 variant in the KRT5 gene, associated with Epidermolysis Bullosa, was prevalent in the Qatari population with a MAF of 0.007, underscoring the genetic susceptibility to skin disorders within this group.
title: Qatar Genome: Insights on Genomics from the Middle East

finding: The SNP rs4767027 was associated with increased OAS1 levels, showing a strong protective effect against COVID-19 outcomes. Specifically, each standard deviation increase in OAS1 levels was linked to a reduced odds of COVID-19 death or ventilation (OR = 0.54, P = 7×10^-8), hospitalization (OR = 0.61, P = 8×10^-8), and susceptibility (OR = 0.78, P = 8×10^-6). Insights also indicated that this SNP's effects were due to a Neanderthal isoform and that it was not associated with other phenotypes beyond OAS1 levels.
title: A Neanderthal OAS1 isoform Protects Against COVID-19 Susceptibility and Severity: Results from Mendelian Randomization and Case-Control Studies

finding: The SNP rs10774671 was recognized as a splicing QTL (sQTL) that influences the expression of different OAS1 isoforms. The G allele, associated with increased expression of the p46 isoform known for its higher enzymatic activity against viruses, was linked to protective effects against severe COVID-19 outcomes. This SNP's protective alleles were found to be in a Neandertal haplotype.
title: A Neanderthal OAS1 isoform Protects Against COVID-19 Susceptibility and Severity: Results from Mendelian Randomization and Case-Control Studies

finding: A significant association was found between ADAM-12 levels at visit 2 and the locus on chromosome 12p13.31, specifically with SNP rs6487735 located near the PZP gene. The association was strong, indicated by a P-value of 3.03×10^-22, suggesting that this SNP influenced ADAM-12 protein levels during pregnancy.
title: Genetic Associations with Dynamic Placental Proteins Identify Causal Biomarkers for Hypertension in Pregnancy

finding: The missense SNP rs2277413, which is located within the PZP gene, was independently associated with ADAM-12 levels at visit 2. It showed a significant P-value of 3.32×10^-11 and suggested that genetic variation within the PZP gene may affect ADAM-12 levels during pregnancy.
title: Genetic Associations with Dynamic Placental Proteins Identify Causal Biomarkers for Hypertension in Pregnancy

finding: In the GWAS of ADAM-12 at visit 1, the SNP rs4316551 was identified as significantly associated with ADAM-12 levels with a P-value of 6.76×10^-9. This SNP was in moderate linkage disequilibrium with rs6487735, indicating a possible shared genetic influence on ADAM-12 levels as pregnancy progressed.
title: Genetic Associations with Dynamic Placental Proteins Identify Causal Biomarkers for Hypertension in Pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs3184504, associated with SH2B3, was linked to immune function in preeclampsia. This lead variant exhibited a strong linkage disequilibrium with the coronary artery disease risk allele, and was associated with variations in leukocyte counts and immune-related proteins. Additionally, reduced SH2B3 function could promote immune processes that are implicated in preeclampsia pathogenesis.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis identifies novel maternal risk variants and enables polygenic prediction of preeclampsia and gestational hypertension

finding: Higher genetically-predicted expression of PDE3A was positively associated with coronary heart disease (CHD), with a significance level of P=2.25×10^-7, using the colocalizing eQTL instrumental variant (rs7488772) in subcutaneous adipose tissue.
title: Transcriptome- and proteome-wide Mendelian randomization to prioritize therapeutic targets for coronary heart disease

finding: The SNP rs28659953 found a new independent signal within a known locus, RILPL1. This SNP is significant as it interacted with LRRK2-phosphorylated Rab10, suggesting its role in PD pathogenesis.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The l-ARMSS analysis in males identified rs7315384, intronic to STAB2, as the top hit with a beta of 1.04 (p=1.29×10^-7). However, it was not significant in the l-MSSS analysis.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: This variant had a strong association with GFATadjBMI (P = 5.6 x 10^-29), influencing multiple gene expressions affecting fat distribution.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs10877425 was associated with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), showing genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.14×10^-10. It was part of the meta-analysis which identified 15 independent loci for OCD, highlighting its relevance.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies new loci associated with OCD

finding: The association of this SNP with the AF-related heart failure subtype points to its involvement in the pathology of atrial fibrillation, corresponding to the ATXN2 gene region.
title: Identifying subtypes of heart failure with machine learning: external, prognostic and genetic validation in three electronic health record sources with 320,863 individuals

finding: At 12q14.3, the rs10878269 variant indicated substantial genetic links to resting fMRI traits, correlated with various sleep conditions.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs28576953 located at 12q24.31 was found in association with cerebellar vermal lobules, showing genetic connectivity with sleep traits.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Found at 22q31.1, rs61921611 was linked with total brain volume in relation to sleep conditions.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12310519 was determined to be a relatively predominant factor influencing the negative causal relationship between chronic back pain and physical activity. The MR analysis indicated that participants with CBP, influenced by this SNP, claimed to engage in approximately 146 MET-minutes/week less physical activity compared to controls. The finding emphasized its significant role in the reduction of physical activity associated with CBP.
title: Investigating the causal relationship between physical activity and chronic back pain: a bidirectional two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs3782886, belonging to BRAP, was reported as a significant variant associated with PAU in the EAS meta-analysis, indicating its importance in understanding the genetic factors of PAU.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The missense variant rs1169288 in the HNF1A gene was associated with an increased risk of type-2 diabetes (GWAS β=0.04) and decreased levels of circulating ACE2 (GWAS β=-0.16). This suggested that the genetic instrument for ACE2 decreased the risk of type-2 diabetes, while type-2 diabetes itself increased ACE2 levels.
title: Circulating cardiovascular proteomic associations with genetics and disease

finding: The upstream variant rs114578532 of FGF6 passed the genome-wide significance threshold in the marginal test with a p-value of 2.18×10−8. However, it was not significant in the joint test and did not appear in prior T2D GWAS studies.
title: Summary statistics from large-scale gene-environment interaction studies for re-analysis and meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs78994068 was identified as part of a putative novel locus at 12q23 driving lung cancer risk in African ancestry. It had an odds ratio close to 2 and resulted in regulatory changes in long non-coding RNAs, though it was not significant in the replication cohort.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: The low-frequency missense variant rs61937878 in the histidine ammonia lyase (HAL) gene was significantly associated with 2 out of 56 selected metabolites, specifically histidine and glycine, with a notably strong association with histidine due to HAL’s enzymatic activity.
title: Genome-wide association study for circulating metabolites in 619,372 individuals

finding: Similar to rs117137535, this SNP was previously associated with AD in Europeans and was noted to be just below the genome-wide significance in the present study's European-only analysis.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP was substantially linked with early-differentiated CD4+ T cells, showing shared genetic bases between immune cell distributions and long COVID.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: It was significantly associated with NK mature NKG2A+ cells and showed an inverse relationship with NK mature NKG2C+ cells, suggesting complex regulatory mechanisms within immune cell types.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: This SNP had an independent significant association with NK immature NKG2C+ cells, indicating its relevance in NK cell development.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: The SNP rs7956202 was identified as the most strongly associated variant with age at onset of walking, located near the HECTD4 gene, with a p-value of 2.045 x 10^-11. This variant had been previously associated with reaction time and variants in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with this SNP were shown to be linked to physical traits such as diastolic blood pressure and hip circumference adjusted for BMI.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis of age at onset of walking

finding: The SNP rs2599400, associated with the gene TAS2R31, displayed opposing effects across populations, highlighting population-specific variations in gene expression regulation and their influence on phenotypes such as sensitivity to bitter taste.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: The eSNP chr12:123306558:G:A was associated with VPS37B and showed higher allele frequency in the EAS (MAF=0.24) compared to the EUR population (MAF=0.04), indicating that allele frequency differences between populations contributed to the observed discrepancies in GWAS and eQTL results.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: The SNP rs11066001, also located in the BRAP gene alongside rs3782886, showed associations with generalized genetic epilepsy (GGE). This finding emphasized the potential role of ubiquitin ligase protein variations in the development of epilepsy.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: The SNP rs11832738 in the CACNA1C gene was found to influence depression severity by modulating spontaneous activity in the right middle frontal gyrus in patients with major depressive disorder. This finding relates to how genetic variations could affect neural activity linked to reward circuitry, which is essential in understanding treatment outcomes in conditions like treatment-resistant depression (TRD).
title: Reward circuit function and treatment outcome following vALIC deep brain stimulation in treatment-resistant depression

finding: The rs4149056 SNP, known as SLCO1B1*5 (C allele), was associated with significantly higher plasma levels of simvastatin and atorvastatin, increasing the likelihood of elevated total cholesterol levels and treatment discontinuation. Specifically, 48.4% of females homozygous for the SLCO1B1*5 genotype had raised cholesterol (>5 mmol/L), compared to 41.7% in individuals with normal SLCO1B1 function, yielding an odds ratio of 1.31 (p=0.001). Furthermore, females with the SLCO1B1*5 genotype were more likely to stop statin treatment, with a hazard ratio for discontinuation of 1.19 (p=0.01), particularly notable after the first year of treatment.
title: Statin treatment effectiveness and the SLCO1B1*5 reduced function genotype: long-term outcomes in women and men

finding: The SNP chr12:11292383:A:G, located in the OAS1 gene, reached genome-wide significance in males for COVID-19 hospitalization, further supporting the genetic underpinnings of severity in this cohort.
title: A genome-wide association study of COVID-19 related hospitalization in Spain reveals genetic disparities among sexes

finding: The rs4149056 SNP in the SLCO1B1 gene was previously associated with statin-related myopathy (SRM), particularly for patients treated with simvastatin at high doses. A notable study published in 2008 reported an increased risk for myopathy in CC homozygotes compared to TT homozygotes, with an odds ratio of 16.9. This finding suggested that the CC genotype was significantly more likely to experience muscle-related adverse reactions to statin therapy. Furthermore, other studies, including a replication by Link et al. in the Heart Protection Study, supported this association, demonstrating a correlation between the presence of the C allele and an increased risk of myopathy. However, in the analyzed retrospective study of 1136 statin users, the authors could not confirm an association between the rs4149056 genotype and changes in statin therapy or achieving a stable dose sooner in primary care.
title: Predictive value of SLCO1B1 c.521T>C polymorphism on observed changes in the treatment of 1136 statin-users

finding: SNP rs2887022 was identified as a candidate causal SNP for the association between BC and COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs12304921 was reported with a significant association at p=5.05×10^-21, linked to the DMT1 gene, which is expressed in the gut and previously associated with microcytic anemia with iron overload.
title: Polygenic architecture of a novel MRI endophenotype: the “hemochromatosis brain”

finding: Associated with short sleep, this variant was the only one tested for DEC2/BHLHE4 and had a BinomiRare mid-p-value of 0.03, suggesting a connection to short sleep in the studied population.
title: BinomiRare: A carriers-only test for association of rare genetic variants with a binary outcome for mixed models and any case-control proportion

finding: Variant rs11568820 was significantly associated with prostate cancer risk among White men (OR=1.04, P=0.00024) and demonstrated suggestive evidence of association in Black men, with a notable difference in allele frequency (0.79 in African vs. 0.20 in European ancestry). Therefore, its influence on prostate cancer risk was highlighted as a significant variant.
title: Variants in Vitamin D-related Genes and Prostate Cancer Risk in Black Men

finding: The SNP rs12146713 was found associated with endophenotype T2:67, where its previous associations included thalamus volume and white matter microstructure. Its links to traits such as cortical thickness and subcortical structure volume echoed its significance in brain morphology studies.
title: New phenotype discovery method by unsupervised deep representation learning empowers genetic association studies of brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs117321479 was found to be associated with the gene SOX5, known for its high pleiotropic effects on various psychiatric disorders. It was linked to hoarding symptoms, among others, and involved in a wide range of phenotypes including schizophrenia, autism spectrum disorder, and neuroticism.
title: Meta-Analysis of Genome-Wide Association Studies of Hoarding Symptoms in 27 537 Individuals

finding: The rs10735079 polymorphism was linked to antiviral activity and demonstrated a frequency pattern in Indians suggesting reduced risk for severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The study found that the LTA4H regulatory variant rs2660845 was significantly associated with an increased risk of asthma exacerbations in European individuals with early-onset asthma (<18 years). Specifically, G allele carriers had 3.27 times the odds of experiencing an exacerbation while under montelukast treatment compared to patients with the AA genotype. This association was validated through a meta-analysis of cohorts that showed no significant association in late-onset individuals but highlighted the relevance of the SNP in young patients, supporting a precision medicine approach for asthma treatment.
title: LTA4H association with montelukast response in early and late-onset asthma

finding: The rs11064881 variant was significantly associated with mtDNA-CN (p=2.6×10^-10) within the PRKAB1 gene, suggesting a role in mitochondrial function.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The SNP rs17178006 on chromosome 12 was previously reported as significantly associated with amygdala volume and spanned an intronic region linked to several psychiatric phenotypes, including cognitive performance and bipolar disorder.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Amygdala Nuclei

finding: The SNP rs7138803 was found to be consistently significant in association with PCOS through its overlap with various obesity measures, particularly WC and HC.
title: Both general- and central- obesity are causally associated with polycystic ovarian syndrome: Findings of a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs653178 SNP showed the strongest signal in the GWAS for both energy (P=1.3×10^-106) and run-length non-uniformity (P=9.2×10^-72), demonstrating a significant genetic overlap with these radiomics features. It was noted to be associated with systolic and diastolic blood pressure.
title: Deep learning-derived splenic radiomics, genomics, and coronary artery disease

finding: The rare SNP rs532342679 near NEDD1 was found to have a significant effect size on AF liability, indicating its potential role in AF but noted that the association was not at genome-wide significance.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: The SNP rs35281060 was identified as one of the significant independent signals after a stepwise conditional analysis in a meta-analysis of OPLL, achieving genome-wide significance with a P value of 1.44×10−12.
title: Genetic insights into ossification of the posterior longitudinal ligament of the spine

finding: The SNP rs1038666 reached genome-wide significance with a P value of 5.00×10−10 and was identified as an independent signal in the meta-analysis of OPLL.
title: Genetic insights into ossification of the posterior longitudinal ligament of the spine

finding: The SNP rs61915977 was detected as an additional signal that reached locus-wide significance with a P value of 1.39×10−6, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors related to OPLL.
title: Genetic insights into ossification of the posterior longitudinal ligament of the spine

finding: The variant rs7310615 was associated with 38 traits in the European population, underscoring its potential pleiotropic effects.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs9651832 was identified as a shared variant associated with both kyphosis and lordosis, indicating its involvement in the genetic risk factors for increased spinal curvature.
title: Aging of the Spine: Characterizing genetic and physiological determinants of spinal curvature

finding: The SNP rs10846742, shown to be significantly associated with beta-sitosterol levels after meta-analysis, reinforced prior findings on the role of SCARB1 in lipid metabolism, further enhancing its relevance compared to earlier studies.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: This SNP, rs7485656, was also significantly associated with beta-sitosterol levels as revealed in the meta-analysis, indicating a pertinent role in the trait beyond previous reports.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: The SNP rs112403212 reached significance in the context of the beta-sitosterol trait, underscoring the importance of SCARB1 in lipid metabolism within this study's findings.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: The SNP rs4590952 was located in a crucial position of a functional p53 regulatory element in the KITLG gene, which is approximately known to be associated with pro-survival p53 target genes. This SNP was identified in one of the strongest cancer genome-wide association studies (GWAS), demonstrating its influence on p53 regulation of transcription and its correlation with cancer susceptibility.
title: A novel map of human p53 response elements uncovers evidence of selection pressures and variants similar to Li-Fraumeni Syndrome mutations

finding: The SNP rs7132910 was identified as being associated with multiple shape features of the hippocampus, particularly the subiculum subfield, and served as an eQTL for the gene TESC in human brain tissues.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: This SNP was identified as an ultra-rare association signal for diastolic blood pressure (DBP) within the FGD4 gene. It had an allele frequency of 9.31 × 10−6. Although common variants in FGD4 had previously been reported to be associated with hypertension, rs757561770 is an intronic variant and demonstrated low linkage disequilibrium (LD) with coding variants, which suggests its unique contribution to the trait.
title: A Genomics England haplotype reference panel and the imputation of the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was linked to SYT10 and ALG10, highlighting its role in the genetic analysis of low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: This SNP associated with CHST11 was part of the novel loci findings related to low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: Tagging CHFR, LOC101928530, and ZNF605, this SNP was among those linked to low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The variant rs17098087 located at 12q14 in African-American participants was associated with increased blood NfL levels (P = 2.59x10-9), contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on neurodegenerative processes in this ancestry group.
title: Genome-wide Association Study Meta-analysis of Neurofilament light (NfL) levels in blood reveals novel loci related to neurodegeneration

finding: The rs73423978 variant present at 12q21 was associated with increased NfL levels (P = 3.50x10-8). This result aligned with findings from the African-American ancestry indicating genetic variants that impact neurodegeneration.
title: Genome-wide Association Study Meta-analysis of Neurofilament light (NfL) levels in blood reveals novel loci related to neurodegeneration

finding: The SNP rs3184504 was previously associated with multiple traits, including cardiovascular disease (CVD), leukocyte count, hypothyroidism, smoking status, diastolic blood pressure, and coronary artery disease. It had a positive association with the identified CpGs.
title: Epigenome-wide association study of self-reported antidepressant use in Generation Scotland implicates the innate immune system

finding: The SNP rs10774624 was associated with various traits including eosinophil count, vitiligo, systolic blood pressure, and intraocular pressure measurement, while also being related to RA.
title: Epigenome-wide association study of self-reported antidepressant use in Generation Scotland implicates the innate immune system

finding: The SNP rs10507274, part of the MED13L gene cluster, was recognized as a male-specific locus linked to lower neuroticism scores. It met genome-wide significance criteria in the male demographic.
title: Sex-specific genetic and transcriptomic liability to neuroticism

finding: This SNP was identified as significantly associated with both the rapid symptom progression subtype (Subtype III) and the mild progression subtype (Subtype I) of PD.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: Association with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I) of PD was noted for this SNP.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs2269899 located at locus 12q24.13 was deemed significantly associated with hospitalized COVID-19 with a p-value of 3.24×10⁻⁸, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing severe disease.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: The rs113247976 variant was identified as a low-frequency coding variant (p.P986L) in KIF5A, one of the known ALS risk genes, indicating its potential causative role in ALS.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: This SNP in the TBK1 locus was found to have both common and rare variants contributing to ALS risk with similar eQTL and mQTL mediated effects observed.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The splice variant rs10774671 in the OAS1 gene was shown to confer protection against severe COVID-19 across different ancestries, including African ancestry. This protective effect was comparable in strength to that observed in European populations, despite the G allele being less common in Europeans. Specifically, the G allele was associated with an odds ratio for hospitalization (OR = 0.92) indicating reduced severity, compared to an OR of 0.89 in individuals of European ancestry. This finding was independent of other variants co-segregating in non-African populations, highlighting the splice variant's role as a causal factor distinct from Neanderthal haplotypes, which are rare among Africans.
title: Alternative splicing of OAS1 alters the risk for severe COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs3184504, mapped to the SH2B3 gene, was found to have strong evidence of colocalization between 19 blood cell traits (BCTs) and cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) such as coronary artery disease (CAD) and venous thromboembolism (VTE), with a posterior probability greater than 0.7.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The SNP rs4378452, located in the CUX2 gene, was identified as a potential common causal variant associated with 22 BCTs and CAD.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: Significant vQTLs associated with blood cell trait variance were identified for rs191673261, which was located proximal to the gene ALDH2, known for its role in alcohol consumption. This SNP was implicated in the variance of platelet crit (pct) as part of its association with alcohol-related phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide analyses of variance in blood cell phenotypes provide new insights into complex trait biology and prediction

finding: The lead vQTL rs572454376 was noted to be in linkage disequilibrium with rs191673261 and contributed to the characterization of blood cell trait variance in relation to alcohol consumption.
title: Genome-wide analyses of variance in blood cell phenotypes provide new insights into complex trait biology and prediction

finding: This SNP showed an increase in allele frequency positively correlated with reading ability and was associated with various health traits, indicating a broad relevance.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: The SNP rs7978610 at the ZNF664 locus was highlighted as a significant marker associated with adiponectin levels and confirmed as a positive finding through the multi-ancestry meta-analysis.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The SNP rs11045172 was nominated as a putative causal variant associated with adiponectin levels, noted from analyses focusing on lead variants.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The SNP rs11057401, associated with the CCDC92 gene, was linked to an increased risk of coronary heart disease (CHD) as identified in the literature by Xiao et al. in 2018. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic risk factors for CHD, supporting the relevance of this SNP in the clinical outcomes associated with heart diseases.
title: Direct causal variable discovery leveraging the invariance principle: application in biomedical studies

finding: The SNP rs6487213, a variant of the SLCO1B1 gene, was identified as a suspected allelic variation linked to chronic Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI). In the analysis, it was revealed that this SNP was part of the gene-gene interactions identified using the MARS method, which was effective in revealing candidate SNPs associated with chronic DILI. The SLCO1B1 gene encodes for a protein involved in the transport of compounds like bilirubin into the liver, and elevated serum bilirubin levels are a known risk factor for chronic DILI.
title: Genetic Connection to Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI) Through Statistical Learning Methods

finding: The variant rs1351394, located in the gene HMGA2 at loci 12q14.3, was associated with variations in FEV1 capacity and had a PICS value of 0.7243, indicating high likelihood of being causal.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: This SNP was part of the evaluation of allelic imbalances on chromosome 3p during the analysis of uveal melanoma samples. The study confirmed that rs1602633 contributed to the effectiveness of detecting copy number alterations.
title: Allele-specific digital PCR enhances precision and sensitivity in the detection and quantification of copy number alterations in heterogeneous DNA samples: an in silico and in vitro validation study

finding: The SNP rs34637584, which is located in the LRRK2 gene, was previously studied for its impact on the penetrance of damaging variants. Research indicated that individuals carrying variants such as LRRK2 p-G2019S exhibited altered risk profiles for Parkinson's disease, especially when assessed alongside polygenic risk scores. While this particular SNP was noted in the context of penetrating the effects of monogenic variants, the detailed direct implications of rs34637584 were emphasized in terms of its relationship with PRS, reflecting its role in heightening disease susceptibility.
title: Assessing the role of polygenic background on the penetrance of monogenic forms in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The intronic variant rs12146713 in NUAK1 was identified as a significant SNP in multiple brain structures, and it also had connections to various brain morphology traits linked to structural connectivity.
title: Beyond Volume: Unraveling the Genetics of Human Brain Geometry

finding: The study found that individuals with alcohol dependence and cirrhosis (AUDC+ve) exhibited significantly lower DNA methylation levels at the ALDH2 locus (mean methylation of 3.8±0.8) compared to those without cirrhosis (AUDC-ve) who had a mean of 5.1±1.9 (P < 0.001). Furthermore, T-allele carriers in the AUDC+ve group demonstrated lower methylation levels (3.5±0.7) compared to T-allele non-carriers (4.0±0.8), with a significance of P=0.01. This finding suggested a potential biomarker role for compromised methylation in the context of alcohol-related liver disease.
title: Genetics and Epigenetics of Aldehyde Dehydrogenase (ALDH2) in Alcohol Related Liver Disease

finding: The SNP rs34637584, located in the <italic>LRRK2</italic> gene, was identified as a common causal mutation associated with Parkinson's disease, particularly in G2019S-carriers. It accounted for about 2% of all Parkinson's disease cases and showed a higher prevalence in specific populations such as Ashkenazi Jews (approximately 20%) and Arab-Berbers (approximately 40%). The study indicated a significant association between this SNP and the risk of developing Parkinson's disease, with varying penetrance linked to age, illustrating that G2019S-carriers have a variable age-at-onset ranging from 50 to 80 years.
title: Epigenetic clock acceleration is linked to age-at-onset of idiopathic and LRRK2 Parkinson’s disease

finding: The variant rs2657879 in GLS2 was associated with a strong positive effect of maternal circulating glutamine on offspring birthweight.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The SNP rs17602430 in SLC38A2 was positively associated, suggesting a role in the transport of maternal amino acids to the fetus.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The East Asian-specific intronic variant rs4646776 was associated with gout, exhibiting a stronger effect in males than in females (in females AF = 20.4%, effect size (se) = -0.10 (0.056), p-value = 0.07; in males AF=24.2%, effect size (se) = -0.29(0.023), p-value = 2.5×10^-36). This association was attributed to higher consumption of alcohol in males among individuals of East Asian ancestries.
title: Global Biobank Meta-analysis Initiative: powering genetic discovery across human diseases

finding: The SNP rs10841302, located near the AEBP2 gene, was positively associated with impaired lung function measures, specifically FEV1/FVC. The G allele was linked to greater susceptibility to the negative effects of PM2.5 exposure, whereby higher allele copies correlated with a more pronounced reduction in FEV1/FVC as PM2.5 levels increased.
title: Genome-wide gene-air pollution interaction analysis of lung function in 300,000 individuals

finding: The rs2080403 SNP associated with 3-aminoisobutyrate and was a strong eQTL for SLC6A13, indicating an original finding related to kidney function.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: The A allele of this tagging polymorphism was linked to increased grade ≥2 adverse events during treatment.
title: Pharmacogenetics of tuberculosis treatment toxicity and effectiveness in a large Brazilian cohort

finding: The C allele linked to increased treatment failure/recurrence but did not previously correlate with anti-tuberculosis medications.
title: Pharmacogenetics of tuberculosis treatment toxicity and effectiveness in a large Brazilian cohort

finding: Variant rs10774671 was confirmed with a statistically significant difference in AF (p-value=0.0035) between COVID-19 patients and the general population, indicating its association with severe disease.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: Variant rs2660 was part of the seven variants showing significant AF differences (p-value=0.007) in the context of COVID-19 severity, confirming its previously reported association.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: Variant rs1293767 exhibited a significant difference in AF (p-value=0.00501) when comparing COVID-19 patients to the general population in this study, aligning with previous findings.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: Variant rs1859330 was confirmed with a significant difference in allele frequency (p-value=2.9E-05) in COVID-19 patients, supporting its association with the disease.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: This low-frequency allele was found to be protective for type 2 diabetes risk while also being associated with lower glycemic markers, signifying its relevance in metabolic outcomes.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The SNP rs3782886 in BRAP was associated with FEV1, showing a significant parameter of P=4.20x10^-8 and a beta of 0.0219, suggesting a role in lung function. Prior associations included height and various traits such as alcohol use disorder, high-density lipoprotein, and type 2 diabetes.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: The rs7487637 SNP at the HDAC7 locus on chr.12q13.11 was associated with higher IgA levels (Beta=0.05, P=9.97×10^-15), implicating it in T-cell regulation and function.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: Identified as one of the significant CAD variants associated with incident CVD in people with T2D, thus contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on cardiovascular outcomes.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: The SNP rs3751262 was reported as a non-synonymous variant associated with POP. It was linked in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the lead signals and exhibited an effect size (p=2.89 × 10^-7) with a high coefficient of determination (r2=0.70), indicating its relevance in the genetic analysis of connective tissue abnormalities associated with POP.
title: Advancing our understanding of genetic risk factors and potential personalized strategies in pelvic organ prolapse: largest GWAS to date reveals 19 novel associated loci

finding: The SNP rs3184504 was identified as an outlier in MR-PRESSO, but its exclusion did not distort the estimate for the association between genetically determined birth weight and latent autoimmune diabetes in adults (LADA). The outlier-corrected odds ratio (OR) was 1.83 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 1.29-2.59. This finding supported the inverse association between lower birth weight and LADA.
title: Birth weight, BMI in adulthood and latent autoimmune diabetes in adults: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs11066188 was one of the two outliers detected by MR-PRESSO during the analysis. Despite being excluded from the analyses, it did not distort the overall association results. The association between lower birth weight and a higher risk of LADA remained consistent, as seen by robust results from different MR estimators after its exclusion.
title: Birth weight, BMI in adulthood and latent autoimmune diabetes in adults: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: FAIM2 variant rs7132908 was also associated with increasing BMI following the adiposity rebound period.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: Located in the P2RX7 locus, rs1718119 is a coding variant (Ala348Thr) in high linkage disequilibrium with the lead SNP rs1626329, suggesting a potential impact on liver metabolism and association with cALT.
title: A trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of unexplained chronic ALT elevation as a proxy for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease with histological and radiological validation

finding: This variant was identified in the HNF1A locus (Ile27Leu) and was shown to be in high linkage disequilibrium with the lead SNP (rs1169292), supporting its role in liver function and disease risk.
title: A trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of unexplained chronic ALT elevation as a proxy for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease with histological and radiological validation

finding: The missense variant rs113791087 in the PTPRB gene was associated with an increased risk of central serous chorioretinopathy (CSC), with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.85 (P = 4.5 x 10^-9). This association was confirmed in a meta-analysis involving 2,452 CSC patients and 865,767 controls, yielding an OR of 3.06 (P = 7.4 x 10^-15). Moreover, rs113791087 was associated with a higher prevalence of retinal abnormalities (35.3% in carriers vs 22.6% in non-carriers, P = 8.0 x 10^-4), varicose veins (OR = 1.31, P = 2.3 x 10^-11), and a reduced risk of glaucoma (OR = 0.82, P = 6.9 x 10^-9).
title: Rare genetic variation in VE-PTP is associated with central serous chorioretinopathy, venous dysfunction and glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs10774671 was reported as an alternative splicing QTL affecting exon 7 of the OAS1 gene, with the G allele leading to a more active enzyme, which was found to have causal implications for COVID-19 severity.
title: Whole Genome DNA and RNA Sequencing of Whole Blood Elucidates the Genetic Architecture of Gene Expression Underlying a Wide Range of Diseases

finding: This SNP was identified as the most strongly associated with pain genome-wide, with a P-value of 6.9e-72. The alternate allele was linked to increased pain risk and was associated with decreased expression of LRP1. The analysis suggested that the increase in pain associated with this SNP may be mediated by decreased pulmonary function, implicating inflammatory processes.
title: GWAS meta-analysis reveals dual neuronal and immunological etiology for pain susceptibility

finding: The rs2657879 variant was the influential variant identified for the ratio of histidine to glutamine in relation to Alzheimer's disease. While glutamine exhibited a nominally significant negative causal effect on Alzheimer's disease, this SNP indicated an effect in the opposite direction when considering the histidine-to-glutamine ratio.
title: Evaluating metabolome-wide causal effects on risk for psychiatric and neurodegenerative disorders

finding: The variant rs14024 in the KRT1 gene also correlated with dermatophytosis, having a p-value of 3.95×10−15 and beta = -0.030, indicating its relevance in skin health.
title: The genetic basis of dermatophytosis skin infection susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs28577594 was associated with the isoform ENST00000537270 of KMT5A and displayed a strong isoQTL signal suggesting a protective effect against schizophrenia risk, despite no significant eQTL detection, again highlighting the importance of isoform-level analysis.
