title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: <italic>LRRK2</italic> rs76904798 was shown to significantly predict higher derived total recall T-scores, indicating its influence on cognitive function in a gender-dependent manner.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs11170516, identified by Chen et al., was associated with moderate-severe hypospadias. This association provided insight into the genetic factors contributing to the severity of hypospadias, amidst other genetic contributions that remain largely unexplained.
title: Whole-exome Sequencing Study of Hypospadias

finding: The VDR rs7975232 CC genotype was independently associated with an asymptomatic phenotype among patients with cerebral cavernous malformation (CCM). The study indicated that patients harboring this genotype had decreased levels of proinflammatory cytokines, implying a possible protective role.
title: Genetic Markers and Predictive Factors Influencing the Aggressive Behavior of Cerebral Cavernous Malformation

finding: The VDR rs731236 AA genotype was correlated with a later onset of symptoms in CCM patients, suggesting that those carrying this genotype tended to develop symptoms later in life compared to those without the genotype.
title: Genetic Markers and Predictive Factors Influencing the Aggressive Behavior of Cerebral Cavernous Malformation

finding: The VDR rs11568820 CC genotype was associated with an earlier onset of symptoms in CCM patients, indicating that genetic variation at this locus potentially influenced symptom precocity.
title: Genetic Markers and Predictive Factors Influencing the Aggressive Behavior of Cerebral Cavernous Malformation

finding: The LRRK2 variant rs34637584 (p.G2019S) was associated with a reduced risk for PD+RBD, showing an OR of 0.41 (95% CI=0.28-0.61, p=1.04E-5). This finding emphasized the role of the LRRK2 locus in influencing the pathology of REM sleep behavior disorder within the framework of Parkinson’s disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of REM sleep behavior disorder in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs17442721, which was protective against developing dementia (OR = 0.43, 95% CI = 0.32 - 0.57, P = 1.44e-08), was associated with the noncoding RNA LINC02555. Further analysis indicated that it tags LRRK2 G2019S, confirming no independent association with dementia when stratified by G2019S status.
title: Investigation of the genetic aetiology of Lewy body diseases with and without dementia

finding: The SNP rs2242367 was associated with more rapid mortality in Parkinson's disease (HR=1.13 [95% CI 1.04 to 1.21], p=0.002). This SNP had previously been identified in the context of Progressive Supranuclear Palsy (PSP) survival.
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and clinical progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs10437796 near SYT10 was nominally protective against Parkinson's disease deaths (HR=0.71, p=0.05) but increased non-Parkinson's deaths (HR=1.50, p=1.8×10^-4). This locus influenced SYT10 expression.
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and clinical progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs141843711 was recognized as an important locus that overlapped in the analyses of AN and BMI, indicating its relevance in the shared genetic factors influencing these traits.
title: An Evolutionary Perspective on the Genetics of Anorexia Nervosa

finding: The SNP rs5442, a missense variant in the GNB3 gene, was associated with retinal nerve fiber layer thickness and linked to the risk of degenerative disc disease, showing a beta of -0.11 with a p-value of 6.74×10^-23.
title: A predictive atlas of disease onset from retinal fundus photographs

finding: The HNF1A variant (rs2135845768) demonstrated an association with altered expression of four proteins (ACE2, CTRC, OSM, and TGF-alpha), with lower levels of ACE2 observed in carriers. This variant explained up to 2.5% of variance in diabetes in the Greenlandic population.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: The FokI rs2228570 SNP was associated with Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) in the South Indian population. The study found that the FF genotype was significantly more frequent in T1D patients compared to controls (OR=1.66; p<0.03), indicating it confers susceptibility to T1D. The amino acid change due to this SNP was predicted to have damaging effects, contributing to the association with the disease.
title: Association of Vitamin D deficiency and vitamin D receptor gene polymorphisms with type 1 diabetes risk: A South Indian familial study

finding: The BsmI-B allele (rs1544410) exhibited an over-transmission to T1D patients (T:U=17/5; p<0.01). This finding indicated a positive association with increased risk of T1D among the South Indian population, highlighting its potential role as a risk factor.
title: Association of Vitamin D deficiency and vitamin D receptor gene polymorphisms with type 1 diabetes risk: A South Indian familial study

finding: The ApaI-A allele (rs7975232) also showed significant over-transmission to T1D patients (T:U=15/5; p<0.006), suggesting it positively contributes to the risk of T1D in this population.
title: Association of Vitamin D deficiency and vitamin D receptor gene polymorphisms with type 1 diabetes risk: A South Indian familial study

finding: This novel signal was linked to estrone levels at the OASL-P2RX7 locus.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs4767027 in OAS1 was shown to be significantly associated with a decreased likelihood of COVID-19 susceptibility and severity in a study involving European ancestry. Additionally, the analysis indicated that aged individuals with severe COVID-19 exhibited reduced expression of type I interferon genes, including OAS1, which correlated with higher viral loads in aged patients as opposed to younger patients.
title: Aging-related cell type-specific pathophysiologic immune responses that exacerbate disease severity in aged COVID-19 patients

finding: rs2364485 was identified as a trans-pQTL for LTA associated with multiple sclerosis, with evidence supporting its role in lower LTBR levels and higher circulating LTA.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The role of rs1800693 includes significant implications for TNFRSF1A in the same locus as rs2364485, impacting the understanding of multiple sclerosis.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The analysis demonstrated that rs76169231 was jointly associated with systolic blood pressure, pulse pressure, and the whole brainstem, midbrain, and pons. This locus was mapped to the WASHC3 gene, which regulates endolysosomal membrane trafficking. The implications of how WASHC3 contributes to hypertension warranted further research.
title: Large-scale brainstem neuroimaging and genetic analyses provide new insights into the neuronal mechanisms of hypertension

finding: Similar to rs76169231, rs11111293 was also jointly associated with systolic blood pressure, pulse pressure, and the whole brainstem, midbrain, and pons, mapping to the WASHC3 gene. Its role in hypertension, linked to the regulation of endolysosomal membrane trafficking by the WASHC3 gene, required additional investigation.
title: Large-scale brainstem neuroimaging and genetic analyses provide new insights into the neuronal mechanisms of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs2138543 was associated with TLA from 6am to 8am, which was indicative of early morning activity, contributing to understanding the genetic basis of diurnal activity rhythms.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: An intronic SNP in FRS2 was identified to be significantly associated with FEV1 in the UK Biobank and SpiroMeta, with a p-value of 1.2 × 10^-10 from a total of 396,723 samples. The association provided additional, independent evidence for this signal as it had not been included in the final list of loci released by Shrine et al., due to a higher p-value in the replication cohort, suggesting important implications for lung function.
title: Powerful gene-based testing by integrating long-range chromatin interactions and knockoff genotypes

finding: The finding indicated that rs10843036 was specifically associated with pregnancy zone protein (PZP) in females. This association highlighted the role of PZP in female reproductive health.
title: Similar and different: systematic investigation of proteogenomic variation between sexes and its relevance for human diseases

finding: The SNP rs1006737 was identified as a risk-associated variant correlated with increased cortical function during executive cognition and higher cortical CACNA1C mRNA levels during brain development, which underscored its relevance in the context of depressive-like symptoms in the prefrontal cortex and its association with schizophrenia.
title: Variant-risk-exon interplay impacts circadian rhythm and dopamine signaling pathway in severe psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs4766578, located at 12q24.12, demonstrated a consistent degree of pleiotropy across multiple trait pairs, particularly in autoimmune diseases (ADs) and cardiovascular diseases (CVDs). It was situated within the binding sequence of HNF4A, a transcription factor linked to critical health outcomes related to blood pressure and both ADs and CVDs.
title: Genetic analyses identify shared genetic components related to autoimmune and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs10744777 within the 12q24.11-12 locus functions as an eQTL for ALDH2 in monocytes. ALDH2 is linked to mechanisms that protect against ischemia-reperfusion injury in CVDs, further indicating the genetic overlap between these conditions.
title: Genetic analyses identify shared genetic components related to autoimmune and cardiovascular diseases

finding: SNP rs3184504, located in the gene SH2B3, showed significant pleiotropic effects associated with both immunological disorders and CVDs. Its A risk allele led to increased activation of the NOD2 recognition pathway, triggering pro-inflammatory responses that could adversely affect cardiac health.
title: Genetic analyses identify shared genetic components related to autoimmune and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SLCO1B1 rs4149032 variant was confirmed as a significant covariate for rifampicin pharmacokinetics, where the variant was associated with low rifampicin plasma exposure compared to the wildtype. An optimum dose of 750 mg was found for patients with this variant to achieve the desired pharmacokinetic target.
title: AI coupled to pharmacometric modelling to tailor malaria and tuberculosis treatment in Africa

finding: The SNP rs1169299, located at the HNF1A locus, was found to have significant ancestry-correlated heterogeneity. It exhibited a negative association with the AFR-EAS axis (P_HET=2.7×10^-11) and a positive association with the AFR-EUR axis (P_HET=4.6×10^-9). The odds ratios (ORs) indicated an AFR allelic effect (OR=1.02) that was intermediate between the effects observed in EAS (OR=0.95) and EUR (OR=1.05). This finding highlighted variability in allelic effects across different ancestry groups when it came to type 2 diabetes (T2D) associations.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide study in >2.5 million individuals reveals heterogeneity in mechanistic pathways of type 2 diabetes and complications

finding: Associated with male-specific traits, this SNP was a significant eQTL for ALDH2 in aorta.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The variant rs77395454, located in the intronic region of CORO1C on chromosome 12, reached genome-wide significance for its association with the penetrance of LRRK2 mutations in Parkinson's disease. The P-value for this finding was 2.5E-08, indicating strong evidence of its role as a modifier of penetrance.
title: Genome-wide association studies of LRRK2 modifiers of Parkinson’s disease

finding: Located near the TBX5 gene at 12q24.21, rs10774740 showed a strong association in the PUV cohort with a p-value of 7.81×10⁻¹² and an odds ratio of 0.40, indicating a protective effect.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: As a proxy for rs751370420, rs7307879 was conclusively linked to pancreas fat levels that correlated heavily with the odds of developing PDAC.
title: Genetic Evidence Causally Linking Pancreas Fat to Pancreatic Cancer: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs10774671-G allele of OAS1 was significantly associated with protection against severe COVID-19 in the Moroccan population. This allele was found to be present in both Neanderthal GGG and African GAC haplotypes, each at a frequency of about 20%. It played a critical role in producing a longer OAS1 transcript, increasing the levels of OAS1 protein and was crucial for decreasing the risk of severe COVID-19. This variant showed a prevalence of 40.4% in present-day Moroccans.
title: Study of the protective OAS1 rs10774671-G allele against severe COVID-19 in Moroccans suggests a North African origin for Neanderthals

finding: The rs4149056 SNP was associated with the odds of missingness of several metabolites related to bile acids and steroids. It emerged as a significant factor in metabolic pathways connected to statin-induced myopathy and serum estrone levels, indicating its role in the metabolism of these substances.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs11836164 near SSPN at 12p12.1 was significantly associated with V (P = 6.69 × 10−5) and previously recognized for its connection to mammographic density.
title: A genome-wide association study of mammographic texture variation

finding: This SNP served as an eQTL and colocalized with serum phosphate levels (rs116827959) observed at a frequency of 15.4% in 1000 Genomes Africans, achieving a high colocalization probability of PP4 = 0.94.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: The study found that the risk allele rs10735079A of the OAS3 gene was inversely associated with developing symptoms such as muscle aches and sore throat. Specifically, rs10735079A carriers were less prone to muscle aches (OR, 0.34; P = 0.0248) and sore throat (OR, 0.17; P < 0.001). This unexpected protective association suggested that while rs10735079A had been linked to critical COVID-19 illness in previous studies, it appeared to provide some immunity to certain symptoms in this specific population.
title: Association of IFNAR2 rs2236757 and OAS3 rs10735079 polymorphisms with susceptibility to COVID-19 infection and severity

finding: SNP rs10849448, nearby LTBR, was associated with the development of tertiary lymphoid structures in COPD patients, suggesting its importance in the immune aspects of the disease.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: The SNP rs2277339 was identified as an exonic missense variant in the PRIM1 gene. This variant was associated with FGT polyps, and based on existing literature, it possibly played a role in cellular proliferation. Additionally, it exhibited a negative correlation with sex hormone-binding globulin (SHBG) and had associations with reproductive traits such as menarche and menopause.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: Identified near MED13L on 12q24.21, rs142145593 showed association with early heart and brain development-related processes and was significantly associated with lung cancer and adenocarcinoma, with stronger effects noted among Asian populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Located in WNK1 on 12p13.33, rs12305739 demonstrated associations regarding squamous cell carcinoma.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs753877638 was recognized as a start-loss variant in the ACAD10 gene, showing significant associations with IOP (P = 1.30 × 10^-10, beta = 8.41) and glaucoma (P = 3.68 × 10^-4) in the UKB, establishing its role in these conditions.
title: Whole-exome sequencing study identifies novel rare variants and genes associated with intraocular pressure and glaucoma

finding: The rs5030654 variant in PAH was confirmed as one of the known high-frequency variants, linked to phenylketonuria and overrepresented in the healthy donor subset of the Russian population.
title: Expanding the Russian allele frequency reference via cross-laboratory data integration: insights from 6,096 exome samples

finding: The SNP rs281865192 was identified as a deep intronic founder variant located in the gene CEP290, associated with certain genetic disorders. Sanger sequencing was used to confirm the presence of this (likely) pathogenic variant in the context of examining its biological plausibility and ensuring its quality. This finding contributed to the understanding of the genetic underpinnings of chronic kidney disease, particularly within the cohort studied.
title: Prevalence of hereditary tubulointerstitial kidney diseases in the German Chronic Kidney Disease study

finding: Lead SNP rs1800693 was mapped to an intron of TNFRSF1A, encoding a tumor necrosis factor receptor. It was associated with pneumonia and approached genome-wide significance, hinting at involvement in immune response mechanisms related to pneumonia.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of pneumonia suggests a role for mucin biology and provides novel drug repurposing opportunities

finding: This SNP predicted glutamine and exerted a protective causal effect on the development of NAFLD, as shown in the MR conservative analysis.
title: Causal relationships between genetically predicted circulating levels of amino acids and non-alcoholic fatty liver disease risk: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The SNP rs11614913 demonstrated a significant association with CHD across several models. The co-dominant model analysis revealed a significant effect (P = 0.0003), indicating that this SNP could impact the susceptibility to CHD.
title: The potential impact of microRNA-related functional polymorphisms in the pathogenesis of coronary heart disease

finding: SNP rs11064501 was adjacent to genes encoding C1 sub-components, significant in activating complement pathways, thus relating to C4 protein regulation.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: The rs215223 SNP, located near the B4GALNT3 gene, was identified as a significant variant associated with circulating sclerostin levels, demonstrating an SD change in circulating sclerostin per A allele with P value of 2.44×10^-73.
title: Lowering of circulating sclerostin may increase risk of atherosclerosis and its risk factors: evidence from a genome-wide association meta-analysis followed by Mendelian randomization

finding: The rs56884502 SNP, associated with decreased daily alcohol intake in heterozygotes carrying rs671, showed conflicting effects in the unstratified analysis, indicating that the A allele of rs56884502 decreased alcohol intake when analyzed with respect to rs671 genotype.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: The rs7978737 SNP, located at chromosome 12q24.12, was found linked to drinking status and showed the same conflict in effect direction as rs56884502, suggesting a similar underlying relationship with rs671.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: The variant rs773121 was part of a haplotype associated with PCOS and elevated androgen levels, with a p-value approaching significance (p=0.0583). It was located in the promoter region of the PA2G4 gene and had a CADD PHRED score of 13.2, indicating potential regulatory effects on gene expression.
title: Loci on chromosome 12q13.2 encompassing ERBB3, PA2G4 and RAB5B are associated with polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs773123 was associated with PCOS and elevated androgen levels as part of a haplotype, with a p-value of 0.0583. It was identified as a missense variant in the ERBB3 gene with a high CADD PHRED score of 24.6, suggesting significant functional impacts related to androgen production.
title: Loci on chromosome 12q13.2 encompassing ERBB3, PA2G4 and RAB5B are associated with polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs812826 was part of a haplotype with a significant association with PCOS (p=0.0583) and was located in the promoter region of the PA2G4 gene. It also showed a significant association with anti-Mullerian hormone (AMH) levels, with a CADD PHRED score indicative of potential functionality (score of 13.2).
title: Loci on chromosome 12q13.2 encompassing ERBB3, PA2G4 and RAB5B are associated with polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The rs3184504 SNP was located within the SH2B3 locus on chromosome 12, and it showed significant local genetic correlation across eosinophil count, lymphocyte count, T1D, and CAD. The local genetic correlation was evidenced by a correlation coefficient, contributing to the understanding of how genetic factors influenced these phenotypes.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: The rs7137828 SNP, also found in the SH2B3 locus on chromosome 12, demonstrated significant local genetic correlation for eosinophil count, lymphocyte count, T1D, and CAD, supporting its relevance in the shared genetic architecture of these conditions.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs7132908 was implicated as a causal variant in the context of childhood obesity, specifically located within the 3' UTR of the FAIM2 gene. This finding underscored the genetic influence of this locus on obesity-related phenotypes.
title: Shared and unique 3D genomic features of substance use disorders across multiple cell types

finding: In IDH-wildtype glioblastoma cases treated with TMZ, the SNP rs73191162-T, located near UNG, was significantly associated with survival. It had a hazard ratio of 1.73, indicating a median survival decrease of 3.2 months compared to CC genotype (p-value not specified).
title: Functional germline variants in DNA damage repair pathways are associated with altered survival in adults with glioma treated with temozolomide

finding: This SNP was associated with brain eQTLs and colocalized with stroke and mental health disorders in specific brain regions, indicating its potential influence on gene expression and disease risk.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: This SNP was related to hippocampal sclerosis of aging, indicating its relevance in neurodegenerative disorders while showing underlying genetic overlaps with cardiovascular health.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: This SNP was associated with brain eQTLs impacting gene expression related to CMR traits, suggesting a complex interplay between heart and brain health.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The type 2 diabetes-associated SNP rs1042725 in the HMGA2 locus demonstrated a higher odds ratio in the top quartile of cardiovascular disease (CVD) topic weight (1.18±0.02) compared to the bottom quartile (1.00±0.02), indicating a potential link between this SNP and increased risk of cardiovascular comorbidities in type 2 diabetes patients (P=3 × 10^−4 for interaction test, FDR=0.04).
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: The SH2B3 locus variant rs7310615 was associated with higher volume in the right optic radiation, alongside increased volume in the left Heschl’s gyrus, suggesting its potential role in volumetric changes related to dyslexia.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: SNP rs188571756 located at the 12q13.3 locus was also identified as a novel risk locus shared between MDD and MI, contributing to the understanding of pleiotropic effects in these diseases.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: The SNP rs116779562 was associated with acne severity at a genome-wide significance level among individuals with European ancestry in the BioVU cohort (P-value = 3.25 x 10^-8). It was located in an intergenic region between genes LINC02398 and PDE3A, though this association was not replicated in the FinnGen population.
title: Genome-wide association study analysis of disease severity in Acne reveals novel biological insights

finding: The variant rs3782449 was associated with UC with a P-value of 8.90×10−6 and OR of 0.73. This gene, RBM19, had not been previously described in relation to IBD and was replicated in other datasets, suggesting it might be protective against UC.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The variant rs4766697 was found to be associated with an ocular manifestation in IBD, though it also showed a protective direction of effect in this dataset (P-value=0.64). While not statistically significant in this study, it was noted to relate to a different haplotype than the protective variant rs3782449.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The variant rs200922417 influenced a bitter taste receptor, with a P-value of 6.17×10−6 and OR of 1.92. It was noted for its potential therapeutic influence on UC by affecting CLCA1.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs28416520 in the PIWIL1 gene demonstrated a recessive effect on age at natural menopause (ANM) and was one of the variants that exhibited a significant departure from an additive model. This variant indicated that the mean ANM was significantly influenced by genotype, marking it as a positive and original finding related to ovarian aging.
title: Genetic insights into the biological mechanisms governing human ovarian ageing

finding: The low-frequency missense variant rs75770066 in the HELB gene exhibited a heterozygous advantage effect on ANM, with heterozygous individuals showing a higher mean age at natural menopause (51.375 years) compared to both common and rare homozygotes. This finding highlighted the complex biological mechanisms at this locus, categorizing it as a positive and original finding.
title: Genetic insights into the biological mechanisms governing human ovarian ageing

finding: The rs10774671-G allele was associated with the production of the OAS1-p46 isoform, which was linked to protection from severe COVID-19. It created a splicing site that led to different OAS1 transcripts, affecting their stability and contributing to a reduced risk of hospitalization for COVID-19 when compared to the risk A allele.
title: Genetic regulation of OAS1 nonsense-mediated decay underlies association with risk of severe COVID-19

finding: The rs1131454-G allele functions as an exonic splicing enhancer that increases the inclusion of the Long exon 3, providing a protective effect against nonsense-mediated decay (NMD) of OAS1 transcripts. This variant was implicated in the elevated risk of severe COVID-19 when the A allele was present.
title: Genetic regulation of OAS1 nonsense-mediated decay underlies association with risk of severe COVID-19

finding: The intron variant rs343086 was linked to traits related to standing height, specifically associated with the gene HMGA2. It contributed to a leading factor that was enriched for musculoskeletal tissues, consistent with previous findings on height variations.
title: A scalable variational approach to characterize pleiotropic components across thousands of human diseases and complex traits using GWAS summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs3184504 was correlated with lower expression of the SH2B3 gene. The presence of the C allele was associated with reduced risk of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus while increasing the susceptibility to endometrial cancer.
title: Mapping inherited genetic variation with opposite effects on autoimmune disease and cancer identifies candidate drug targets associated with the anti-tumor immune response

finding: This missense variant in the <italic>SLCO1B1</italic> gene was linked to total bilirubin levels.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This variant was linked to fibroblastic disorders through the gene <italic>LUM</italic>.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with PS thickening, indicating a potential PS-independent risk for AMD.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: The study provided the first evidence that the CACNA1C protein levels were significantly higher in subjects with bipolar disorder (BD) who were homozygous for the risk allele (CC), indicating an association between the rs11062170 polymorphism and increased serum levels of CACNA1C protein in this population.
title: Differential Serum Levels of CACNA1C, Circadian Rhythm and Stress Response Molecules in Subjects with Bipolar Disorder: Associations with Genetic and Clinical Factors

finding: The SNP rs1677091, located near the gene LDHB, was found to be genome-wide significant in individuals of European ancestries. This finding was replicated in subsequent independent samples.
title: Clinical, genomic, and neurophysiological correlates of lifetime suicide attempts among individuals with alcohol dependence

finding: The SNP rs683813, located within the gene ARNTL2, was associated with suicide attempts among individuals of African ancestries and was reported as a significant finding.
title: Clinical, genomic, and neurophysiological correlates of lifetime suicide attempts among individuals with alcohol dependence

finding: The SNP variant rs35767, located in the regulatory region of the IGF1 gene, was associated with elevated circulating IGF-1 levels. A multivariable analysis across several cohorts indicated that possessing even one risk allele of rs35767 was linked to a 50% increase in the risk of Death Censored Graft Failure (DCGF), with a hazard ratio of 1.50 (p = 0.01). This finding corroborated the hypothesis that higher IGF-1 exposure negatively impacted KTx survival, thereby establishing a connection between the SNP and poorer long-term clinical outcomes.
title: The Growth Hormone-IGF-1 axis is a risk factor for Long-Term Kidney Allograft Failure

finding: The variant rs33990080 in the SLC15A4 gene was identified as a novel genetic risk variant for idiopathic gastroparesis. Carriers of this variant exhibited a significantly higher nausea score at baseline, with a mean difference of approximately 0.3 units, and around 0.6 units when comparing homozygotes (p-value <0.04). The odds ratio (OR) for this variant in idiopathic patients versus controls was 1.9, indicating a strong association.
title: The role of M1 to M2 macrophage polarization in the etiology of idiopathic gastroparesis: GWAS perspective

finding: The variant rs10847696 within the SLC15A4 gene showed a statistically significant association in the GWAS for idiopathic gastroparesis, with a p-value <0.000004 and an odds ratio of 1.9.
title: The role of M1 to M2 macrophage polarization in the etiology of idiopathic gastroparesis: GWAS perspective

finding: The SNP rs7313797 on chromosome 12 was notable for having consistent direction of effect across populations and reached nominal significance in all three population analyses, illustrating its association with sleep duration.
title: Genome-wide association study investigating short and long sleep duration: a cross-population meta-analysis

finding: The genetic variant rs2943692 was associated with INHBC, located on chromosome 12 at position 57442315, serving as the lead variant in the association results. It exhibited significant associations with both protein levels and the incidence of T2D.
title: Circulating proteomic profiles are associated with the onset of type 2 diabetes in a multi-ethnic Asian population – a longitudinal study

finding: was located near SUOX and showed significant associations with cancer proliferation; it influenced immune regulatory pathways pertaining to keratinocyte cancer.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: was associated with hypothyroidism, showcasing its significance in immune and inflammatory responses.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: was linked to psoriasis and located near IL31, relevant to skin allergic diseases.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: The non-coding variant rs76904798 was confirmed to be significantly associated with an increased risk of Parkinson's disease (PD), showing an odds ratio of 1.15 (95% CI: 1.13-1.18) in the meta-analysis. Notably, its association remained significant even after excluding carriers of rare LRRK2 coding variants, which highlights that rs76904798 operates independently of the LRRK2 coding variations.
title: LRRK2 coding variants and the risk of Parkinson’s disease

finding: Found to be associated with L-lactate dehydrogenase A chain protein (LDHA) levels, contributing to insights on serum protein levels.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The study identified a significant interaction for rs6539267, another top SNP from a TS GWAS. This interaction was with a cumulative pre- and perinatal adversity score, with an F value of 6.80 and a P value of 0.001. The CC genotype, when combined with a higher number of pre- and perinatal adversities, was positively associated with tic severity.
title: Investigation of gene-environment interactions in relation to tic severity

finding: This SNP represented a Finnish-enriched variant p.Arg310Cys in LUM, showing strong association with DD (OR = 2.86, p = 3.59 × 10^-8).
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: The variant rs3138142 within the RDH5 gene showed a very significant association (P = 5.58 x 10<sup>-60</sup>) with PRC thickness, linking it to multiple ophthalmic phenotypes and pathogenic variants known to cause fundus albipunctatus, a retinal dystrophy.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs11614913 in the MIR196A2 gene was associated with Hip Shape Mode 9 (HSM9) with a P value of 2.8×10^-10. This was a novel finding in the context of hip morphology, as it had not been previously reported despite its association with bone size. Furthermore, it exhibited protective associations with hip fracture.
title: Genome-wide association study of DXA-derived hip morphology identifies associations with 4 loci in Chinese populations

finding: The rs10774671 haplotype was associated with the transcriptional response to Omicron infection. It was found in 83% of the control population, 86% of the unvaccinated Omicron population, and 85% of the vaccinated Omicron population. This SNP is linked to the OAS1 gene, which has a mutation traced back to the Neanderthal genome and is associated with protection from severe COVID-19, highlighting its potential significance in the immune response to Omicron.
title: Prior vaccination enables a more robust immune response to Omicron infection

finding: The SNP rs3184504 at the SH2B3 locus was found to act in trans and was associated with six proteins: CXCL9, CXCL10, CXCL11, CD5, CD244, and IL12B, indicating its involvement in inflammation-related pathways.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs11066132 was identified as an intron variant in the NAA25 gene and was associated with 23 traits, indicating significant pleiotropy. This finding contributed to a better understanding of the genetic architecture involved in multiple phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide study on 72,298 Korean individuals in Korean biobank data for 76 traits identifies hundreds of novel loci

finding: Similar to rs11066132, rs116873087 was also an intron variant in the NAA25 gene and demonstrated associations across 23 traits, reinforcing the concept of pleiotropy for this locus.
title: Genome-wide study on 72,298 Korean individuals in Korean biobank data for 76 traits identifies hundreds of novel loci

finding: The analysis revealed that SNP rs3184504 was significantly associated with celiac disease, a condition characterized by an autoimmune response to gluten. It was included in the sparse PRS model for celiac disease, which comprised 428 variants including imputed HLA allelotypes and variants near the MHC region on chromosome 6. The missense variant rs3184504, located on chromosome 12 within the gene SH2B3, had a log(OR) of 0.15 in the multivariate PRS model, indicating its role in the genetic predisposition to celiac disease.
title: Significant Sparse Polygenic Risk Scores across 813 traits in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs747096195 (R101G) was characterized as having a reduced efficiency in acetaldehyde metabolism when assessed in a recombinant enzyme context. The study identified that individuals carrying this variant experienced a two-fold increase in acetaldehyde levels following an alcohol challenge, contrasting with a nine-fold increase observed in those carrying the common ALDH2 variant rs671 (E504K). This suggested a notable impairment in aldehyde metabolism attributable to the R101G mutation.
title: Phenotyping aldehyde metabolism in humans uncovers novel genetic mutations in aldehyde dehydrogenase 2

finding: The SNP rs190764869 (R114W) was also characterized as having reduced enzymatic efficiency in the context of acetaldehyde metabolism. Similar to rs747096195, the participants with this variant showed two-fold elevated acetaldehyde levels after an alcohol challenge, compared to a significantly higher increase in ALDH2 variant rs671 (E504K), indicating its contribution to impaired aldehyde metabolism.
title: Phenotyping aldehyde metabolism in humans uncovers novel genetic mutations in aldehyde dehydrogenase 2

finding: The SNP rs4646777 (G>A), identified as an intron mutation, was linked to facial flushing without significant accumulation of acetaldehyde following alcohol consumption. Participants with this mutation displayed modest physiological responses similar to those with the wild type ALDH2 genotype, suggesting that although it induced flushing, it did not contribute to aldehyde toxicity, contrasting it with rs671 and the other point mutations.
title: Phenotyping aldehyde metabolism in humans uncovers novel genetic mutations in aldehyde dehydrogenase 2

finding: The SNP rs3764002 was identified as a likely damaging exonic variant, contributing to pain intensity, and was part of the 125 independent genetic loci found in a cross-ancestry meta-analysis of pain intensity.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: Significant association was found between rs11837200 and gut microbiota class Bacilli, again supporting the possibility that selenium may regulate this bacterial class and influence fetal developmental abnormalities.
title: The Mendelian randomization analysis of trace elements Zinc, Selenium, Copper, Iron, and Phosphate with congenital foot deformities

finding: The study identified rs597808 as a common risk locus between systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and premature coronary atherosclerosis, with genome-wide significance (P<5 × 10^-8). This locus was linked to decreased HDL and LDL cholesterol levels, indicating its role in the dyslipidemia observed in naive SLE patients.
title: Association between Systemic Lupus Erythematosus and Coronary Heart Disease: a retrospective case-control analysis and Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: In locus 12p13.33, rs3782860 associated with chronotype and retinal traits, showing the connections between sleep and eye health.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The SNP rs2080402 in 12p13.33 linked chronotype with retinal measurements, emphasizing the genetic overlap between sleep and eye development.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The SLCO1B1 rs4149032 polymorphism was shown to be highly prevalent in South Africans and associated with reduced rifampicin concentrations. This finding suggested important dosing implications, indicating that individuals with this polymorphism might require adjusted rifampicin dosages to achieve optimal drug exposure.
title: Plasma pharmacokinetics of high dose oral versus intravenous rifampicin in patients with tuberculous meningitis: a randomized controlled trial

finding: The SNP rs10128882 was identified as a lead variant in colocalization analyses with both LIN7A and ACSS3, observed only in the Mexican ancestry blood eQTL data. The T2D risk allele was associated with decreased expression levels of both genes, showing population-specific effects.
title: Multi-omics characterization of type 2 diabetes associated genetic variation

finding: The T2D risk allele for rs11114650 showed differential linkage disequilibrium in various ancestry groups and was linked to lower expression levels of LIN7A and ACSS3, indicating its association with T2D risk.
title: Multi-omics characterization of type 2 diabetes associated genetic variation

finding: The variant rs138740163 (MAF=1.0%) was found to increase the risk for 'Mittelschmerz' (ovulation pain) by more than 5-fold (OR: 6.00) among women, with RBM19 as a putative candidate gene linked to preimplantation development.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: The analysis indicated that rs1468603, located at chr12:6317886 C>T, was associated with a splicing event related to PLEKHG6. Specifically, the T allele was predicted to activate an exonic cryptic acceptor, enhancing the inclusion of an in-frame 45 bp deletion in PLEKHG6, suggesting a potential functional role in CRC.
title: Integrating multi-tissue expression and splicing data to prioritise anatomical subsite- and sex-specific colorectal cancer susceptibility genes with therapeutic potential

finding: The rs4760682 variant located in the PFKM gene was linked with plasma pyruvate levels, thus suggesting its role in the glycolysis pathway affecting red blood cell survival.
title: Mendelian randomisation with proxy exposures: challenges and opportunities

finding: The rs3819817 variant near the HAL gene was found to affect vitamin D levels and skin cancer risk, and was identified as an eQTL for HAL, demonstrating its significance in vitamin D synthesis.
title: Mendelian randomisation with proxy exposures: challenges and opportunities

finding: The rs61937878 variant in the HAL gene showed strong associations with plasma histidine and vitamin D levels, suggesting its functional relevance.
title: Mendelian randomisation with proxy exposures: challenges and opportunities

finding: This variant in the HAL gene was associated with plasma histidine levels but did not show a significant association with vitamin D levels, indicating a more complex relationship.
title: Mendelian randomisation with proxy exposures: challenges and opportunities

finding: This SNP showed a positive association with HSM4, HSM9, and HSM10, indicating its involvement in hip shape variation. Specifically, it presented a beta of -0.08 with a P value of 1.38×10^-7, suggesting a protective effect against hip fracture. It was predicted to increase transcription in chondrocytes and was also noted to increase transcription in osteoblasts.
title: Hip shape shows a causal effect on hip fracture but not hip osteoarthritis: findings from a GWAS meta-analysis and causal analyses

finding: This SNP, similar to rs56368105, was positively associated with HSM4 and showed a beta of -0.08 and a P value of 8.87×10^-8, indicating a protective effect against hip fracture. It was also predicted to increase transcription in chondrocytes.
title: Hip shape shows a causal effect on hip fracture but not hip osteoarthritis: findings from a GWAS meta-analysis and causal analyses

finding: In contrast to rs56368105 and rs736825, rs11614913 was associated with an increased risk of hip fracture, showing a beta of 0.08 and a P value of 4.73×10^-31. It was associated with hip shape modes indicating its role in determining hip shape but acted differently compared to the other SNPs.
title: Hip shape shows a causal effect on hip fracture but not hip osteoarthritis: findings from a GWAS meta-analysis and causal analyses

finding: The findings indicated that rs10850579 had a significant effect on methylation site cg14016568, with a beta value of -1.20 and a p-value of 1.10×10^-28. This emphasized the importance of this SNP in relation to the molecular mechanisms of osteoarthritis, as observed in tissue from patients undergoing total knee replacement.
title: Epigenomic profiling of the infrapatellar fat pad in osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs1006737, located within intron 3 of the schizophrenia (SZ) risk gene CACNA1C, was linked to variable mRNA expression, indicating that it played a role in influencing gene expression levels related to the risk of developing schizophrenia.
title: Long-read sequencing reveals the RNA isoform repertoire of neuropsychiatric risk genes in human brain

finding: The rs3741596 missense variant (S218G) in the ORAI1 gene was associated with an increased risk of hospital-diagnosed peripheral vascular disease (PVD), generalised atherosclerosis, acute ischaemic heart disease, and cardiac conduction disorders including atrioventricular and left bundle-branch block among White British UK Biobank participants. Notably, the analysis revealed that carriers of this variant had a 1.7-fold increased risk of hospitalisation for PVD and a 6.8-fold higher risk of hospitalisation for generalised atherosclerosis. Furthermore, rs3741596 was linked to elevated circulating platelet counts, reduced triglyceride levels, and alterations in various blood cell parameters, indicating its significant role in cardiovascular and hematological health.
title: A rare ORAI1 missense variant associates with risk of vascular diseases in White British adults

finding: The SNP rs377424471 at the MLXIP locus demonstrated an association with early onset IS, with an OR of 0.90 (95% CI: 0.86-0.94), marking a novel association not previously linked to stroke.
title: Genetic Contributions to Early and Late Onset Ischemic Stroke

finding: The genetic variant rs2270788 in ABCB9 was found to be associated with both the risk and tumor size of uterine leiomyomas specifically in African American participants. ABCB9, which is involved in the transport and processing of antigens, has also been observed to be downregulated in women with high progesterone serum levels, which is relevant given that progesterone promotes leiomyoma growth.
title: Exploring potential causal genes for uterine leiomyomas: A summary data-based Mendelian randomization and FUMA analysis

finding: The lead SNP rs12308154 at the LGR5 locus showed strong head-specific effects with a p-value of 1.5e-9 concerning DXA-derived bone mineral density (BMD). This SNP and locus are critical for bone development and homeostasis, being involved in WNT signaling and embryonic craniofacial development.
title: Valid inference for machine learning-assisted GWAS

finding: The rs768676371 variant, a missense variant in the DAO gene resulting in a glycine-to-valine substitution (DAO<sup>G131V</sup>), was confirmed in multiple affected family members with bipolar disorder type-1 or type-2 and was absent in unaffected members. This suggests that the variant is associated with bipolar disorder and it demonstrates linkage with a statistical significance of P = 7e-4.
title: A rare variant in D-amino acid oxidase implicates NMDA receptor signaling and cerebellar gene networks in risk for bipolar disorder

finding: rs11494758 was associated with SHS-PC3 and was found to be independent from rs201449027. This variant is also located within the KLRG1 locus and pertains to immune response mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of composite sleep health scores in 413,904 individuals

finding: SNP rs10774625 was highlighted for its strong association with cardiovascular phenotypes in the EUR, and it had also replicated in the AFR cohort, marking it as a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: The SNP rs4149056, located in the SLCO1B1 gene, was identified as a sentinel variant significantly associated with decreased serum levels of glycocholic acid (GDCA), with a notable effect size observed in males (beta = -0.51, p = 2.30×10^-13). This SNP, a missense variant (p.Val174Ala), has also been linked to other blood metabolites such as bilirubin and vitamin D in previous studies.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals loci with sex-specific effects on plasma bile acids

finding: The variant rs73079476 in high linkage disequilibrium with rs4149056 (r² = 0.97) was also associated with GDCA levels. The association was significant in male-only analyses, corroborating that the SLCO1B1 locus had a stronger influence on GDCA levels in men compared to women.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals loci with sex-specific effects on plasma bile acids

finding: Identified within the FAIM2 locus, rs7132908 demonstrated consistent contacts with gene promoters across multiple cell types, indicating its role in the genetic architecture of obesity.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: The SNP rs111486601, situated near LHX5-AS1 on chromosome 12, also reached genome-wide significance with a P-value of 1.1×10^-8. This SNP displayed a significant association primarily in the Hispanic population, where it had an OR of 0.63, indicating a possible protective effect against AD.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis of 56,241 individuals identifies LRRC4C, LHX5-AS1 and nominates ancestry-specific loci PTPRK, GRB14, and KIAA0825 as novel risk loci for Alzheimer’s disease: the Alzheimer’s Disease Genetics Consortium

finding: The SNP rs11065577 emerged as one of the seven novel loci in the latent MDD-CVD factor analysis. Though it had not previously been identified in any GWAS, it showed suggestive associations (p<.05) with metabolic traits, indicating its potential relevance in the context of MDD-CVD comorbidity.
title: Distinct biological signature and modifiable risk factors underly the comorbidity between major depressive disorder and cardiovascular disease

finding: Similarly, rs35350651 was also associated with seven autoimmune traits. This SNP demonstrated regulatory interactions with various gene promoters in immune cell types, highlighting its importance in the genetic landscape of autoimmune diseases.
title: 3D chromatin-based variant-to-gene maps across 57 human cell types reveal the cellular and genetic architecture of autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: rs653178 was found to be linked with seven autoimmune traits as well, showcasing its relevance in the context of autoimmune disorders. It participated in chromatin contacts that influence gene regulation, implicating it in the mechanisms underlying immune response and inflammation.
title: 3D chromatin-based variant-to-gene maps across 57 human cell types reveal the cellular and genetic architecture of autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The study found that the allele C at rs695871 was consistently present in SCA2 carriers while an unexpected G allele was also identified in one SCA2 family. This finding contradicted previous studies that suggested a common haplotype for SCA2 families worldwide, indicating multiple origins of the disease in different populations.
title: Spinocerebellar ataxia type 2 has multiple ancestral origins

finding: SNP rs9651873 was also included in the 40 PTSD risk loci identified and had a high CADD score, suggesting its significance in affecting PTSD-related traits.
title: The genetic relationships between post-traumatic stress disorder and its corresponding neural circuit structures

finding: The SNP rs1860356 showed a significant association with angina, with an odds ratio (OR_IVW) of 1.005 (95% CI: 1.003–1.007, p < 0.001), thus indicating a potential impact on cardiovascular health.
title: Causality of Genetically Determined Monounsaturated Fatty Acids on Risk of Cardiovascular Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs4963772 was significant within the SOX5 locus, displaying linear associations with latent phenotypes Z49_S1 and Z82_S1, which were linked to multiple cardiac diseases, including atrial fibrillation and blood pressure traits, with a highly significant P-value of 3.55 × 10^-14.
title: Unsupervised cardiac MRI phenotyping with 3D diffusion autoencoders reveals novel genetic insights

finding: The SNP rs11610045 was located in the 12q24.33 locus, situated between the GALNT9 and FBRSL1 genes. It correlated with the methylation probe cg18316254, which was inversely correlated with mean striatal DAT binding in the participant cohort, affirming its relevance to dopaminergic functions.
title: Epigenetic and cognitive signatures of striatal DAT binding among healthy elderly individuals

finding: The SNP rs3764002, a missense variant in the gene WSCD2, was associated with both type 2 diabetes and knee osteoarthritis, with its risk-increasing allele affecting both diseases. This SNP was noted for its predicted damaging effect on protein function.
title: Insights into the comorbidity between type 2 diabetes and osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs1426371 was identified as an intronic variant within WSCD2 and reached genome-wide significance in association with knee osteoarthritis. It was part of the high-confidence effector gene colocalizing with type 2 diabetes, reinforcing its significance in the comorbidity.
title: Insights into the comorbidity between type 2 diabetes and osteoarthritis

finding: SNP rs11057830 in SCARB1 was associated with hypercholesterolemia and detected through the CC-liability method, being significant in other GWAS studies within the UK Biobank.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The variant rs11115199 achieved genome-wide significance in both cardiometabolic interaction (p=1.37×10⁻⁸) and joint tests (p=4.85×10⁻⁸). It is an eQTL for METTL25, suggesting it affects immune response and cardiometabolic traits, potentially linking it to COVID-19 outcomes, especially in T2D patients.
title: Gene-environment interaction analysis incorporating sex, cardiometabolic diseases, and multiple deprivation index reveals novel genetic associations with COVID-19 severity

finding: The variant p.V377I in MVK was associated with hyper-IgD syndrome (OMIM: 260920), showing a significantly enriched AF of 0.8% in the Qatar Arab subpopulation, which was absent in the 1000 genomes and approximately 0.15% in other global datasets.
title: Genetic landscape of rare autoinflammatory disease variants in Qatar and Middle Eastern populations through the integration of whole-genome and exome datasets

finding: The SNP rs74651308 presented a significant association with PSP at p = 2.86 × 10^-7, contributing to the genetic understanding of the SLCO1A2 locus.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The rs11568563 SNP was shown to be associated with PSP with a p-value of 1.45 × 10^-6, highlighting its relevance in the SLCO1A2 region.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: SNP rs147124286 demonstrated a significant association with PSP, exhibiting a p-value of 4.39 × 10^-7 linked to the SP1 region, affirming previous findings.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The lead SNP rs12817984 was significantly associated with PSP at p = 8.91 × 10^-8, connected to the SP1 transcriptional network.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The locus rs11050663 was investigated as part of a chemoradiotherapy regimen for treating advanced pancreatic cancer, showing promise for improving patient outcomes.
title: Graph Attention Networks for Drug Combination Discovery: Targeting Pancreatic Cancer Genes with RAIN Protocol

finding: The study found that OGFOD2/CCDC62 rs11060180 G-carriers exhibited higher UPDRS-III scores compared to AA carriers. Furthermore, small-worldness properties in the gray matter covariance network mediated the effects of this SNP on motor assessments in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients.
title: Parkinson’s disease-associated genetic variants synergistically shape brain networks

finding: The SNP rs138380449 in the gene IFFO1 was associated with higher levels of injury/inflammation, specifically showing an increase of 1.7 standard deviations (SD) with a p-value of 0.0001. This SNP harbored the minor A allele, which was predicted to have a moderately deleterious effect (CADD>22.5) and was carried by individuals who mostly had mild cognitive impairment (MCI) or Alzheimer's disease (AD). Mediation tests indicated that the injury/inflammation levels influenced by this SNP also affected dementia symptoms, with a significant association (p=9.5×10−6).
title: Rare variants in IFFO1, DTNB and NLRC3 associate with Alzheimer’s disease CSF profile of neuronal injury and inflammation

finding: Similar to rs138380449, the SNP rs139792267 in IFFO1 showed an association with raised injury/inflammation levels, yielding an increase of 1.3 SD with a p-value of 0.0037. This SNP, which is located close to rs138380449, also carried the minor A allele and was linked to individuals with MCI or AD. Mediation analyses suggested that the influence of this variant on injury/inflammation also had significant repercussions on dementia symptoms (p=9.5×10−6).
title: Rare variants in IFFO1, DTNB and NLRC3 associate with Alzheimer’s disease CSF profile of neuronal injury and inflammation

finding: The T allele of rs17836273, causing an alanine to threonine substitution (A98T) in the EF-hand domain of Rab46 and CRACR2A, was significantly associated with increased COVID-19 mortality with an odds ratio of 1.43 (p = 0.012). This SNP's substitution occurred at a highly conserved position and was predicted to lead to structural changes affecting calcium binding, which is critical for the protein's function.
title: EFCAB4B (CRACR2A) genetic variants associated with COVID-19 fatality

finding: The T allele of rs36030417 resulted in a histidine to glutamine substitution (H212Q) within the coiled-coil domain of Rab46 and CRACR2A. This SNP showed a significant association with COVID-19 fatality, corresponding to an odds ratio of 1.39 (p = 0.013). The mutation occurred at a highly conserved site, which suggested potential importance in protein interactions and functionality.
title: EFCAB4B (CRACR2A) genetic variants associated with COVID-19 fatality

finding: The C allele of rs9788233 resulted in an arginine to glycine substitution (R7G) occurring in a structurally undefined region of the protein. This SNP was significantly linked to COVID-19 mortality with an odds ratio of 1.51 (p = 0.004). Although the specific functional implications of this mutation were less clear, it raised concerns due to its conservation across species.
title: EFCAB4B (CRACR2A) genetic variants associated with COVID-19 fatality

finding: The SNP rs3782886 was found to be a significant lead variant in the BRAP gene region, indicating its association with alcohol dependence. It had a p-value of 1.68×10^-29 in the study, which reinforces its relevance in the context of AUD, particularly in East Asian populations where this SNP is linked to several traits including alcohol-related behaviors.
title: Genome-wide Meta-analysis of Alcohol Use Disorder in East Asians

finding: This SNP had a significant association with carcinoid syndrome, showing a notable P-value of 4×10^-9, which emphasizes its potential role in tumor biology.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: The variant rs3138141 was found in the RDH5 gene locus, which has been previously reported to be associated with high myopia (HM). Its association was reaffirmed with a meta-analysis P-value of 4.69 × 10^-9.
title: Sequencing of 19,219 exomes identifies a low-frequency variant in FKBP5 promoter predisposing to high myopia in a Han Chinese population

finding: Variant rs112726671 near the VDR gene was determined to increase risk of HPV(-) OPC with an odds ratio of 1.23 (95% CI: 1.14, 1.32, p_meta=2.19×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The SNP rs10735079 was identified among the top eight robust associations in the GWAS by Pairo-Castineira et al., which were related to antiviral defense mechanisms and inflammatory organ damage, indicating a potential association with COVID-19 severity.
title: Genetic risk prediction of COVID-19 susceptibility and severity in the Indian population

finding: The SNP rs3138142 was noted as a synonymous coding SNP in RDH5, which is essential for the visual cycle. Mutations in RDH5 result in fundus albipunctatus, a retinal phenotype affecting night vision.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: The SNP rs61916712 showed a distinct association pattern focusing within the fovea and overlapping with a retinal eQTL for TSPAN11. It was also linked to optic disc morphology in previous studies.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: The SNP rs4149056 demonstrated a significant association with statin-associated muscle symptoms (SAMS), with an uncorrected odds ratio (OR) of 1.63 (95% CI [1.34-1.99]). However, upon correction for publication bias, the association was no longer significant, with an OR of 1.23 (95% CI [0.96-1.58]), indicating that initial findings may have been exaggerated due to publication bias.
title: Publication bias in pharmacogenetics of statin-associated muscle symptoms, an umbrella review with a meta-epidemiological study

finding: For Parkinson's disease (PD), homozygous 'C' alleles at rs76904798 were coded as '0', while heterozygous and homozygous 'T' alleles were coded as '1'. This coding revealed the genetic risk associated with LRRK2 mutations, clarifying their role in PD susceptibility.
title: Gut-Brain Nexus: Mapping Multi-Modal Links to Neurodegeneration at Biobank Scale

finding: This SNP was analyzed in relation to Parkinson's disease, where homozygous 'G' alleles were coded as '0' and heterozygous or homozygous 'A' alleles as '1'. The findings correlated LRRK2 G2019S mutations with increased risk for PD.
title: Gut-Brain Nexus: Mapping Multi-Modal Links to Neurodegeneration at Biobank Scale

finding: The SNP rs11616188 was noted for being involved in the colocalization between GWAS traits of mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH) and mean corpuscular volume (MCV) and the enQTL of MLF2, suggesting its relevance in leukemia.
title: Genetic determinants of gene expression noise and its role in complex trait variation

finding: The variant rs4149056, a missense variant in the SLCO1B1 gene, demonstrated significant associations with multiple oxylipins. It was noted to explain 6.78% of the trait variance associated with HpODE.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: The variant rs11045856 was identified as the top secondary variant in all conditional analyses related to the SLCO1B1-associated metabolites, indicating its potential importance in metabolic pathways.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: The TPH2 SNP in intron 8 (rs10879354) was noted as the only SNP showing consistent effects on perinatal depression across multiple time points, including gestation and postpartum periods among a German population. This finding underscored the importance of TPH2 polymorphisms in neurotransmitter activity related to depression.
title: A sum of its parts: A systematic review evaluating biopsychosocial and behavioral determinants of perinatal depression

finding: The SNP rs11060180 was associated with the gene PTK2B, which is considered a PD-risk allele. This association was significant with a p-value of 1.12×10^-4. The context of this finding relates to its role in Parkinson's disease (PD) and its correlation with motor symptoms as measured by the UPDRS-III scale.
title: Plasma acellular transcriptome contains Parkinson’s disease signatures that can inform clinical diagnosis

finding: At the ALDH2 locus, the common T allele of rs6490056 was associated with increased systolic blood pressure (SBP) levels, exhibiting a significant P value of 1.9x10^-10, particularly pronounced in the 'current smoking' exposure strata with an interaction P value of 2.6x10^-5. This SNP and related variants acted as eQTLs for ALDH2 across multiple tissues, relevant for understanding oxidative stress and blood pressure modulation influenced by smoking.
title: Multi-omics insights into the biological mechanisms underlying gene-by-lifestyle interactions with smoking and alcohol consumption detected by genome-wide trans-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: At the TMEM116 locus, two variants including rs6490056 and rs10849962 were linked to mean arterial pressure (MAP) measures, with rs6490056 showing a P value of 5.7x10^-11 in the 'ever smoking' group. The T allele of rs6490056 correlated to lower TMEM116 expression levels in heart and adipose tissues, whereas the A allele of rs10849962 was associated with higher expression in various tissues, suggesting a complex interaction between gene expression and smoking.
title: Multi-omics insights into the biological mechanisms underlying gene-by-lifestyle interactions with smoking and alcohol consumption detected by genome-wide trans-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs1800801 related to the OA risk gene MGP, demonstrated a downregulation effect with the risk allele T in cartilage, producing a meta-φ of 0.37. This finding highlighted the significant allelic expression imbalance (AEI) for the MGP gene.
title: Allelic expression imbalance in articular cartilage and subchondral bone refined genome-wide association signals in osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs4236 exhibited a downregulation effect of the risk allele C for the gene MGP in subchondral bone tissue, with a calculated meta-φ value of 0.33, which indicates its impact on gene expression in the OA context.
title: Allelic expression imbalance in articular cartilage and subchondral bone refined genome-wide association signals in osteoarthritis

finding: The common HNF1A variant rs1169288 (encoding p.I27L) was significantly associated with predicted HNF1A liver expression scores (p < 2 x 10^-16). This variant had previously been linked to metabolic phenotypes, indicating its important role in regulating liver-specific gene expression related to metabolic processes.
title: Human gain-of-function variants in HNF1A confer protection from diabetes but independently increase hepatic secretion of multiple cardiovascular disease risk factors

finding: A rare missense variant in KNTC1 showed a protective association with the mLOY phenotype, with an odds ratio of 0.58.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The rs1491942 variant in the LRRK2 gene was identified as a risk factor for Parkinson's Disease (PD) development with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.26 and a p-value of 0.01. This association was particularly significant among patients with a high proportion of Native American ancestry, defined as ≥56.6%.
title: MEX-PD: A National Network for the Epidemiological & Genetic Research of Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs7977233 was identified in a subsequent analysis using SAIGE software, which was designed to handle both common and rare variants, and it reached a genome-wide significance threshold with a p-value of 1.47 x 10^-8. This locus was previously reported and emphasized the challenges in analyzing rare variants using current GWAS approaches.
title: Machine Learning Reveals the Contribution of Rare Genetic Variants and Enhances Risk Prediction for Coronary Artery Disease in the Japanese Population

finding: The SNP rs3782886 was also found in the same SAIGE analysis as rs7977233, reaching a similar genome-wide significance threshold of p = 1.47 x 10^-8. This SNP was noted as a previously reported locus, underscoring the limitations of traditional GWAS in addressing rare variants.
title: Machine Learning Reveals the Contribution of Rare Genetic Variants and Enhances Risk Prediction for Coronary Artery Disease in the Japanese Population

finding: The SNP rs1006737, located in the CACNA1C gene, was associated with schizophrenia, contributing to the understanding of the genetic risk factors involved in this neurological disorder. This finding was significant in the context of a larger body of research linking variants in calcium signaling pathways, like those involving calmodulin, to schizophrenia. The odds ratio of 5.62 for calmodulin variants highlights the role of calcium signaling in the pathophysiology of schizophrenia.
title: Calmodulin variants in schizophrenia patients display gain-of-function or loss-of-function effects

finding: rs7973452 at the 12p13.2 locus reached suggestive significance with a P-value of 8.47×10^-6 and an OR of 1.34, hinting at its influence in UC susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs324015, located in the 3' UTR of the STAT6 gene, was identified to significantly increase post-transcriptional activities in luciferase reporter assays compared to the reference alleles, indicating its role in enhancing expression and oncogenic potential in colorectal cancer.
title: Large-scale alternative polyadenylation (APA)-wide association studies to identify putative susceptibility genes in human common cancers

finding: The SNP rs2280503, associated with the DIP2B gene, significantly increased post-transcriptional activities when the risk allele was present, as demonstrated through luciferase reporter assays, confirming its functional impact.
title: Large-scale alternative polyadenylation (APA)-wide association studies to identify putative susceptibility genes in human common cancers

finding: The SNP rs76895963 is implicated in the CCND2-AS1 locus and was part of the seven SNPs shared with type 2 diabetes and PHQ-9. It also showed associations with gene expression in various tissues.
title: Bi-directional Mendelian randomization and multi-phenotype GWAS show causality and shared pathophysiology between depression and type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs10774625 was associated with coeliac disease, demonstrating genome-wide significant results in both the UK Biobank (p = 1.3 × 10^-6) and FinnGen (p = 2.1 × 10^-10). It was noted as a positive finding as it was significant in its own right.
title: Leveraging molecular-QTL co-association to predict novel disease-associated genetic loci using a graph convolutional neural network

finding: The variant rs183884396 in the TESPA1 locus showed a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP of 0.99) and was noted for its enrichment in the Finnish population, indicating a specific ancestral association. This variant was identified in the analysis of 78/101 loci that reached genome-wide significance, establishing its relevance to AD.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Identifies Novel Loci in Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The mQTL variant associated with high-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels, rs28577594, was found to be 4.2 times more prevalent in UKB-EUR (0.723) than in UKB-AFR (0.171), indicating implications for cardiovascular traits.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The SNP rs56350303 showed association with gene AC091814.2, reinforcing the observation of its importance in regulating immune traits pertinent to T1D.
title: Genetic factors affecting immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP at 12p13.33 was associated with lung cancer, extending the findings of earlier genome-wide studies.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The SNP rs5443 in GNB3 revealed a notable allele frequency difference of 0.238 across populations, emphasizing its importance in pharmacogenomics and potential implications for metabolizer phenotypes.
title: Diversity and level of evidence evaluation of commercial pharmacogenomic testing for mental health

finding: The SNP rs4149056-C allele within the solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 1B1 (SLCO1B1) was associated with an increased risk of simvastatin induced myopathy (muscle weakness). This relationship indicated that the presence of the rs4149056-C allele could predict adverse responses to statin therapy, particularly muscle-related side effects, substantiating its clinical relevance for dosage and treatment decisions.
title: Biobank scale pharmacogenomics informs the genetic underpinnings of simvastatin use

finding: The missense variant rs11057401 in the CCDC92 gene was associated with metabolic and inflammatory traits and was part of the analysis that established its connection with heart failure via its role in the NLRP3/inflammatory pathway. This further confirmed the genetic association with HFrEF, supported by mouse genetics.
title: Large-scale Mendelian randomization identifies novel pathways as therapeutic targets for heart failure with reduced ejection fraction and with preserved ejection fraction

finding: Reportedly exonic, this SNP was identified in both anxiety and major depression loci, indicating its relevance to both disorders. It also had a high CADD score, suggesting potential detrimental effects.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SH2B3 nonsynonymous SNP (rs3184504) was highlighted as a protective gene in both sexes. It was associated with numerous diagnoses including ischemic stroke, hypertension, and several autoimmune diseases. The gene exhibited a strong statistical signal related to systolic and diastolic blood pressure as well as LDL cholesterol levels. In established rodent models for salt-sensitive hypertension, a mutation in SH2B3 was linked to the attenuation of hypertension and renal disease, establishing its role in inflammatory signaling mechanisms contributing to hypertension.
title: Recessive and sex-dependent genetic effects in primary hypertension

finding: This variant was linked to testosterone levels with a beta value of 0.133 and a p-value of 2.34E-16, suggesting a strong association with obesity and its effects on testosterone.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP, associated with SOX5, emerged as a genome-wide significant hit in the AA GWAS meta-analysis but was not included in the Rotterdam Study. It has been highlighted for its critical role in joint morphogenesis and might relate to OA through this pathway. The findings were seen as contributing to understanding osteoarthritis development through cam morphology.
title: Investigation of the genetic architecture of cam morphology, and its relationship with hip osteoarthritis, using alpha angle as a proxy measure

finding: The chr12:91158410:T:C variant related to DCN was also noted as a novel association, prevalent in the Inuit population of Greenland, emphasizing its potential significance in local health-related outcomes.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit
