finding: The SNP rs1017301, located on Chromosome 12 at position 9210335, was identified as the top finding using the NetSHy score, demonstrating a significant association with the protein network (p = 2.38×10−13, MAF = 0.33). This finding underscored the effectiveness of the NetSHy approach in detecting important SNPs compared to conventional methods.
title: NetSHy: Network Summarization via a Hybrid Approach Leveraging Topological Properties

finding: The SNP rs76904798 was significantly associated with increased expression levels of the LRRK2 gene, linking it to Parkinson's disease risk. A phenome-wide association study identified 14 proteins associated with this variant, including notable proteins like GPNMB and GRN, which have previously been associated with PD risk.
title: Proteome Wide Association Studies of LRRK2 variants identify novel causal and druggable for Parkinson’s disease

finding: The VWF missense variant was associated with an increased risk of von Willebrand disease, although it was previously noted in ClinVar as having conflicting pathogenicity.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: This SNP featured prominently in both analyses and demonstrated a significant correlation with hypertension traits, indicating its potential importance.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs2456973 was identified as a highly pleiotropic variant, which was strongly associated with several hematological and anthropometric traits. Its presence significantly impacted the association between educational attainment (EDU) and the gene STX1B, which was initially detected by revTWMR. However, this association did not hold after correcting for pleiotropy, illustrating the complexity and challenges posed by pleiotropic effects in genetic analyses.
title: Differentially expressed genes reflect disease-induced rather than disease-causing changes in the transcriptome

finding: For the SNP rs56269265, transcript levels of RPS18 in the coronary artery were found to have a protective association against CAD, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.74 [95% CI: 0.68 – 0.81]. This protective effect was identified in the context of coronary artery tissue.
title: Integrative multi-ethnic Mendelian randomisation identifies tissue-specific causal genes for Coronary Artery Disease and interactions with post-acute Covid

finding: Lead variant rs10774671 had a clear increase in odds ratios for severe COVID-19 phenotypes despite not passing the statistical significance threshold, marking it as relevant for severity of COVID-19.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: This SNP was associated with C1s, another identified protein with potential implications in myocardial infarction.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs111337717 was confirmed as a rare intronic variant significantly more common in severe COVID-19 cases versus asymptomatic cases, thereby affirming its role as a potential genetic risk factor for severe outcomes of the disease.
title: Targeting ATP2B1 impairs PI3K/Akt/Fox-O3 signaling and reduces SARS-COV-2 replication in vivo

finding: The rs2279744 SNP in the MDM2 gene was associated with lung cancer risk in a Northeastern Chinese population, suggesting that this polymorphism may have implications for cancer susceptibility.
title: A Cost-effectiveness analysis of Nivolumab plus chemotherapy for the first-line treatment of locally advanced or metastatic gastric/GEJ/oesophageal adenocarcinoma in the United States of America

finding: The missense variant rs200735214 in DDX51 was linked to fat-free muscle volume of the right posterior thigh, showing an effect of -0.87 L and an effect size of -1.09 standard deviations (P = 1.5 × 10^-10). Further analysis also indicated association with total thigh fat-free muscle volume, suggesting DDX51's potential involvement in muscle composition.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The variant rs2239194 was shown to be an eQTL for spleen tissue and was linked to spleen volume through gene-level burden tests, which provided evidence for its regulatory role in spleen-related traits.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The study identified rs11172113, located in the LRP1-STAT6-SDR9C7 region on chromosome 12q13.3, as the most significantly associated locus for headaches, with a P value of 1.24 x 10^-62. This SNP was previously reported and linked to migraine mechanisms, particularly highlighting the role of LRP1 in glutamate receptor interactions which may influence migraine pathophysiology.
title: A meta-analysis of the genome-wide association studies on two genetically correlated phenotypes (self-reported headache and self-reported migraine) identifies four new risk loci for headaches (N=397,385)

finding: Also a rare variant with an effect size of OR > 2.1, showing association with VTE, underlining the significance of rare genetic variations.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: Within CUX2, this SNP had been associated with developmental and epileptic encephalopathy and highlights connections with thrombotic disorders through proximity.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The rs10774671 tag SNP was linked to the genes OAS1 and OAS3, where the haplotypes and variants associated with OAS1 were shown to impair its function, suggesting a strong role of the OAS/RNASEL axis in the severity of COVID-19.
title: Common, low-frequency, rare, and ultra-rare coding variants contribute to COVID-19 severity

finding: The rs1859330 polymorphism in OAS3 was associated with a decrease in interferon gamma production, potentially leading to increased susceptibility to viral infections and severity in COVID-19 cases.
title: Common, low-frequency, rare, and ultra-rare coding variants contribute to COVID-19 severity

finding: The SNP chr12:43573874:T:G corresponding to the gene ADAMTS20 was reported as one of the damaging variants that completely co-segregated with common variants in EFIGA families, suggesting it might contribute to the genetic basis of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Identification of Rare Damaging Missense and Loss of Function Variants in GWAS Loci Using Genome Sequencing Data from Two Cohorts of Familial Late-Onset Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs3003-T was identified as a csaQTL at locus 12p13.2, which associated with increased abundance of NK cells expressing TNF-α, IFN-γ, IL-2, and IL-6 response genes. This association had a p-value of 1.96×10^-11. Additionally, this SNP colocalized with an eQTL for KLRC1 and was associated with increased risk for psoriasis, indicated by a GWAS p-value of 4.17×10^-9. The findings suggested that the increased abundance of these cytokine-expressing NK cells might contribute to the elevated risk for psoriasis, which is a well-documented autoimmune disease that responds to anti-TNF treatments.
title: Identifying genetic variants that influence the abundance of cell states in single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs11053802-T was noted for its association with psoriasis, as it was identified by Tsoi et al. in their meta-analysis, with a GWAS p-value of 4.17×10^-9. The SNP was in linkage disequilibrium with rs3003 (LD 0.50), suggesting that both may share a similar underlying genetic effect related to autoimmune processes in psoriasis.
title: Identifying genetic variants that influence the abundance of cell states in single-cell data

finding: It was newly flagged as significant after tracking H3K27ac values, indicating its role in immune response associated with asthma.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP rs2072579 was confirmed to be homozygous G/G in the PGP1 induced pluripotent stem cell line and homozygous C/C in the HEK293 cell line. The editing outcomes related to this SNP were simulated by mixing different ratios of these two cell lines, which allowed for robust analysis of CRISPR edits using the ICE method. The predictions from the ICE analysis showed a high correlation with the expected editing percentages, thereby validating the effectiveness of the ICE tool in analyzing variants specifically at the rs2072579 locus.
title: Inference of CRISPR Edits from Sanger Trace Data

finding: SNP rs1025607 was found associated with the hardness trait of tubers, further contributing to the understanding of genetic factors controlling quality attributes in yam.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: The SNP rs1038631 was associated with the hardness of yam tubers, contributing to the insights into the genetic factors affecting food quality.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: The study found that rs1800693 regulated the skipping of exon 6 in TNFRSF1A across 35 tissues. Previous studies using in vitro minigene splicing assays indicated that the G allele of rs1800693 led to the skipping of exon 6.
title: Junction-skipping regulation in complex disease

finding: The rs76904798 variant in the LRRK2 promoter was found to increase the risk of idiopathic Parkinson's disease (iPD) independently of LRRK2 missense mutations. This finding highlighted the importance of promoter variants in iPD risk, contributing to our understanding of genetic factors implicated in the disease.
title: Single molecule array measures of LRRK2 kinase activity in serum link Parkinson’s disease severity to peripheral inflammation

finding: The SNP rs11574077, which pertains to the VDR gene, was also found to be associated with gastrointestinal toxicity during FOLFIRI treatment in metastatic colorectal cancer patients. This association indicates the critical role of VDR in modulating the microbiome and its impact on cancer-related outcomes.
title: Vitamin D receptor protects against dysbiosis and tumorigenesis via the JAK/STAT pathway in intestine

finding: The common polymorphism rs11614913 in Hsa-miR-196a2 was reported to affect lung cancer risk, suggesting that this SNP has a significant association with cancer predisposition.
title: Somatic mutations in miRNA genes in lung cancer – potential functional consequences of non-coding sequence variants

finding: The SNP rs3741869 was identified as a significant finding with a GWAS p-value of 3.2E-05. It was located in OASIS locus 12p11.21 and found to be a cis-eQTL regulating expression of the gene <italic>DDX11</italic>, with a p-value of 8.62E-05. Additionally, <italic>DDX11</italic> was significantly downregulated in both the GEO and Cordoba SLE expression datasets, confirming its potential role in systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
title: Genomic convergence of locus-based GWAS meta-analysis identifies DDX11 as a novel Systemic Lupus Erythematosus gene

finding: This SNP was identified as one of six Denisovan TFBS-disrupting aSNPs regulating OAS2 and OAS3, where archaic alleles segregated at frequencies between 0.33 and 0.39 in Papuans, while west Indonesians were fixed for the reference allele. This allele was predicted to alter transcription factor binding.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: Like rs370899715, this SNP was part of the cluster affecting OAS2 and OAS3 gene regulation, displaying similar allele frequency patterns across populations, indicating its potential role in immune response regulation.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: This SNP was also among the six Denisovan aSNPs linked to the regulation of OAS2 and OAS3, with the alternative archaic allele present in Papuans, thereby supporting the idea of adaptation through archaic admixture.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: This SNP was part of the regulatory cluster affecting OAS2 and OAS3 genes, and showed consistent segregation patterns indicative of differential expression between Papuans and western Indonesians.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: Identified as one of the six Denisovan variants affecting OAS2 and OAS3 regulation, this SNP demonstrated archaic variant segregation in Papuans at significant frequencies relative to western Indonesian populations.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: This SNP was included in the group regulating OAS2 and OAS3, where archaic alleles segregated in the Papuan population, suggesting it contributes to phenotypic variation related to immune response.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: The SNP rs7955964, located in the FIGNL2/ANKRD33 gene region, showed significant 1df interactions with long sleep duration (LTST) in a study involving 62,969 individuals. It was replicated in an additional 59,296 individuals, indicating its association with elevated blood pressure (BP) possibly through its role in circadian rhythms and neurohormonal regulation.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide gene-sleep interactions identify novel loci for blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs79755767 was shown to be associated with NFE2, which affected the expression of 134 genes. This SNP's regulatory effects reinforced the understanding of NFE2 as a hemostatic transcription factor influencing platelet and megakaryocyte development.
title: Discovery of target genes and pathways of blood trait loci using pooled CRISPR screens and single cell RNA sequencing

finding: The rs215226 SNP in the B4GALNT3 region was found to be associated with serum sclerostin levels (β = 0.205 SD change in serum sclerostin per A allele, P = 4.6 x 10^-49) and showed a strong positive association with B4GALNT3 gene expression in arterial and ovarian tissues, establishing it as a positive and original finding related to bone mineral density.
title: Mendelian Randomization analysis reveals a causal influence of circulating sclerostin levels on bone mineral density and fractures

finding: The SNP rs3176789 was linked to alterations in transcription factor binding critical for the regulation of genes associated with T1D, notably through its effects on CD69.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: This variant was found to significantly impact the expression of the CD69 gene and its regulatory network, suggesting its importance in T1D.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: The SNP rs1012994 was identified as a liver-specific eQTL, associated with the gene GLT1D1. This finding highlighted the expression regulation of GLT1D1 in liver tissue specifically.
title: Mechanisms of tissue-specific genetic regulation revealed by latent factors across eQTLs

finding: SLCO1B1 rs4149056 was linked to increased SN-38 concentration in metastatic colorectal cancer patients, indicating its role in predicting drug response.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The study found that obese individuals carrying a C allele in the rs1878022 polymorphism of the ERV1/ChemR23 receptor experienced a protective effect against adipose tissue inflammation. This finding highlighted the significant role of host genetics in the response to specialized pro-resolving mediators (SPMs) such as RvE1, indicating potential variability in therapeutic efficacy based on genetic profiles.
title: Targeting the resolvin E1 - eicosapentaenoic acid axis improves hyperinsulinemia and hyperglycemia in a host genetic dependent manner

finding: For rs11111794, it was found to be associated with the use of HDAC inhibitors in acute myeloid leukemia. The study indicated that this SNP could influence the responsiveness of leukemia cells to HDACi treatment, further implicating its role in chromatin modifications related to this malignancy.
title: Exogenous and endogenous HDAC inhibitor effects in Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome models

finding: The association of this SNP was reported as a second replicated rQTL for CD69 with NFATC1, further enhancing the understanding of protein interactions related to nfATC1 and drug targets for immunosuppression.
title: Genetic associations with ratios between protein levels detect new pQTLs and reveal protein-protein interactions

finding: The study found that the TPH2 SNP rs4570625 (703G/T) significantly moderated the association between childhood maltreatment (CM) exposure and punishment sensitivity. TT carriers exhibited increased brain volumes in thalamic-limbic-prefrontal circuits associated with higher CM exposure, leading to heightened sensitivity to punishment, indicating a phenotype of facilitated threat avoidance.
title: Serotonin and childhood maltreatment interact to shape brain architecture and anxious avoidant behavior – a TPH2 imaging genetics approach

finding: The variant rs11055880 was identified as part of a candidate regulatory element associated with the ATF7IP gene. The presence of the protective allele at this SNP led to a significant increase in ATF7IP promoter activity, demonstrating a functional role in breast cancer risk modulation. The introduction of this variant as a part of the protective haplotype increased luciferase activity by 9-fold.
title: CRISPR screens identify gene targets and drug repositioning opportunities at breast cancer risk loci

finding: The variant rs16909788, along with other SNPs, was shown to alter the promoter activity of ATF7IP. When the protective allele was introduced, the luciferase activity was increased, while the risk-associated alleles did not elicit the same effect, indicating its role in promoting ATF7IP expression, which is linked to breast cancer risk.
title: CRISPR screens identify gene targets and drug repositioning opportunities at breast cancer risk loci

finding: Similar to rs16909788, rs17221259 was also part of the regulatory effect on ATF7IP expression. The introduction of this SNP in the context of the risk-associated allele did not change luciferase activity, reinforcing the connection between this SNP and the risk of breast cancer through its influence on ATF7IP.
title: CRISPR screens identify gene targets and drug repositioning opportunities at breast cancer risk loci

finding: The rs3184504 polymorphism was identified as a key variant associated with an increased risk for type 1 diabetes (T1D). This variant encodes a hypomorphic SH2B3 protein, leading to a dysfunction in T cell tolerance mechanisms. In mouse models, SH2B3 deficiency resulted in enhanced survival and pathogenicity of CD8+ T cells, promoting islet destruction and accelerating diabetes onset, thus confirming its significant role in the pathology of T1D.
title: Reduced function of the adaptor SH2B3 promotes T1D via altered gc cytokine-regulated, T cell intrinsic immune tolerance

finding: This SNP is linked to the PR interval (P = 7.62 x 10^-13) and shows looping interaction with the TBX3 gene, a cardiac specific transcription factor.
title: Detailed Regulatory Interaction Map of the Human Heart Facilitates Gene Discovery for Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The variant rs11045818 was identified as a synonymous introgressed ESM in SLCO1B1, with a high PIP for total bilirubin. The derived allele was found fixed in Neanderthals and suggested potential binding sites for splicing factors, affecting gene function.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The variant rs17730088 was indicated as an adaptively introgressed intronic variant in KRT71 linked to balding type 4. This variant was part of an introgressed haplotype affecting splicing and phenotype.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: This SNP was associated with increased risk for colorectal cancer as identified in a study that analyzed the CYP27B1 gene polymorphism in patients diagnosed with colorectal cancer.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The T allele at rs7296418 decreased gene expression variability of the ARL6IP4 gene in T cells treated with PHA plus dexamethasone but not in PHA condition. ARL6IP4 was associated with multiple sclerosis and allergic rhinitis.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The LPCAT3 SNP rs60015123 was associated with increased protein decay and showed significant correlation with lower hemolytic propensity, particularly upon osmotic insult in both index and recalled donor cohorts.
title: Ferroptosis regulates hemolysis in stored murine and human red blood cells

finding: The SNP rs4765623 was included in a functional enhancer associated with SCARB1. It exhibited enhancer activity confirmed by H3K27ac ChIP analysis and was shown to result in higher SCARB1 expression in a heterozygous cell line model. The C allele of this SNP was linked with greater enhancer activity, marking it as a significant genetic contributor in RCC.
title: Allelic imbalance reveals widespread germline-somatic regulatory differences and prioritizes risk loci in Renal Cell Carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs4765621, in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs4765623, contributed to the functional regulatory landscape of SCARB1. Its presence in the same enhancer peak reinforced the regulatory role of this genomic region in RCC expression profiles.
title: Allelic imbalance reveals widespread germline-somatic regulatory differences and prioritizes risk loci in Renal Cell Carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs5888 was identified as a relevant heterozygous reporter SNP located in exon 8 of SCARB1. Measurement of allelic imbalance showed that the A allele was associated with higher SCARB1 expression, demonstrating its role in modulating the expression levels of this cancer-related gene.
title: Allelic imbalance reveals widespread germline-somatic regulatory differences and prioritizes risk loci in Renal Cell Carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs697221 was noted to cause a missense change in the DDIT3 gene, which was associated with the contextual signaling feature ERK·MK2. This feature was predictive of sensitivity to PI3K-targeted inhibitors like pictilisib, uprosertib, and taselisib, thereby linking the genetic variation to functional drug response.
title: Deciphering the Signaling Network Landscape of Breast Cancer Improves Drug Sensitivity Prediction

finding: The SNP OAS2/rs15895-A presented an increased frequency from sub-Saharan Africa to Latin America, possibly playing a role in the immune response against Zika virus.
title: Hypothetical Human Immune Genome Complex Gradient May Help to Explain the Congenital Zika Symdrome Catastrophe in Brazil: A New Theory

finding: Located in the promoter of DDX11, the alternative allele disrupted the ETV5 motif, leading to reduced acetylation and diminished expression of DDX11.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The rs1006737 SNP in the CACNA1C gene was identified as a main risk variant that interacted with early-life stress to influence the cortisol-awakening response, which is a key indicator of HPA axis activity. Studies indicated that this SNP significantly altered the risk for developing depressive symptoms and bipolar disorder, establishing a connection between CACNA1C variants, stress exposure, and neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Reduced gene dosage of the psychiatric risk gene Cacna1c is associated with impairments in hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis activity in rats

finding: The derived T allele of rs11614913 in hsa-miR-196a-3p was associated with a decreased risk of multiple cancers, including breast and gastrointestinal cancers, especially in Asian populations, revealing significant population differentiation in cancer risk.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: This SNP was a splice region variant in COL2A1, linked to Stickler Syndrome. It was involved in downregulating PFKM expression levels in the cerebellum, showcasing a connection to changes in craniofacial structure.
title: Derived Homo sapiens cis-eQTL regulation: implications for brain evolution

finding: This SNP acted as a downregulating eQTL related to Stickler Syndrome, affecting PFKM expression levels in the cerebellum. It underscored the genetic factors influencing craniofacial developmental disorders.
title: Derived Homo sapiens cis-eQTL regulation: implications for brain evolution

finding: The SNP rs16917496 correlated with colorectal cancer in a study of the Iranian population. This finding was significant as it linked a polymorphism at the miR-502 binding site of the Lysine Methyltransferase 5A (SET8) with CRC, which is relevant given SET8's role in oncogenic signaling pathways.
title: APC coordinates GSK3 phosphorylation of SETD8 to suppress colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs7975232 (ApaI) was positively associated with a decreased risk of pulmonary tuberculosis in overall and African populations, but not in Asian populations, according to a meta-analysis conducted by Areeshi et al. in 2017.
title: Reassessing the association of VDR and its polymorphisms with tuberculosis in global populations

finding: The SNP rs76895963 was identified as causal and was associated with type-2 diabetes (T2D). It had a rare allele that was linked to reduced susceptibility in GWAS studies. This variant was also noted to be pleiotropic for HbA1c levels in blood, suggesting its significant role in influencing both T2D susceptibility and glycemic control.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: The rs2228570 variant of the vitamin D receptor gene was associated with sporadic essential tremor. This finding indicated a link between essential tremor and vitamin D receptor polymorphism, suggesting potential genetic influences on dyskinetic movements.
title: Amelioration of L-DOPA-induced dyskinesia with vitamin D3 in Parkinsonian mice model

finding: The SNP rs1156242 was linked to intron levels of FAR2, which encodes a fatty acid reductase enzyme. It colocalized with a GWAS variant for interleukin-27 levels, suggesting a role in the regulation of this cytokine.
title: Disentangling genetic effects on transcriptional and post-transcriptional gene regulation through integrating exon and intron expression QTLs

finding: The SNP rs3184504 was identified as strongly associated with hundreds of different traits through GWAS Catalog data. In the context of stroke and LDL-C (Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol), it contributed to the detection of two modes when analyzing the relationship under stringent p-value thresholds. However, the analysis indicated that removing rs3184504 caused the disappearance of one identified mode, suggesting that this SNP was likely an outlier rather than indicative of a broader pleiotropic pathway. This finding highlighted the complexities involved in interpreting genetic associations, particularly when multi-modality was observed in risk factor-disease pairs.
title: Causal inference for heritable phenotypic risk factors using heterogeneous genetic instruments

finding: The SNP associated with celiac disease increased in frequency for approximately 9,000 years, indicating it was subject to long-term selection contrary to earlier beliefs.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: This SNP linked to rheumatoid arthritis has risen in frequency for about 9,000 years, reinforcing the notion of prolonged selection in the context of autoimmune diseases.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The study by Giusti et al. (2014) identified that the rs1466535 polymorphism in the LRP1 gene was associated with carotid artery disease. This correlation indicated that variations in LRP1 could influence the risk of developing atherosclerosis, thereby linking genetic factors to vascular disease pathology.
title: Thymosin β4 preserves vascular smooth muscle phenotype in atherosclerosis via regulation of Low Density Lipoprotein Related Protein 1 (LRP1)

finding: The rs35907548 SNP was identified as a likely regulatory variant within an active enhancer of the SLC15A4 gene, demonstrating significant association with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). The risk allele T increased enhancer activity and target gene expression, impacting endolysosomal pH regulation. This association was validated through luciferase assays, ChIP-qPCR, and CRISPR/Cas9 technology, resulting in markedly dysregulated endolysosomal acidification in knockout cells.
title: A Non-Coding Variant in SLC15A4 Modulates Enhancer Activity and Lysosomal Deacidification Linked to Lupus Susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs4766664 was identified as a protective variant against severe COVID-19, with a p-value of 5.7e-9, and it was associated with a ~14% reduction in hospitalization risk (OR = 0.86, 95% CI: 0.82-0.91). This SNP is notable for its protective effect inherited from Neandertals.
title: A genetic variant protective for COVID-19 is inherited from Neanderthals

finding: SNP rs10774671, modifying a splice acceptor site in the OAS1 gene, was recognized as a functionally important Neandertal variant. It was linked to protection against West Nile Virus (OR = 0.63, 95% CI: 0.5-0.83), thereby marking it as a positive original finding relevant to viral infections.
title: A genetic variant protective for COVID-19 is inherited from Neanderthals

finding: The missense variant rs2660 in OAS1 was previously associated with moderate to strong protection against SARS-CoV (OR = 0.42, 95% CI: 0.20-0.89), making it a significant positive original finding concerning antiviral response.
title: A genetic variant protective for COVID-19 is inherited from Neanderthals

finding: The missense variant rs1127787 within MRPS35 was identified as being significantly linked with chronotype, indicating its association with circadian rhythm traits.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: The maximum archaic allele for rs142658135 in AMIGO2 has been linked with schizophrenia and bipolar disorder and was found to have undergone positive selection.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: The SNP rs190280601 found in DNM1L has been associated with schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, demonstrating elevated allele frequencies linked to adaptive introgression.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: The variant rs2241322 within TSPAN11 has connections with schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, contributing to understanding its introgressive status.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: Variant rs76693329 within TSPAN11 was noted for its association with mental health disorders, consistent with prior findings about archaic contributions.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: The rs7953706 eQTL for DDX11 reduced transcriptional activity by impacting a repressive sequence associated with the DREAM complex, showing a nuanced role in gene regulation.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: The variant rs111939932 was associated with nucleus accumbens volume and demonstrated effects on the shape of this structure. It was classified as an eQTL for ATP5G2 in the nucleus accumbens and basal ganglia, marking it as a significant finding related to brain morphology.
title: Genetic variants for head size share genes and pathways with cancer

finding: The variant rs12146713 in region 12q23.3 was significantly associated with multiple FA measures. This finding highlighted its influence in white matter microstructure traits.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The SNP rs11060784 was linked to the regulation of Nerve Growth Factor (NGF) which was shown to induce proliferation and aggressiveness in prostate cancer (PCa) cells, highlighting its potential role in the pathogenesis of PCa, particularly in the context of chronic inflammation as discussed in the study.
title: Chronic IL-1 exposure drives LNCaP cells to evolve androgen and AR independence

finding: The SNP rs1391721 was found to promote allele-specific open chromatin and was associated with the binding of GATA3 in MCF7 breast cancer cells. ChIP-seq data indicated preferential GATA3 recruitment to the risk allele, suggesting a mechanistic role for this SNP in breast cancer gene regulation.
title: Chromatin interactome mapping at 139 independent breast cancer risk signals

finding: The risk allele T of SNP rs12817989 correlated with lower SMC proliferation responses, and higher expression of FGD6 in proliferative SMCs, indicating a potential regulatory role in CAD.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: The p.Arg151Trp variant, corresponding to rs577400960, was found at the beginning of the DHX37 protein sequence and was classified as possibly deleterious by four in-silico prediction tools. Although it was identified in a heterozygous state in the 1000 Genomes Project and among Brazilian controls, with an allele frequency of 0.02% (1 in 5007), it was not detected in the ABraOM-Brazilian Genomic Variants and Brazilian in-house control groups.
title: DEAH-box helicase 37 (DHX37) defects are a novel molecular etiology of 46,XY gonadal dysgenesis spectrum

finding: SNP rs10743430 was identified as causing moderate to major structural changes in the lncRNA, as per the consensus results of RNA structure prediction servers.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: SNP rs1373453 altered binding motifs, resulting in SFRS1 and SFRS9 differentially binding to the mutant lncRNA, indicating structural significance.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The SNP rs324017 was found to be associated with the gene NAB2, which is implicated in stress-induced neuroprotective maintenance. This gene association was further significant as NAB2 is the downstream target of the SCZ drug cinnarizine. The finding contributed to understanding the regulatory mechanisms involved in schizophrenia (SCZ).
title: Unveiling causal regulatory mechanisms through cell-state parallax

finding: The rs368816473 variant was identified as having the potential to disrupt transcription factor binding sites (TFBS) associated with genes such as OAS2 and OAS3. It was observed to segregate at frequencies of 0.2 to 0.4 in Papuans, suggesting adaptive significance in immune responses.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: The rs139804868 variant showed a significant reduction in transcriptional activity when compared to modern human alleles. It was predicted to affect transcription factors involved in immune B cell differentiation, with archaic alleles found in Papuans.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: rs143462183 was predicted to impact transcription factor binding but lacked specific experimental validation details. Nevertheless, it segregated within Papuan populations at notable frequencies.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: This SNP was included in the set of SNPs associated with the regulation of OAS2 and OAS3, showing potential contributions to immune responses akin to the other Denisovan variants documented.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: rs838880 was associated with medium high-density lipoprotein (M-HDL-P), large high-density lipoprotein (L-HDL-P), extra large high-density lipoprotein (XL-HDL-P), high-density lipoprotein diameter (HDL-D), apolipoprotein A1 (ApoA1), and high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C). It had a negative association with coronary artery disease (CAD), suggesting a protective effect against the condition.
title: A Mendelian randomization study of the role of lipoprotein subfractions in coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs887304, located within the EFCAB4B gene, was identified as significantly associated with lobular inflammation in patients with NAFLD. In a study examining monozygotic twins who both developed NASH cirrhosis, both carried the heterozygous genotype for this SNP. Additionally, it was reported as one of 19 SNPs significantly associated with NAFLD in a pilot study within an Indian population.
title: RNAseq analysis reveals transcriptome changes associated with the progression of non-alcoholic liver disease in livers from Efcab4b knockout mice

finding: The SNP rs76895963, which is a conserved intronic SNP located in a promoter of the gene CCND2, was fine-mapped for traits including bone mineral density, height, red blood cell count, systolic blood pressure, and triglycerides. The gene CCND2 is involved in cell cycle regulation and associated with delayed psychomotor development.
title: Functionally-informed fine-mapping and polygenic localization of complex trait heritability

finding: An interactive association was observed between the intronic polymorphism (rs10506151) of the LRRK2 gene and type 2 diabetes, suggesting implications for neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The lead SNP rs73264680 was found to be associated with RBC levels of various lysophospholipids, such as those containing linoleyl- (18:2) and palmitoyl (16:0) fatty acids. This SNP was in perfect linkage disequilibrium with the missense mutation rs1984564/I217T within the LPCAT3 gene.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: The missense mutation rs1984564/I217T, associated with SNP rs73264680, was linked to RBC levels of lysophospholipids in the context of LPCAT3, demonstrating an important genetic correlation with metabolite levels.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: The SNP rs55958994 was associated with the regulation of multiple gene expressions through long-range chromatin interactions, influencing tumor progression in prostate cancer. The study indicated that this variant played a significant role in determining prostate cancer risk.
title: CTCF-binding element regulates ESC differentiation via orchestrating long-range chromatin interaction between enhancers and HoxA

finding: The SNP rs2860482[A] was reported to be associated with atrial fibrillation. It was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium (R2 = 0.85) with the reference allele of a variable number tandem repeat (VNTR) in the NACA gene, suggesting that the multi-allelic SV in NACA was likely responsible for the observed associations with atrial fibrillation.
title: Long read sequencing of 3,622 Icelanders provides insight into the role of structural variants in human diseases and other traits

finding: The SNP rs7978685[T] was also reported to be associated with atrial fibrillation. Similar to rs2860482, this SNP was in strong LD (R2 = 0.85) with the reference allele of the VNTR in NACA, reinforcing the implication that the multi-allelic SV in NACA contributed to the association with atrial fibrillation.
title: Long read sequencing of 3,622 Icelanders provides insight into the role of structural variants in human diseases and other traits

finding: The SNP rs11060758 was identified in the context of Sema4F as a key regulator of tumorigenesis in glioblastoma (GBM). This finding related to the influence of neurons on tumor progression and infiltration, specifically highlighting the role of axon guidance genes, which include Sema4F. The study showed that Sema4F was associated with activity-dependent infiltration of tumors and facilitated bidirectional signaling between tumor cells and neurons, contributing to the malignant progression of GBM.
title: Remote neuronal activity drives glioma infiltration via Sema4f

finding: The SNP rs11111664 was associated with IL-33 driven eosinophil activities, particularly in promoting adhesion to cancer cells and facilitating degranulation, which contributed to tumor cell killing. This finding highlighted its role in eosinophil function and their interaction with cancer cells, correlating with the cytokine's influence on the eosinophil phosphoproteome.
title: Molecular anatomy of eosinophil activation by IL5 and IL33

finding: The association between rs10772420 (p.Arg299Cys) in TAS2R19 and coffee intake was established (details on specific p-values not provided) as it impacted bitterness perception.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: Variants in TAS2R31 were associated with tea intake, supporting the role of taste receptors in dietary preferences.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs11060819 was associated with the finding that Wee1, rather than Plk1, was inhibited by AZD1775 at therapeutically relevant concentrations. This study indicated a selective inhibition mechanism of AZD1775, highlighting its potential clinical implications in cancer treatment.
title: Development of Cell Permeable NanoBRET Probes for the Measurement of PLK1 Target Engagement in Live Cells

finding: The SNP rs1847461 was associated with smoking behaviour and was found to overlap a GWAS haplotype block. Seven novel multi-exonic transcripts were identified at this locus, with all splice junctions confirmed by Illumina short-read sequencing. The transcripts exhibited highly conserved exons and two transcription start sites supported by CAGE peaks.
title: Targeted, High-resolution RNA Sequencing of Non-coding Genomic Regions Associated with Neuropsychiatric Functions

finding: The SNP rs11050678 was associated with findings related to the metabolism of cysteine in tumor proliferation and survival. In the study, it was reported that in normal tissues, cystine uptake and its metabolism were critical for maintaining the cysteine pool, which was essential for the survival of cancer cells. Specifically, the study underlined that tumors showed either inactive or downregulated cysteine synthesis, making cystine a major contributor to cysteine metabolism in these settings.
title: The Origin of Cysteine and its Catabolism in Mammalian Tissues and Tumors

finding: The SNP rs2072449 was associated with the gene expression of C3AR1. This finding was highlighted in the context of cell-type specific chromatin landscapes and accessibility at the putative enhancers for C3AR1 in peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC). The analysis demonstrated a significant enhancer-promoter pair relationship linked to this SNP.
title: SnapATAC: A Comprehensive Analysis Package for Single Cell ATAC-seq

finding: The rs3741605 variant (T>C) was associated with delayed age at natural menopause (ANM) and was located in the putative promoter of the HELB gene, which encodes DNA helicase B. This gene was active across multiple ovarian cell types, including stromal, endothelial, theca, granulosa, and immune cells. The C allele of rs3741605 was significantly correlated with increased HELB expression in the human ovary, suggesting that this functional non-coding variant may contribute to delayed ANM by upregulating a critical DNA repair gene, resulting in improved genome maintenance.
title: The regulatory landscapes of human ovarian ageing

finding: The SNP rs6538618 was found to be in high LD with endometriosis risk SNPs shared with ovarian cancer risk on chromosome 12q22 and situated in a bidirectional promoter region for the genes VEZT and FGD6, showing relevance to gene regulation in endometrial tissues.
title: Global Endometrial DNA Multi-omics Analysis Reveals Insights into mQTL Regulation and Associated Endometriosis Disease Risk

finding: The SNP rs11111728 was identified in the context of cancer biology as it relates to the TYK2 gene, which serves as an upstream kinase of STATs. The study demonstrated that this SNP has a significant involvement in cancer progression, contributing to the understanding of its genetic associations with tumor dynamics.
title: Identifying common transcriptome signatures of cancer by interpreting deep learning models

finding: SNP rs1585897 showed evidence of lower SA across various areas of association cortex in the ADHD context, reflecting its influence.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs11112594 showed a correlation with enhanced thickness in the perisylvian cortex in anxiety, further indicating its relevance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs11147235 was associated with lower SA in the perirhinal cortex in ASD, further indicating its significance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs2049114 indicated lower SA in the inferior parietal cortex for PTSD, which further underscores its significance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs1006737 was found to significantly confer risk for bipolar disorder (BD), schizophrenia (SCZ), and autism spectrum disorder (ASD). It lies within intron 3 of the CACNA1C gene, a non-coding region, and was associated with altered gene expression, which may contribute to the mechanisms underlying these psychiatric disorders.
title: Functional characterisation of single nucleotide variants of the psychiatric risk gene cacna1c in the zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs4765905 was reported to affect interactions with the promoter region of the CACNA1C gene, leading to alterations in its expression. This finding further highlighted the role of such variants in the expression changes linked to clinical presentations of psychiatric disorders.
title: Functional characterisation of single nucleotide variants of the psychiatric risk gene cacna1c in the zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs1131017 was identified as a co-eQTL affecting the co-expression of the gene RPS26 with other ribosomal genes, particularly impacting T cell activation and autoimmune disease-associated genes. The study provided robust evidence linking this SNP to several autoimmune diseases, such as rheumatoid arthritis and Crohn's disease, underlining its role in the molecular mechanisms underlying these conditions.
title: Identification of genetic variants that impact gene co-expression relationships using large-scale single-cell data

finding: The risk allele at rs11168249 was associated with higher NFKB1 target gene expression in non-inflamed settings within certain clusters. However, it did not affect NFKB1 target gene expression significantly during inflammation, indicating a protective but context-dependent role.
title: A systems genomics approach to uncover patient-specific pathogenic pathways and proteins in a complex disease

finding: The SNP rs3184504 was identified as a missense variant in the SH2B3 gene, and it was reported in correlation with the platelet phenotype. This variant represented a new finding in the context of platelet studies.
title: Multi-resolution localization of causal variants across the genome

finding: The SNP rs72650673 was also noted as a missense variant within the SH2B3 gene and was associated with the platelet trait. This represented a previously unreported association with platelet count or function.
title: Multi-resolution localization of causal variants across the genome

finding: The SNP rs1029388, described as an intron variant in the ATXN2 gene, was linked with the platelet phenotype. This finding was confirmed as having not been previously associated with this trait.
title: Multi-resolution localization of causal variants across the genome

finding: The rs2287218 SNP was associated with an increased risk of coronary heart disease and ischemic stroke. This finding was established through a case-control study, highlighting its relevance in the etiology of cardiovascular conditions.
title: Quantitative Proteomic Profiling of Murine Embryonic Heart Development Reveals a Role for the Mevalonate Pathway in Cardiomyocyte Proliferation

finding: The SNP rs11050678 was associated with variations in glutathione levels, which in turn were implicated in the regulation of lipid abundance in liver tissue. The study reported that GSH (glutathione) is essential for maintaining lipid levels and that its imbalance can affect lipogenic enzyme expression and fat store levels, hence highlighting the relevance of rs11050678 in modulating these pathways in the context of oxidative stress and lipid metabolism.
title: Glutathione supports lipid abundance in vivo

finding: The SNP rs2057778 showed a significant association with the expression of OAS1 specifically in patrolling non-classical monocytes, indicating how severe COVID-19 risk variants can impact immune responses by influencing antiviral gene expression.
title: COVID-19 genetic risk variants are associated with expression of multiple genes in diverse immune cell types

finding: The SNP rs2010604 was associated with the expression of the neighboring gene DTX1 specifically in naive B cells. This variant indicated the role of genetic modulation of DTX1, a gene involved in regulating NOTCH activity, potentially impacting B cell functions in COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 genetic risk variants are associated with expression of multiple genes in diverse immune cell types

finding: Index SNP rs112581165 was associated with downregulation of 10 TE families, including the L1 family, across genotyping analysis. It demonstrated significant negative effects on TE expressions, as noted in GSEA.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate Regulators of LINE-1 RNA Levels in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The SNP rs34637584 was identified as a known missense variant in the LRRK2 gene (G2019S), which has been associated with Parkinson's disease (PD). This variant was part of the top variants identified in the patient group compared to controls, highlighting its significance in PD risk.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs202134984, located in the PTPRB gene, was found to be significantly enriched in GBA1-N409S carriers compared to all other cases. Its association was highlighted following the Cohort Allelic Sums Test (CAST) analysis.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The rs10774671 A/G SNP was found to control the production of different splicing isoforms of OAS1, which is integral to the antiviral response against SARS-CoV-2. The G allele of this SNP was associated with the production of the active p46 isoform, while the A allele led to the alternative splicing generating less active forms. This finding is significant as it links the SNP's allelic variation to differential activities of the OAS1 enzyme in response to RNA structures from SARS-CoV-2, suggesting a genetic influence on COVID-19 severity.
title: Switching of OAS1 splicing isoforms mitigates SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: Identified as a caQTL active in all immune cell types but exhibiting significant effects specifically in CD8+ T cells (π=0.76, q-value=1.4×10^-4), suggesting a nuanced role across different cell types.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: The study indicated that the SNP rs3033405 was associated with microvessel density and the expression of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF) and alpha-smooth muscle actin (a-SMA) in different regions of human gastrointestinal carcinomas. This finding underscored the relevance of this genetic variation in the context of tumor vascularization and healing processes.
title: Engineering Antioxidant and Oxygen-Releasing Lignin Composites to Accelerate Wound Healing

finding: The SNP rs1169301 was involved in cleavage efficiency during the mutation analysis of the HNF1A gene. It was linked to altered function in the HNF1A protein due to its positioning 102 bp from the PAM sequence of sgRNA#14, evidenced by the mutations observed in heterozygous clonal lines.
title: Human stem cell model of HNF1A deficiency shows uncoupled insulin to C-peptide secretion with accumulation of abnormal insulin granules

finding: The SNP rs2071190 was similarly implicated in the mutation outcomes of the HNF1A gene. It was located 130 bp from the PAM sequence of sgRNA#14 and was noted in the context of homozygous lines, suggesting potential large deletions related to these mutations, as indicated by the absence of multiple linked SNPs.
title: Human stem cell model of HNF1A deficiency shows uncoupled insulin to C-peptide secretion with accumulation of abnormal insulin granules

finding: The study identified rs4765621 as a tumor-specific QTL (tsQTL) with a very low false discovery rate (FDR = 6.02×10^-8) that co-localized with a genome-wide significant risk variant for SCARB1 (p-value = 3.33×10^-12). The finding highlighted its association with kidney cancer risk, supporting the role of SCARB1 in tumor biology.
title: A novel method to identify cell-type specific regulatory variants and their role in cancer risk

finding: The study confirmed that rs4765623 was in perfect linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs4765621 and exhibited tumor-specific enhancer activity validated in a clear cell renal cell carcinoma cell line. The study emphasized that the C risk allele was associated with increased chromatin activity, aligning with its biological function in cancer risk related to SCARB1.
title: A novel method to identify cell-type specific regulatory variants and their role in cancer risk

finding: Found in a study of 2,244 critically ill COVID-19 patients, this SNP was located on 12q24.13, within a gene cluster that includes antiviral restriction enzymes OAS1, OAS2, and OAS3, thus linking it to COVID-19 severity.
title: Human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 severity are enriched in immune and epithelium regulatory networks

finding: At the PDE3A gene, rs11045172 was marked as the first signal in the HDL-C GWAS, demonstrating significant colocalization with eQTL data, which highlights its role in lipid metabolism.
title: Adipose tissue eQTL meta-analysis reveals the contribution of allelic heterogeneity to gene expression regulation and cardiometabolic traits

finding: The second signal rs2044315 at PDE3A was linked with the HDL-C trait and represented the second colocalized signal indicating complex regulatory mechanisms in lipid homeostasis.
title: Adipose tissue eQTL meta-analysis reveals the contribution of allelic heterogeneity to gene expression regulation and cardiometabolic traits

finding: In relation to the PDE3A gene, rs11045237, the third signal, was directly associated with variations in HDL-C levels, further linking genetic variants to lipid phenotypes.
title: Adipose tissue eQTL meta-analysis reveals the contribution of allelic heterogeneity to gene expression regulation and cardiometabolic traits

finding: The fourth signal, rs7134150, also at PDE3A, was significant in the analysis of lipid traits, showcasing its involvement in the expression regulation of associated genes.
title: Adipose tissue eQTL meta-analysis reveals the contribution of allelic heterogeneity to gene expression regulation and cardiometabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs11053646, located in the OLR1 gene and identified as a missense variant (K167N), exhibited a sex-specific association with carotid atherosclerotic plaque in individuals of Dominican descent. In sex-stratified analyses, this variant was significantly associated with plaque presence and all plaque sub-phenotypes in women (odds ratio between 2.44 and 5.86; P values ranging from 3×10^-4 to 8×10^-3), while showing no significant association in men (odds ratio between 0.85 and 1.22; P values from 0.77 to 0.92), illustrating its regulatory effects were dependent on sex.
title: GEGenetic regulatory effects in response to a high cholesterol, high fat diet in baboons

finding: The SNP rs12821256 was associated with altered transcription factor binding of lymphoid enhancer-binding factor (LEF) at the KIT ligand (KITLG) gene, contributing to a blonde hair phenotype in humans and a lighter fur coloration in mice when this base pair was experimentally altered.
title: Parallel evolution at the regulatory base-pair level contributes to mammalian inter-specific differences in polygenic traits

finding: For rs4149056, which is associated with the SLCO1B1 gene, a significant finding was reported. Approximately 22.9 percent of the subjects carried the C allele or specific SLCO1B1 star alleles (e.g., *6, *9, *23, *31) leading to a possible decreased function. This variation indicates that a lower dose of simvastatin might be recommended due to an increased risk of muscle toxicity, which is relevant for clinical dosage guidance.
title: Pharmacogenetics at scale: An analysis of the UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs7962469, an intronic variant in the ACVR1B gene on chromosome 12, was significantly associated with COPD risk in the International COPD Genetics Consortium dataset and correlated with altered expression of ACVR1B mRNA in lung tissue, suggesting its role in modulating serum CC-16 levels.
title: The protective effect of club cell secretory protein (CC-16) on COPD risk and progression: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: Associated with diastolic blood pressure, this SNP was active in heart tissues, linking it closely to the phenotype of interest.
title: Genome-Wide Large-Scale Multi-Trait Analysis Characterizes Global Patterns of Pleiotropy and Unique Trait-Specific Variants

finding: The SNP rs3916 was associated with elevated levels of butyrylcarnitine, linked to ACADS, which causes SCAD deficiency—an autosomal recessive disease.
title: Cross-platform genetic discovery of small molecule products of metabolism and application to clinical outcomes

finding: Being in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs3916, the missense variant rs1799958 within ACADS also highlighted connection to butyrylcarnitine metabolism.
title: Cross-platform genetic discovery of small molecule products of metabolism and application to clinical outcomes

finding: SNP rs2464195 was shown to be associated with both triple-negative (OR=0.93, P=2.5×10^-8) and luminal B-like (OR=0.96, P=0.02) breast cancer subtypes. It demonstrated heterogeneity in risk depending on the subtype, highlighting its relevance in understanding subtype-specific risks.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 32 novel breast cancer susceptibility loci from overall and subtype-specific analyses

finding: At the CCND2 locus, this primary signal was classified as shared with TOA scores of 0.53 in islet and 0.47 in adipose, suggesting significant implications for T2D in both tissues.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: Identified as a GWAS variant for C-reactive protein levels, this trimodal QTL was tied to inflammatory processes within monocyte functionality.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs7294919 was identified as a polymorphism that regulates tescalcin (TESC), with specific effects on gray matter structure in the hippocampus. This finding indicated a significant association between the polymorphism and altered hippocampal morphology, which has implications for understanding its role in neurodevelopment and potential links to neuropsychiatric conditions.
title: Conformational dynamics and target-dependent myristoyl switch of calcineurin B homologous protein 3

finding: The SNP rs72650673 in the SH2B3 gene was found to be near statistically significant for abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.847 (95% CI = 1.65 – 2.18, P = 0.0647). This SNP was correlated with increased incidence of AAA in a study involving 8,236 AAA cases and approximately 230,000 controls, and was associated with a history of cardiovascular disease (CVD) and altered hematopoietic differentiation, particularly impacting platelet counts. Additionally, the study found that several other SH2B3 loss of function SNPs had ORs ranging from 1.8 to 2.8, correlating with increased incidence of AAA, thereby supporting the role of SH2B3 in AAA pathogenesis.
title: Platelets are Protective in Early Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Formation

finding: The SNP rs77864822 was associated with higher RMST expression and reduced T2D risk, indicating its role in decreasing fasting glucose and HbA1c levels.
title: TIGER: The gene expression regulatory variation landscape of human pancreatic islets

finding: The low-frequency variant rs76895963 was identified to reduce T2D risk by half while increasing CCND2 expression in islets, also linked to decreased fasting glucose.
title: TIGER: The gene expression regulatory variation landscape of human pancreatic islets

finding: The rs2268508 locus was found in an open chromatin region and was identified as a proxy for rs4762284, which was in a closed chromatin region, shedding light on its implications in B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (BCP ALL) and its association with precursor B cells.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: Similar to rs2268508, the rs17736737 locus was located within an open chromatin region, serving as another proxy for rs4762284, suggesting its relevance to B-cell differentiation and potential implications for BCP ALL.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs10774671, located in the splice-acceptor site of exon 6 in OAS1, was found to generate the OAS1 p46 isoform, which exhibited enhanced antiviral activity against SARS-CoV-2 and other positive-strand RNA viruses like flaviviruses and picornaviruses. The G allele associated with this SNP significantly correlated with decreased risk of severe COVID-19 disease, as shown in a case-control study where the odds ratio was 0.35, indicating that individuals carrying the G allele were less likely to experience severe complications from COVID-19 compared to those with the A allele.
title: Endomembrane targeting of human OAS1 p46 augments antiviral activity

finding: Although the specific findings associated with rs10735079 were not detailed in the text, it was stated that this SNP is in high linkage disequilibrium with rs10774671. Therefore, it was implied that the protective association against severe COVID-19 observed for the G allele at rs10774671 would also be relevant for rs10735079, as both SNPs are related and affect splicing and expression levels of OAS1.
title: Endomembrane targeting of human OAS1 p46 augments antiviral activity

finding: The rs3809260 SNP was associated with breast cancer (Pancan) and breast tissue (GTEx) as an eQTL located on chromosome 12. The G/T allele change was found in the promoter of the CHPT1 gene, less than 1 kb from its transcription start site. The alternative allele T was predicted to increase enhancer activity by 14 percent and was linked to higher expression levels of CHPT1 in breast cancer patients, suggesting enhanced FOXA1 binding affinity as a mechanism for increased gene activation.
title: Mechanistic analysis of enhancer sequences in the Estrogen Receptor transcriptional program

finding: The SNP rs1186214 influenced the expression of <italic>PGAP6</italic> in the context of comparisons between TB-T2D and T2D patients.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The study reported that SNP rs11050619 was linked to fibroblast behavior that modulated local and systemic cancer metabolism. The findings underscored the role of fibroblasts in supporting the tumor microenvironment in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDA), thus indirectly affecting therapeutic outcomes and cancer progression.
title: The Pancreatic Tumor Microenvironment Buffers Redox Imbalance Imposed by Disrupted Mitochondrial Metabolism

finding: The SNP rs3916 was noted as an independent pQTL that specifically regulates the protein level of ACADS, with no corresponding effect on the transcript level.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs1006737 in the CACNA1C gene was found to be associated with schizophrenia. This association suggests that genetic variation at this locus may contribute to the susceptibility to schizophrenia through its role in calcium signaling pathways that are crucial for neuronal function and may influence learning and memory.
title: Neuronal L-Type Calcium Channel Signaling to the Nucleus Requires a Novel CaMKIIα-Shank3 Interaction

finding: The variant rs112814955 was associated with ADAMTS13 levels, which is linked to von Willebrand factor (VWF) biology, playing a key role in thrombosis. This result illustrated the genetic association between the protein tested (ADAMTS13) and its interaction partner (VWF) at the trans locus.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The proxy SNP rs7297582 associated with CACNA1C expression levels showed significant association in GTEx exclusively in the cerebellum (p=6.6e-7), highlighting a distinct tissue-specific expression relationship.
title: Cell type-specific genetic regulation of expression in the granule cell layer of the human dentate gyrus

finding: Multiple human GWAS studies demonstrated a strong association between SNP rs2292239 located in the ERBB3 gene and Type 1 Diabetes (T1D). This finding was supported by the understanding that ARID1A could interact genetically with ERBB3. Furthermore, the experimental data indicated that the inducible overexpression of ERBB3 significantly conferred resistance to streptozotocin (STZ)-induced T1D in a mouse model, marking the first functional confirmation of ERBB3's effect in a T1D context.
title: Arid1a loss potentiates pancreatic β-cell regeneration through activation of EGF signaling

finding: The rs7132327 locus was previously associated with electrical phenotypes, underlining the importance of trabecular morphology in adult cardiac conduction and physiology.
title: Genomic analysis reveals a functional role for myocardial trabeculae in adults

finding: The SNP rs11050688 was associated with the signaling pathways in cancer cells, which impacted the de novo synthesis of nucleotides. This finding highlighted the role of genetic variations in metabolism, particularly in the context of tumor growth and cancer cell adaptation.
title: Reconstruction of a generic genome-scale metabolic network for chicken: investigating network connectivity and finding potential biomarkers

finding: The study highlighted the molecular dissection of the MS risk allele rs1800693, located in the TNFR1 gene. This variant was associated with coding for a soluble form of TNFR1, which mimics TNF blocking molecules. This finding illustrated the role of TNFα blockade in increasing disease activity, indicating a complex relationship between TNFα signaling and multiple sclerosis pathology.
title: Systems Analysis of Immune Changes after B-cell Depletion in Autoimmune Multiple Sclerosis

finding: In the context of the study on Durnavirales-like endogenous viral elements (EVEs), the rs2020 SNP was associated with sequences that exhibited similarity to RdRp from viral infections. This finding was significant as it contributed to the identification of the clade containing EVEs from the Mortierellaceae family, suggesting connections between the virus-derived sequences and the host fungi. The inclusion of rs2020 in the research underscored the potential for discovering previously uncharacterized RNA viruses and their integration into host genomes.
title: Uncovering hundreds of exogenous and endogenous RNA viral RdRp sequences amongst uncharacterised sequences in public protein databases

finding: The SNP rs1466535 in the LRP1 gene was identified as a significant polymorphism associated with carotid artery disease. This finding was supported by findings indicating that LRP1 variants were major risk loci for abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) and coronary artery disease, linking the genetic variation to increased susceptibility to vascular diseases.
title: Thymosin β4 mediates vascular protection via regulation of Low Density Lipoprotein Related Protein 1 (LRP1)

finding: The variant rs886125 was identified as a nominally significant GWAS variant linked to cardiac tissue. It disrupted the binding site of a transcription factor, ZNF382, thereby decreasing expression of the HCM risk gene MYL2 in cardiomyocytes, which was validated by eQTL data showing an association with increased expression of MYL2.
title: Deconvolution of polygenic risk score in single cells unravels cellular and molecular heterogeneity of complex human diseases

finding: The SNP rs10876864 was associated with RPS26 in subpopulations RPE1, RPE5, and RPE6, contributing to its association with disease status in geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: In the Progenitor RPE, as well as RPE2, RPE3, and RPE4 subpopulations, rs1131017 was found to be the significant variant associated with RPS26, further linking it to geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: The genetic variant rs34873612 was classified as an eQTL but not as a stQTL for the DDX11 gene. It was significantly associated with the expression level of DDX11 (FDR = 2e-60) but showed no significant association with mRNA stability, indicating its influence on transcriptional regulation rather than mRNA stability.
title: Genetic variants associated mRNA stability in lung

finding: The SNP rs1382264 was significantly associated with immune domain differentiation, specifically linked to traits NKearly and NKeff, indicating its role in natural killer cell activity.
title: A refined characterization of large-scale genomic differences in the first complete human genome

finding: SNP rs2617151 was also significantly associated with immune domain differentiation traits across GWAS, reinforcing its importance in immune responses.
title: A refined characterization of large-scale genomic differences in the first complete human genome

finding: The analysis of rs2733845 revealed significant associations with immune domain differentiation, further highlighting its role within the immune response context.
title: A refined characterization of large-scale genomic differences in the first complete human genome

finding: The rs615382 variant in the RACGAP1 gene was identified as a significant genetic modifier associated with late-onset Transthyretin Amyloid Polyneuropathy (ATTR-PN) in patients with the TTR Val30Met mutation (ATTRV30M). The study found that individuals carrying the alternative A allele exhibited a mean increase in age of onset by 20 years for heterozygous and 34 years for homozygous carriers. Functional assays revealed that the A-allele led to a significant increase in RACGAP1 expression, approximately 35% higher in neuronal-like SH-SY5Y cells and 20% higher in non-neuronal HEK293T cells compared to the reference C-allele. This increased expression correlated with reduced Rac1 activity, suggesting that elevated RACGAP1 levels are involved in the delayed progression of the disease.
title: Rac1 inhibition prevents axonal cytoskeleton dysfunction in Transthyretin Amyloid Polyneuropathy

finding: This SNP was part of an amplicon (#3), which drove significant RNA transcript expression in the MPRA assays, validating it as an enhancer region within the <italic>CACNA1C</italic> intronic region.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Overlapping with rs1108075 in amplicon #3, this SNP also demonstrated significant enhancer activity, supporting its role in regulating gene expression associated with neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: This SNP was included in amplicon #6, which showed significant enhancer activity that contributed to RNA transcript expression in the mouse brain at postnatal stages.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Like rs12315711, this SNP also formed part of amplicon #6, confirming its involvement in enhancing gene expression in the context of psychiatric disorders.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Located in amplicon #7, this SNP demonstrated enhancer activity, playing a role in gene regulation in the brain as validated through MPRA and single-candidate constructs.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: The SNP rs11170342 had strong evidence for association with OFC, as indicated by dual luciferase assays in human oral epithelium cells. It was shown that this SNP lies within an enhancer regulating the expression of KRT18.
title: Analysis of zebrafish periderm enhancers facilitates identification of a regulatory variant near human KRT8/18

finding: The SNP rs2070875 was prioritized as having the strongest deltaSVM score among OFC-associated SNPs at the 12q13 locus, suggesting its significant role in regulating the activity of an enhancer affecting KRT18 and KRT8 expression.
title: Analysis of zebrafish periderm enhancers facilitates identification of a regulatory variant near human KRT8/18

finding: The SNP rs3741442 was identified in a recent GWAS and was also found to have a p-value reaching genome-wide significance, indicating its strong association with non-syndromic OFC.
title: Analysis of zebrafish periderm enhancers facilitates identification of a regulatory variant near human KRT8/18

finding: The SNP rs11170344 was the lead SNP in the meta-analysis re-evaluation and demonstrated formal genome-wide significance (p=5E-8) indicating its strong linkage with the risk for OFC.
title: Analysis of zebrafish periderm enhancers facilitates identification of a regulatory variant near human KRT8/18

finding: The SNP rs55958994 was identified as a prostate cancer risk variant that regulated multiple gene expressions through extreme long-range chromatin interactions. This regulation was found to play a significant role in controlling tumor progression in prostate cancer. The context of this finding related to the importance of enhancer regulation in cancer progression.
title: Regulation Network of Colorectal Cancer Specific Enhancers in Progression of Colorectal Cancer

finding: Associated with CL, this SNP showed a P-imputed_1000G of 6.58×10^-6, with lower expression in normal skin compared to CL biopsies.
title: A genome-wide association study highlights a regulatory role for IFNG-AS1 contributing to cutaneous leishmaniasis in Brazil

finding: This SNP was notably associated with differential IFN-γ responses based on genotype, showing significance in T cell activity in response to Leishmania antigens.
title: A genome-wide association study highlights a regulatory role for IFNG-AS1 contributing to cutaneous leishmaniasis in Brazil

finding: This SNP was studied for its role alongside rs4913269 in influencing T cell production of IFN-γ and TNF, showing a significant correlation with these immune responses.
title: A genome-wide association study highlights a regulatory role for IFNG-AS1 contributing to cutaneous leishmaniasis in Brazil

finding: The SNP rs11171964 was an original finding related to the research conducted by Vazquez-Cuervo and colleagues, which utilized saildrones to validate satellite-derived sea surface salinity and sea surface temperature. This study highlighted the integration of genetic data with environmental parameters in understanding marine biodiversity.
title: Plankton Planet: ‘seatizen’ oceanography to assess open ocean life at the planetary scale

finding: This missense variant in the SLCO1B1 gene was associated with 19 metabolites, including primary and secondary bile acids, indicating its role in the liver's transport of bile acids.
title: Genome-microbiome interplay provides insight into the determinants of the human blood metabolome

finding: Another variant, rs11065979, was associated with small vessel stroke and identified in the CCSp analysis. This association replicated in both the trans-ancestry analysis and the European analysis, implicating the SH2B3-BRAP-ALDH2 locus in the genetic risk for small vessel stroke.
title: Alternate approach to stroke phenotyping identifies a genetic risk locus for small vessel stroke

finding: The rs1006737 SNP, associated with the CACNA1C gene, exhibited a notable finding in the context of bipolar disorder. In human iPSC-derived neurons carrying the rs1006737 risk allele, researchers observed higher mRNA levels of CACNA1C as well as heightened L-type calcium currents when compared to neurons with the non-risk variant. This indicated a gain-of-function effect in terms of gene expression related to calcium signaling, which is critical for neuroplasticity and may contribute to the cognitive deficits frequently seen in bipolar disorder patients.
title: Bipolar-associated miR-499-5p controls neuroplasticity by downregulating the Cav1.2 L-type voltage gated calcium channel subunit CACNB2
