finding: This missense variant in SH2B3 was associated with Celiac disease risk and showed a significant increase in frequency from the Bronze Age to the Historical period, indicating its role in dietary adaptation and immune regulation.
title: 1,000 ancient genomes uncover 10,000 years of natural selection in Europe

finding: The SNP rs10877969 was identified as part of the analysis of the gene Avpr1a, which was linked to visceral hypersensitivity (VH) in disorders of gut-brain interaction (DGBI) and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). In the study, the differential expression of Avpr1a was associated with higher abdominal pain ratings in patients, suggesting a strong correlation between this SNP and the genetic predisposition to visceral pain.
title: Identification of arginine-vasopressin receptor 1a (Avpr1a/AVPR1A) as a novel candidate gene for chronic visceral pain

finding: Another variant in CCND2, rs3217792, was reported with similar associations to rs76895963, further indicating its role in diabetes susceptibility and HbA1c levels.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: The SNP rs1280682918 was identified as disrupting a start-stop element in the 5' UTR of the PTPN11 gene, which encodes the SHP-2 protein involved in RAS/MAPK and PI3K signaling pathways. This disruption was hypothesized to cause a loss-of-function mutation leading to de-repression of translation and aberrant expression levels.
title: Regulatory start-stop elements in 5’ untranslated regions pervasively modulate translation

finding: The rs55958994 variant was implicated in prostate cancer risk by regulating multiple gene expressions via extreme long-range chromatin interactions to control tumor progression.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The SNP rs2277339 located in the essential gene PRIM1 was identified as a significant candidate for therapeutic targeting in cancer due to its role in loss of heterozygosity (LOH). It led to a T to G substitution resulting in an amino acid change from aspartate to alanine. This allele exhibited a common minor allele frequency of 0.177, with LOH occurring in 9% of cancers overall, but notably higher in specific cancer types such as 21% in lung adenocarcinomas and 18% in ovarian cancers. The allele-specific CRISPR disruption experiments showed that targeting this SNP reduced proliferation in cells with the sensitive G allele (PRIM1^S) while leaving those with the resistant T allele (PRIM1^R) unaffected.
title: Loss of heterozygosity of essential genes represents a widespread class of potential cancer vulnerabilities

finding: The SNP rs2277339 was characterized as a missense coding variant in DNA primase subunit 1 (PRIM1) located on chromosome 12. It demonstrated a connection between plateletcrit, a marker of thrombotic and inflammatory processes, and Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI). Documented associations in the UK Biobank included height, waist to hip ratio, and red blood cell-related traits, linking it to the biological processes associated with OSA.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy to discover and interpret GWAS results for sleep-associated traits

finding: The SNP rs11050631 was also recognized in the context of cancer cell migration as per the findings of Limia et al. in 2019, which discussed how the Unfolded Protein Response impacts the migratory and invasive behavior of cancer cells. The study suggested that this SNP might play a role in modulating the cellular mechanisms that govern motility in cancer.
title: Systemic migrations in enucleated cells

finding: The RA rs11564258, located near MUC19, was strongly associated with multiple phenotypes including Crohn's disease and inflammatory bowel disease. The finding highlighted the role of this RA as potentially adaptive in modern human populations following separation from Neanderthals.
title: Neanderthal introgression reintroduced functional ancestral alleles lost in Eurasian populations

finding: The SNP rs2229774 was linked to the gene RARG, which demonstrated a significant upregulation in response to the anthracycline EPI and a less significant positive fold change in response to DOX. This suggests that RARG may mediate cardiotoxicity effects associated with anthracycline treatments.
title: Anthracycline-induced cardiotoxicity associates with a shared gene expression response signature to TOP2-inhibiting breast cancer drugs in cardiomyocytes

finding: The SNP rs10507084 was associated with OSA near RMST/NEDD1 on chromosome 12 with a P-value of 2.8 x 10^-11. Notably, its association remained significant even after adjusting for BMI, suggesting a BMI-independent mechanism in predisposing individuals to OSA.
title: Genetic analysis of obstructive sleep apnoea discovers a strong association with cardiometabolic health

finding: The CACNA1C rs1006737 SNP was found to increase essential hypertension risk in Chinese Han and ethnic Russian populations, pointing to its broad genetic influence.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs7308356, located at locus 12q13.12, was identified as an index SNP that is associated with varicose veins (VVs), contributing to our understanding of the genetic risk factors related to this condition.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs12303082 was found to reside in a highly conserved region within the FAM186A gene, causing a non-conservative amino acid substitution and was associated with varicose veins (VVs) with a P-value of 2×10^-9.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: Zhang et al. (2022) investigated SNP rs11111309 in relation to multi-species individual tree segmentation and identification based on improved Mask R-CNN and UAV imagery.
title: Influence of Temperate Forest Autumn Leaf Phenology on Segmentation of Tree Species from UAV Imagery Using Deep Learning

finding: Inconsistent genotypes were observed in five individuals; four confirmed homozygous for the rs3817551-G allele expressed only hsa-miR-7107-3p with the T allele, yet found no explanations through BLAST analysis.
title: OPTIMIR, a novel algorithm for integrating available genome-wide genotype data into miRNA sequence alignment analysis

finding: The SNP rs72650673 correlated with the SH2B3 gene, where the primary allelic variant was shown to increase platelet counts due to impaired hematopoietic signaling. This allele was frequently made homozygous by clonally selected CNN-LOH mutations, indicating its role in promoting blood clone development.
title: Monogenic and polygenic inheritance become instruments for clonal selection

finding: This SNP was associated with an earlier onset by an average of 2.9 years (p=0.037), marking it as notable in the context of genetic risk factors influencing MS.
title: A higher burden of multiple sclerosis genetic risk confers an earlier onset

finding: The study by Shonibare et al. (2021) identified the rs1006737 SNP in CACNA1C as being associated with neurostructural phenotypes in adolescents diagnosed with bipolar disorder and healthy controls, suggesting a link between this genetic variant and the pathophysiology of bipolar disorder.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Bipolar Disorder by Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs1196764 located in the APPL2 locus was significantly associated with multiple microbial taxa, specifically positively correlated with Prevotella jejuni, an important bacterium linked to periodontal health, as well as with unclassified SGB (uSGB) 3339 from the genus Oribacterium and uSGB 315 from the genus Solobacterium, which is associated with colorectal cancer.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: The study identified rs772557 as a causal variant within the 12q14 association, linked to the PPM1H gene. The rs772557-A allele was found to abrogate a MYB transcription factor binding site, leading to downregulation of PPM1H and an increase in specific hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell (HSPC) subpopulations.
title: Genome-wide association study on 13,167 individuals identifies regulators of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell levels in human blood

finding: The study found that the LTA4H rs17525495 genotype, specifically the TT homozygous variant, was associated with increased survival in HIV-negative patients with tuberculous meningitis (TBM) in Vietnam. This survival benefit was particularly pronounced in patients exhibiting hyper-inflammatory responses, while patients with CC genotypes potentially experienced harm from glucocorticoid treatment. The findings from both Vietnam and Indonesia cohorts, despite some variability in significance, extended the association of this genotype with TBM survival, suggesting that personalized treatment strategies based on LTA4H genotype could be beneficial.
title: A Bayesian analysis of the association between Leukotriene A4 Hydrolase genotype and survival probability of tuberculous meningitis patients treated with adjunctive dexamethasone

finding: The rs1393693495 (W514Ter) SNP was analyzed and was predicted to be deleterious by PredictSNP2. This nonsense mutation leads to a stop codon which significantly disrupts the functionality of the TBX5 protein.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs1555226308 (Q156Ter) SNP was found to create a stop codon at amino acid position 156, significantly disrupting the T-box domain (amino acid position 58-238) of TBX5, predicting a deleterious effect as assessed by PredictSNP2.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs104894381 SNP was identified as Pathogenic in ClinVar database, indicating a significant impact on TBX5 functions.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs1131691460 SNP was classified as Pathogenic based on ClinVar database records.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs1565941579 SNP was determined to be Pathogenic according to ClinVar information.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs483353129 SNP was listed as Pathogenic, highlighting its impact on TBX5 gene function.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs863223773 SNP was categorized as Pathogenic within the ClinVar database.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs1057519050 SNP was recognized as Pathogenic based on ClinVar classifications.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs1555225344 SNP was designated as Pathogenic in ClinVar, confirming its deleterious potential.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs1565935426 SNP was reported as Pathogenic in ClinVar, indicating substantial effects on TBX5 functionality.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs1131691932 SNP was found to be Pathogenic according to ClinVar annotations.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs104894378 SNP was classified as Pathogenic, linking it to TBX5-related diseases.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs104894382 SNP was included among Pathogenic variants, underscoring its significance.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: CARMEN identified rs705698 as having significant regulatory potential (CARMEN score = 0.4070), located in the first intron of the gene RAB5B, a candidate gene for type 1 diabetes, which was confirmed by independent luciferase assays.
title: Computational Assessment of the Regulation-Modulating Potential for Noncoding Variants

finding: The SNP rs11111726 was associated with the expression of the protein STAT5B, which was found to be part of a signaling network in HSC myofibroblasts that mediates the fibrotic response. In the context of fibrosis, depletion of STAT5B along with other kinases decreased the expression of COL1A1, a gene critically involved in collagen production. This implicates rs11111726 in pathways concerning liver fibrosis, suggesting its potential relevance in the regulation of STAT5B during fibrotic processes.
title: Nanchangmycin regulates FYN, FAK and ERK to control the fibrotic activity of hepatic stellate cells

finding: The SNP rs28990715 was linked to the FOXM1 gene and exhibited the same amino acid change in both humans and cattle. This variant was not a missense but occurred at orthologous positions and was part of the group of variants associated with height, suggesting the potential broader implications for stature-related traits.
title: The conservation of human functional variants and their effects across mammals

finding: This SNP notably had genome-wide significant association results (P < 5 × 10^-8) in the subcortical volume analysis, highlighting its significance.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs10860784 was confirmed to be cis-acting on the gene DRAM1, located 98 Kb downstream, in multiple tissues. The UK Biobank PheGWAS reported a strong association between rs10860784 and height with a p-value of 1.47 × 10^-14.
title: EPISPOT: an epigenome-driven approach for detecting and interpreting hotspots in molecular QTL studies

finding: The SNP rs10784774 was revealed as a lead hotspot in the pleiotropic region around LYZ, with a size of 154. It detected associations with multiple transcripts, specifically in monocyte expression QTLs.
title: EPISPOT: an epigenome-driven approach for detecting and interpreting hotspots in molecular QTL studies

finding: The SNP rs2168029 was identified as another lead hotspot near LYZ, with a size of 109 and an r² value of 0.89 with rs10784774. It was shown to be involved in a similar trans network.
title: EPISPOT: an epigenome-driven approach for detecting and interpreting hotspots in molecular QTL studies

finding: The SNP rs1384 was flagged as a hotspot in ATLASQTL, located in the 3' UTR of LYZ, suggesting a possible trans action mediated by LYZ itself, supported by multiple analyses linking it to the expression of LYZ.
title: EPISPOT: an epigenome-driven approach for detecting and interpreting hotspots in molecular QTL studies

finding: The SNP rs11104703 was associated with the expression of the gene KITLG (ENSG00000049130) in naive B cells, revealing opposite effect eQTLs based on lithium usage. This meant that the presence of lithium altered the expression of KITLG depending on the genotype at rs11104703, highlighting a possible genetic mechanism via which lithium may impact psychiatric conditions such as bipolar disorder and schizophrenia.
title: Cell type deconvolution of bulk blood RNA-Seq to reveal biological insights of neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: rs56027063 is also noted as an indel in TGP38L with an alternate allele frequency of 1 and was connected to the erroneous lack of variation in TGP38L compared to earlier versions.
title: Quality control of large genome datasets using genome fingerprints

finding: The G2019S variant (rs34637584) in the LRRK2 gene was associated with increased LRRK2 kinase activity, which supported its linkage to both familial and sporadic Parkinson's disease (PD). This was established through assessments in human subjects who carried this pathogenic variant.
title: Understanding LRRK2 kinase activity in preclinical models and human subjects through quantitative analysis of LRRK2 and pRab10

finding: The N551K variant (rs7308720) in the LRRK2 gene was also found to be associated with LRRK2 activity. The study included subjects carrying this variant, linking it to an increased risk of developing Parkinson's disease, similar to the findings for the G2019S variant.
title: Understanding LRRK2 kinase activity in preclinical models and human subjects through quantitative analysis of LRRK2 and pRab10

finding: The variant rs28941773 in the gene ACADS was identified as a known epilepsy variant. This missense mutation was included among the predicted damaging mutations linked to neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Evolutionary constraint genes implicated in autism spectrum disorder across 2,054 nonhuman primate genomes

finding: The SNP rs3751143 was implicated in the P2RX7 gene, resulting in a loss-of-function variant (CC genotype). This variant impacted the response of CD4+ T cells from patients with active leprosy to extracellular ATP (eATP). The study showed that while the functional AA donor's CD4+ T cells increased Ki-67+CD44+CD4+ T cells when exposed to eATP, the CC donor exhibited no such increase. This indicated that P2RX7 activation is critical for CXCR3 upregulation and the proliferative response in CD4+ T cells during mycobacterial infections.
title: T cell-specific P2RX7 favors lung parenchymal CD4+ T cell accumulation in response to severe lung infections

finding: It was found that the SNP rs11111710 is associated with gene expression related to CD105, which was expressed in ovarian cancer precursor lesions and identified as necessary for metastasis to the ovary. The study established a link between this SNP and cancer progression in ovarian cancer, highlighting its potential role as a prognostic marker.
title: A meta-analysis of the inhibin network reveals prognostic value in multiple solid tumors

finding: The SNP rs11111701 was identified as a notable variant associated with JAK1, impacting the enzymatic characteristics of both wild-type and mutant forms of Janus Kinase 1. This finding highlighted its potential role in altering tumorigenesis, particularly due to its association with mRNA processing and the subsequent dicing of JAK1.
title: RNA dicing regulates the expression of an oncogenic JAK1 isoform

finding: The rs1169284 SNP at the HNF1A locus was associated with biological age (ΔAge) with a highly significant p-value of 3.0×10^-23. This SNP is known to be a risk factor for diabetes and cancer, indicating its relevance in human aging and disease susceptibility.
title: A mathematical model that predicts human biological age from physiological traits identifies environmental and genetic factors that influence aging

finding: The derived allele G of rs74576183-A/G, an intronic variant of NCAPD2, was positively selected in PNG highlanders. It showed an association with a slower heart rate (pval_adjusted=0.046, beta=-2.981), suggesting a role in adaptation to hypoxic conditions, as this region also exhibited a significant association with increasing red blood cell count in the UK Biobank.
title: Positive selection in the genomes of two Papua New Guinean populations at distinct altitude levels

finding: SNP rs77216612 was identified as a prostate cancer risk SNP and classified as an eSNP, associated with the expression of two long noncoding RNAs, LOH12CR2 and RP11-253I19.3. This relationship was modulated by an adjacent eCpG site at chr12:12714982. This SNP did not appear as a canonical eQTL or meQTL.
title: memo-eQTL: DNA methylation modulated genetic variant effect on gene transcriptional regulation

finding: The candidate variant rs1859332 was linked to the OAS cluster and found to be potentially protective against severe COVID-19, with significant eQTL associations.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The COVID-19-associated variant rs10774679 was identified as increasing in frequency and was shown to be linked to the OAS1 splice variant, which has implications for susceptibility to both IBD and COVID-19.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: Another IBD risk allele rs11066188 showed a significant increase in frequency, correlating with higher expression of IKZF1, which aids in immune response.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: This variant was shown to be linked to rs10774679, and was also associated with slight susceptibility to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The C1S variant (rs12146727), involved in host defense, was highlighted as one of many negatively selected variants.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The SNP rs61938093 was identified as a risk-associated CCV located within a putative regulatory element (PRE) at chromosome 12q22, which frequently interacted with the NTN4 promoter in breast cancer cell lines. The study demonstrated that silencing the PRE led to reduced NTN4 expression, implying that this regulatory element acts as an enhancer. Electromobility shift assays (EMSAs) revealed that this SNP altered protein binding in vitro, suggesting its role as a functional variant at the signal.
title: High-throughput allelic expression imbalance analyses identify candidate breast cancer risk genes

finding: The SNP rs2227473, located in the IL22 gene, was significantly associated with specific bacteriophages. The IL22 gene encodes a pro-inflammatory cytokine, indicating a potential role in immune response modulation.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: SNP rs7954905 acted as a key instrument for reconstructing the <italic>CD163</italic> sub-network, emphasizing its role in linking cortisol to gene regulation related to metabolic implications.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs4148866 was unique to the NET analysis, linked to the gene ABCB9. Although ABCB9 did not have reported associations with diseases in the musculoskeletal system, its colocalization analysis indicated a significant shared variant, suggesting its involvement in disease mechanisms.
title: A novel method for multiple phenotype association studies based on genotype and phenotype network

finding: The SNP rs11050678 was associated with the metabolism of cysteine, which became essential for tumor proliferation and survival in glioblastoma cells. This finding highlighted the role of non-essential amino acids in cancer biology and suggested that targeting their metabolism could have significant implications for treatment strategies.
title: Multi-omic screening of invasive GBM cells in engineered biomaterials and patient biopsies reveals targetable transsulfuration pathway alterations

finding: The SNP rs111891989 was identified as a credible causal SNP located in an intron of the MSI1 gene, associated with cerebellar volume with a strong statistical significance (p = 4.73×10^-51). MSI1 encodes an RNA-binding protein that regulates midline crossing of pre-cerebellar neurons.
title: Genome-wide association study of cerebellar volume

finding: The SNP rs2102949 was an intronic variant in the MPHOSPH9 gene, identified as significant in both the cerebellar volume study and the schizophrenia GWAS. MPHOSPH9 is highly expressed in the cerebellum but its function is not fully understood.
title: Genome-wide association study of cerebellar volume

finding: The SNP rs2269935 was previously associated with cachexia and was reported to be linked to lowering of body fat, indicating its probable regulatory role in metabolism.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs11168417 served as a prognostic marker for non-small cell lung cancer in patients undergoing surgical resection or chemotherapy, suggesting its importance in cancer prognosis.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs11609399 was identified as a deleterious non-synonymous SNP affecting protein structure by converting Leucine to Histidine, which may impact the function of PFKM and has been recognized in relation to cancer susceptibility.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs2228500 was highlighted for its role in affecting exon splicing and was evolutionary conserved, making it relevant to potential functions in cancer development.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs10774671 was identified as an IAV-specific response eQTL within the OAS1 gene. It showed significant association with increased OAS1 enzymatic activity and a stronger transcriptional response in IAV-infected cells compared to mock-infected cells. This SNP is part of a Neanderthal-derived haplotype and was associated with susceptibility to various viruses.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals pervasive but highly cell type-specific genetic ancestry effects on the response to viral infection

finding: The SNP rs7310409 was associated with C-reactive protein levels in four ancestry cohorts (African-American (PAGE), European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American), highlighting its conserved significance across ancestries.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs1169310 was found to be significant in three ancestry cohorts (European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American), showing its association with C-reactive protein levels.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs1183910 showed significant associations across the European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American ancestry cohorts, further supporting its importance in relation to C-reactive protein levels.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs7953249 was significantly associated with C-reactive protein levels in African-American, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts, indicating its potential relevance across these groups.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs2259816 was significantly associated with C-reactive protein levels in European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American ancestry cohorts, emphasizing its role across diverse populations.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs7979473 was found to be significantly associated with C-reactive protein in African-American, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American ancestry cohorts, demonstrating its cross-ancestry significance.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The analysis of SNP rs7312625 revealed that it was located within a fragment that exhibited increased enhancer activity in the atrial cardiomyocyte-like cell line HL-1. This finding was significant because it indicated that this variant could potentially play a role in enhancing transcriptional activity, which is important in the context of atrial fibrillation (AF). The enhanced activity linked to this SNP gave insights into its role in the regulatory mechanisms governing cardiac function.
title: An atrial fibrillation-associated regulatory region modulates cardiac Tbx5 levels and arrhythmia susceptibility

finding: SNP rs4767237 was found within a fragment that demonstrated minimal decreased enhancer activity in the atrial cardiomyocyte-like cell line HL-1. This decrease in activity suggested that this variant may negatively influence transcriptional regulation. The significance of this finding lies in its potential implications for atrial fibrillation (AF) susceptibility, as reduced enhancer function could affect the expression of genes crucial for heart rhythm control.
title: An atrial fibrillation-associated regulatory region modulates cardiac Tbx5 levels and arrhythmia susceptibility

finding: This SNP in the HMGA2 gene was replicated in Ladakhi offspring, reflecting its previous associations with human height and birth weight, indicating a biological relevance in the context of lowland populations.
title: Population History and Genome Wide Association Studies of Birth Weight in a Native High Altitude Ladakhi Population

finding: The SNP Fok1 (rs2228570) within the VDR gene was significantly associated with the onset of rheumatoid arthritis (RA) in the indigenous North American (INA) population. This finding suggested a genetic link between vitamin D metabolism and RA susceptibility.
title: Circulating Levels of Free 25(OH)D Increase at the Onset of Rheumatoid Arthritis

finding: The SNP rs76895963, located at the CCND2 locus, was identified as the single most pleiotropic signal in the study. It was associated with 13 traits, including bone mineral density (BMD), indicating a significant genetic relationship with this phenotype.
title: GWAS-informed data integration and non-coding CRISPRi screen illuminate genetic etiology of bone mineral density

finding: The SNP rs10859995 was within the intron of the HAL gene, which is expressed in the skin, and its association was noted in the context of factors influencing vitamin D production.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: This SNP was also part of the significant regions determined in earlier analyses for 25OHD concentration.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The common LRRK2 risk variant rs10878226 was associated with an increased risk of developing Parkinson's disease as indicated by an odds ratio of 1.20 and a p-value of 6.3 x 10^-4, based on a sample of 6129 individuals. This finding confirmed the risk profile associated with the variant, emphasizing its role in the genetics of Parkinson's disease.
title: Analysis of DNM3 and VAMP4 as genetic modifiers of LRRK2 Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs12821256 in the KITLG gene exhibited evidence of selection with a selection coefficient (s) of about 0.016. This variant was associated with traits such as blonde hair color and demonstrated strong selection concentrated mainly in the last 5,000 years.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs5443 was identified as a pNMD-QTL that interacted with the DNA repair gene XRCC3, regulating the fraction of NMD-targeted transcripts across 18 tissues, including 6 brain tissues. It was associated with a substantial number of diseases, specifically 48 out of 8073, indicating its crucial role in maintaining genome integrity and preventing genetic diseases.
title: Mapping genetic variants for nonsense-mediated mRNA decay regulation across human tissues

finding: The G allele at rs1362463 was associated with a rapid extinction of IFNG expression in individuals along DEX response pseudotime, which is relevant due to IFNG's involvement in inflammatory responses and COVID-19 disease outcomes.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The study identified the rs4570625 SNP in the TPH2 gene as a significant genetic marker associated with individual differences in emotional processing. Specifically, the GG genotype was correlated with increased sensitivity to acute tryptophan depletion (ATD) and its effects on the functional architecture of brain circuits involved in anxiety and stress. This finding emphasized how variations in this SNP influenced serotonin synthesis in limbic and prefrontal brain regions, impacting amygdala functional connectivity and the effectiveness of emotion regulation mechanisms.
title: State and trait serotonin variations interact to shape the intrinsic connectivity and gradient architecture of the brain – a combined TPH2 genetics and tryptophan depletion study

finding: The SNP rs11543305, a C/T variant located 1.6kb proximal to the VNTR at chr12:132,148,891-132,150,764, was identified as the lead SNV associated with the expression of the NOC4L gene. After stratifying the samples based on genotype at rs11543305, the study found that the copy number of the associated VNTR still exhibited a significant association with NOC4L expression. This finding indicated that the VNTR associations acted independently of local SNV QTLs.
title: Pervasive cis effects of variation in copy number of large tandem repeats on local epigenetics and gene expression

finding: The SNP rs1269970792 (W121R) was found to be damaging and implicated in the potential development of Holt-Oram Syndrome (HOS). This finding arose from comprehensive assessments indicating significant structural impact on TBX5.
title: Identification of deleterious single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)s on the human TBX5 gene & prediction of their structural & functional consequences: An in silico approach

finding: The SNP rs772248871 (V153D) was among the top five SNPs reported to cause significant structural damage to the TBX5 protein, which is essential in heart and limb development, potentially leading to Holt-Oram Syndrome (HOS).
title: Identification of deleterious single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)s on the human TBX5 gene & prediction of their structural & functional consequences: An in silico approach

finding: The SNP rs769113870 (E208D) was recognized as one of the most damaging alterations to the TBX5 protein structure based on predictive modeling, with implications for causing Holt-Oram Syndrome (HOS).
title: Identification of deleterious single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)s on the human TBX5 gene & prediction of their structural & functional consequences: An in silico approach

finding: The SNP rs1318021626 (I222N) was classified as a highly deleterious variant affecting TBX5, contributing to the potential development of Holt-Oram Syndrome (HOS) according to several bioinformatics prediction tools.
title: Identification of deleterious single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)s on the human TBX5 gene & prediction of their structural & functional consequences: An in silico approach

finding: The finding established that rs7294619 fell within a microglia-specific enhancer and was identified as a significant eVariant leading to increased LRRK2 expression in microglia (p = 1.27×10−6, beta = 0.263), corroborating it as a PD risk factor in previous studies.
title: Fine-mapping of Parkinson’s disease susceptibility loci identifies putative causal variants

finding: The study reported that a common polymorphism in the Retinoic acid receptor-γ (RARG) gene, specifically rs2229774, was found to confer increased susceptibility to anthracycline cardiotoxicity risk among childhood cancer survivors. This provided important insights into the genetic factors contributing to the side effects of doxorubicin therapy, highlighting the role of this SNP in modifying the cardiotoxic effects of the drug.
title: CRISPR/Cas9 screens implicate RARA and SPNS1 in doxorubicin cardiotoxicity

finding: The SNP rs1131017, located in the 5'-untranslated region of the gene RPS26, was associated with a bimodal expression pattern at the RNA level. The C/C genotype corresponded to high transcription states, while the derived G/G genotype was linked to lower transcription states. Notably, despite lower transcription levels, mRNA carrying the derived G allele led to significantly increased protein production, highlighting a complex regulatory mechanism where the same SNP influences gene expression in opposing directions.
title: Switch-like Gene Expression Modulates Disease Susceptibility

finding: Co-localization analyses revealed that rs7309146 enhanced TCF7L2 expression in islets, linking this variant to T2D-associated gene regulation.
title: Influence of genetic variants on gene expression in human pancreatic islets – implications for type 2 diabetes

finding: The intergenic variant rs11114010 was significantly linked to SELPLG protein levels in common variant analysis.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The SNP rs835044, positioned 2 kb upstream of NDUFA12, exhibited strong genetic effects in cells with high oxidative phosphorylation scores. This variant's association with oxidative phosphorylation suggested a significant role in mitochondrial function, with loss-of-function variants linked to clinical phenotypes, including Leigh syndrome.
title: Widespread gene-environment interactions shape the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection in hospitalized COVID-19 patients

finding: This nonsynonymous SNP in the SH2B3 gene was associated with an increased risk of colorectal cancer while the alternative allele T was linked to higher risks for CAD and stroke.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: The SNP rs7297245 was associated with DNAm in connection to severe sunburns and skin cancer risk, enhancing the understanding of its functional implications.
title: Investigating DNA methylation as a potential mediator between pigmentation genes, pigmentary traits and skin cancer

finding: The rs11055602 variant was found to have a strong effect on DNA methylation levels at the CLEC4C locus, which is involved in the regulation of dendritic cells. The genotype effects depended on the circulating proportions of myeloid cells, indicating a myeloid lineage-dependent effect on 5mC levels.
title: The Immune Factors Driving DNA Methylation Variation in Human Blood

finding: The SNP rs11111650 was associated with misregulation of gene expression in gonadotroph nonfunctioning pituitary tumors. The study highlighted the role of aberrant DNA methylation as a contributing factor to the observed expression changes in pituitary gene regulation, indicating the significance of this SNP in the dynamics of pituitary-related processes.
title: Postnatal developmental trajectory of sex-biased gene expression in the mouse pituitary gland

finding: Associated with the R262W coding mutation in SH2B3, this SNP contributed to the characterization of risk loci with functional implications in hematopoiesis.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: The SNP rs74416240 was found to be an eQTL for TCHP in CD14+ monocytes, with implications for Graves' disease. The high colocalization probability indicated its potential significance in this autoimmune disorder, warranting further investigation despite limited prior knowledge about TCHP in disease contexts.
title: Single-cell analysis of human diversity in circulating immune cells

finding: The SNP rs76524143, located in the NCOA1 gene, displayed a highly significant interaction with brain imaging phenotypes for Alzheimer's disease, having the lowest p value (3.59E-08) after correction, suggesting a strong link to the disease.
title: Functional biological paths altered in Alzheimer’s disease: from genes to bile acids

finding: In relation to major depressive disorder (MDD), the rs567868887 SNP had a MAF of 0.0009, an Info score of 0.28, and an extraordinary p-value of 1.57 x 10^-55. The findings suggested a strong association between this rare SNP and MDD.
title: Increasing the resolution and precision of psychiatric GWAS by re-imputing summary statistics using a large, diverse reference panel

finding: This novel SNP was associated with hsCRP levels and included in the broader discussion of genetic influences on chronic inflammation.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The SNP rs76847996 was recognized as a novel finding associated with hsCRP, adding to the understanding of genetic factors in inflammation.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: Notably significant in the context of hsCRP, rs2393775 was recognized for its association with lipid metabolism and inflammation.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: SNP rs76904798, which had a high colocalisation probability (PP4 = 0.975) with LRRK2 sQTL in LIL10_24, was linked to decreased usage of a specific LRRK2 splice junction. This decrease in splicing usage was associated with increased risk of IBD, suggesting that inclusion of this splice junction may confer a protective effect against the disease.
title: Low-usage splice junctions underpin immune-mediated disease risk

finding: The SNP rs7137828 was identified within the SH2B3-ATXN2 locus, which colocalized with cholesterol measures (LDL, HDL), blood pressure measures (SBP, DBP), and rheumatoid arthritis (RA) in relation to CHD. It explained approximately 76.8% of the posterior probability of colocalization with CHD.
title: A fast and efficient colocalization algorithm for identifying shared genetic risk factors across multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs1131454 within the OAS1 gene was confirmed to be significantly associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD) in an analysis involving 1,313 individuals with sporadic AD and 1,234 control individuals. This association was noted alongside findings that rs1131454 was linked to decreased OAS1 expression.
title: Genetic variability associated with OAS1 expression in myeloid cells increases the risk of Alzheimer’s disease and severe COVID-19 outcomes

finding: The SNP rs1484149172, corresponding to the amino acid change L45P, was identified as a high-risk non-synonymous variant contributing to the pathogenicity of the IAPP protein, associating it with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). This finding was supported by its designation as deleterious by numerous in silico tools.
title: Elucidating conformational alteration of human islet amyloid polypeptide by nonsynonymous substitution

finding: The SNP rs78822118, resulting in the amino acid change T37P, was classified as deleterious based on multiple predictive algorithms. It was selected for further study due to its significant alteration of the conformational dynamics of IAPP, indicating a potential role in T2DM and related protein misfolding disorders.
title: Elucidating conformational alteration of human islet amyloid polypeptide by nonsynonymous substitution

finding: The SNP rs200376097, associated with the amino acid change G66R, emerged as a deleterious variant that could affect the structure and function of the IAPP protein, thus linking it to type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) and amyloid deposition in this pathology.
title: Elucidating conformational alteration of human islet amyloid polypeptide by nonsynonymous substitution

finding: The SNP rs763604023 corresponds to the amino acid change T69I, recognized as a deleterious nsSNP that affects IAPP's conformational dynamics. Its significance in the context of type 2 diabetes mellitus was established through further simulation studies.
title: Elucidating conformational alteration of human islet amyloid polypeptide by nonsynonymous substitution

finding: The SNP rs706799 served as the lead SNP for association with autoimmune thyroid disease (ATD), reinforcing its relevance in autoimmune disease contexts.
title: Sharing information between related diseases using Bayesian joint fine mapping increases accuracy and identifies novel associations in six immune mediated diseases

finding: The SNP rs11111702 was associated with a function for the STAT3 gene which had a sexually dimorphic role in Sonic Hedgehog (SHH) medulloblastoma. In the context of the research, this finding indicated that the molecular mechanisms involving STAT3 may vary significantly between male and female patients, elucidating differences in tumor progression and immune responses linked to the oncogene YAP1.
title: Sex-biased Yap1 oncogene function

finding: This novel SNP was identified near the gene RPL23AP68, contributing significantly to the genetic findings in psychopathology.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: Identified near the gene ANKS1B, rs10777957 was noted as a novel finding with potential relevance to psychiatric disorders.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: This SNP was recognized as a novel risk variant for psychopathology, associated with the gene RP11-768F21.1.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: Identified on chromosome 12, this SNP was noted as a heterogeneous SNP influencing genetic risk in psychopathology.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: At the rs2271194 locus, several genes, including ERBB3, IKZF4, RPS26, and SUOX, showed evidence of colocalization with PCOS risk. Both ERBB3 and RPS26 are candidates for mediating PCOS risk, with ERBB3 being connected to the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal (HPG) axis and implicated in follicular development, and RPS26 being involved in DNA damage response and female fertility.
title: Colocalization highlights genes in hypothalamic–pituitary–gonadal axis as potentially mediating polycystic ovary syndrome risk

finding: The SNP rs11111635 was associated with variations in the expression of genes regulated by the galectin1/HOXA5 complex, which plays a critical role in maintaining brain tumour stem cells (BTSCs) and influencing glioblastoma resistance to therapy. The study revealed that this SNP impacted the transcriptional landscape relevant to BTSCs and their response to treatments, particularly regarding their self-renewal and tumourigenesis capabilities.
title: Transcriptional Control of Brain Tumour Stem Cells by a Carbohydrate Binding Protein

finding: The eQTL variant rs10876864 was identified as a risk variant for allergic disease and vitiligo. It exhibited sensitivity to cellular respiration effects late in differentiation, indicating its relevance in a higher order interaction between genetic effects and cellular contextual factors.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing of differentiating iPS cells reveals dynamic genetic effects on gene expression

finding: The PD risk allele rs76904798-T was found to increase expression of LRRK2 in monocytes, corroborating previous reports of its effect on LRRK2 regulation.
title: Discordant transcriptional signatures of mitochondrial genes in Parkinson’s disease human myeloid cells

finding: The IFNG rs1861494 polymorphism was associated with IBD disease severity and functional changes in IFNG methylation and protein secretion, as described by Gonsky et al. in 2014.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and enriched pathways in inflammatory bowel disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs11111675 was linked to the expression of voltage-gated sodium channels in carcinomas. This finding suggested that it could play a role in the potentiation of metastasis in glioblastoma, emphasizing its relevance in understanding cancer metastasis and possibly guiding therapeutic approaches.
title: Voltage-gated ion channels mediate the electrotaxis of glioblastoma cells in a hybrid PMMA/PDMS microdevice

finding: The SNP rs1006737 from the gene CACNA1C was associated with neural correlates of verbal fluency in healthy individuals. This finding was significant as it contributed to the understanding of genetic factors influencing cognitive processes, particularly in relation to language abilities, which is relevant to the context of developmental disabilities and language impairments reported in the affected individual.
title: Language impairment with a microduplication in 1q42.3q43

finding: The variant rs11066320 was located in the Ptpn11 locus and was robustly associated with HDL cholesterol levels, which are crucial for determining CAD risk. This SNP had a significant p-value of 1.03e-08.
title: The single-cell epigenetic regulatory landscape in mammalian perinatal testis development

finding: The SNP rs2463169 was found to be associated with height, showing a height-increasing G allele frequency of 23% in African populations (AFR) versus 84% in European populations (EUR). This SNP was located within the 12q21.2 locus and is situated in the intron of the gene PAWR, which is linked to the prostate apoptosis response-4 protein. The effect size for this SNP was estimated at approximately 0.034 standard deviation (SD) per G allele in AFR, contrasting with -0.002 SD per G allele in EUR. The marginal association p-value in EUR was reported as P=0.08, indicating a potential true difference in effect size or the presence of nearby causal variants with different linkage disequilibrium (LD) patterns.
title: A Saturated Map of Common Genetic Variants Associated with Human Height from 5.4 Million Individuals of Diverse Ancestries

finding: The synonymous variant rs61756181 in the SOX5 gene, while implicated in Lamb-Shaffer syndrome, was not associated with any specific phenotype. Despite its presence across all represented populations in gnomAD with varying MAF values, this variant showed a high ADS of 0.496, signifying its widespread occurrence across diverse populations. The MAF was 0.026 in gnomAD compared to 0.069 in the IGSR dataset.
title: Allele Dispersion Score: Quantifying the range of allele frequencies across populations, based on UMAP

finding: Found to be significant for both breast and endometrial cancers with a connection to blood cell traits.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: This SNP strongly disrupted CEBPB regulation of TNFRSF1A in the Hippocampus, associated with severe stage Alzheimer’s disease neuroinflammatory module.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: SNP rs623853 was detected as having significant regulatory activity within the context of the YEATS4 gene based on SuRE data in K562 cells. This finding was attributed to alteration in transcription factor binding affinity.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: The SNP rs554591 showed significant regulatory activity in K562 cells, with identified binding patterns relating to transcription factors that influence enhancer activity.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: This SNP was located near multiple GWAS lead SNPs related to red blood cell traits, and SuRE identified the G allele as exhibiting approximately 8-fold higher activity compared to the A allele, implicating it in regulating SH2B3.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: The SNP rs11111633 was reported to correlate with the biology of meningiomas and was implicated in the role of Merlin/NF2 loss, further suggesting its involvement in cancer pathways regulated by YAP/TAZ.
title: Structure-based discovery of a novel small-molecule inhibitor of TEAD palmitoylation with anticancer activity

finding: The study successfully edited the functionally predicted SNP rs704074 (A/G), which is in strong linkage disequilibrium with a genome-wide associated risk variant for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). The MICCNi002-A cell, which had an AA genotype, underwent CRISPR-Cas9 transfection using a donor molecule that introduced the G allele. The screening of 50 single-cell clones identified 5 with the successfully knocked-in variant, confirming the achievement of a heterozygous A/G genotype. This demonstrated an effective editing success rate of 10%, indicating the utility of this method in precision gene editing for disease modeling.
title: Integration of Xeno-Free Single-cell Cloning in CRISPR-mediated DNA Editing of Human iPSCs Improves Homogeneity and Methodological Efficiency of Cellular Disease Modelling

finding: The SNP rs4766428 was found to be a significant eQTL for ATP2A2, which is associated with cognitive ability, risk of schizophrenia, and risk of anorexia nervosa. This SNP corresponded to damaging missense mutations in ATP2A2, suggesting a strong link to bipolar disorder. It highlighted the contextual influence of oxygen-responsive conditions on gene expression related to neurological traits.
title: Oxygen-induced stress reveals context-specific gene regulatory effects in human brain organoids

finding: The T2D risk variant rs1617434 at the MPHOSPH9 locus overlapped a candidate cis-regulatory element (cCRE) defining beta-1 subtype. Its risk allele significantly decreased beta-1 chromatin accessibility and disrupted a predicted binding site for the transcription factor HNF4A. This effect was notable, with a beta-1 allelic effect (π) of 0.27, a 95% confidence interval of 0.12 to 0.46, and a q-value of 0.048. Additionally, this allele was associated with reduced expression of genes such as ABCB9, RILPL2, and MPHOSPH9, with P-values indicating significant expression changes.
title: Integration of single-cell multiomic measurements across disease states with genetics identifies mechanisms of beta cell dysfunction in type 2 diabetes

finding: The CYP27B1 rs10877012 polymorphism was also investigated in the context of multiple sclerosis, suggesting its relevance in autoimmune disease susceptibility.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs3184504, identified as a missense mutation in the SH2B3 gene, was associated with various autoimmune disorders, particularly type 1 diabetes (T1D) and celiac disease, across more than 40 publications.
title: JASS: Command Line and Web interface for the joint analysis of GWAS results

finding: The study found that individuals carrying the A risk allele (AA/AG) of the rs1006737 genotype exhibited a deficit in reward responsiveness when compared to non-risk (GG) genotype carriers. This was observed using a probabilistic reward-learning task, indicating that variation in the CACNA1C gene, specifically this SNP, may be linked to behavioral deficits in reward processing, which are relevant to anhedonia, a symptom common across various psychiatric disorders.
title: REDUCED CACNA1C EXPRESSION PRODUCES ANHEDONIC REACTIONS TO PALATABLE SUCROSE IN RATS: NO INTERACTIONS WITH JUVENILE OR ADULT STRESS

finding: The variant rs104894368 was associated with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. It surfaced during subquery optimization for a dataset containing gene markers like Hyal2 and Myl2, indicating a connection to enriched cell types such as cardiomyocytes and heart epithelial cells.
title: Fast searches of large collections of single cell data using scfind

finding: Similar to rs104894368, the variant rs104894369 was also linked to hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. It appeared in the word cloud generated from the query involving atrial and ventricular heart tissue markers, reinforcing its association with heart cell types.
title: Fast searches of large collections of single cell data using scfind

finding: The SNP rs77956314 was associated with hippocampus volume variability in the mean models. It contributed to variance with 0.535% explained variance and had a very low mean variance model finding of 0.0006%.
title: Genetic control of variability in subcortical and intracranial volumes

finding: The non-coding transcript exon variant rs1247942912 in AC024257.3 was shown to have an association with height, thanks to the insights gained from the application of WGS data.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The variant rs2072449 (12_8058041_A_G) acted as an eQTL for the transcription factor FOXJ2, located approximately 25 kb from its TSS and in the 3' UTR of C3AR1. The G allele was associated with enhanced FOXJ2 expression in whole blood. However, different eQTL comparisons revealed that it reduced expression in EBV-transformed lymphocytes and NECAP1 across various tissues. Additionally, in GWAS studies, the G allele was linked to a decrease in monocyte count and an increase in neutrophil count.
title: Single-cell gene expression prediction from DNA sequence at large contexts

finding: Located exclusively within an OCR found in excitatory dentate gyrus neurons, rs4765913 was significantly associated with bipolar disorder, highlighting its potential role in psychiatric conditions.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: Part of the CACNA1C locus, rs882195 intersected with an OCR in excitatory neuron populations, contributing to the understanding of its role in potentially modulating schizophrenia-related phenotypes.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: This SNP was identified within the CACNA1C locus with intersections in OCRs from excitatory neurons, suggesting its relevant contribution to disease mechanisms.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: Intersected with OCRs in excitatory neurons across multiple cortical layers, indicating its relevance in modulating neuronal function and possible association with schizophrenia.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: This SNP intersected with both excitatory and inhibitory neurons, suggesting a complex role in regulating expression related to schizophrenia.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: Similar to rs1860002, this SNP intersected with both excitatory and inhibitory neurons, reinforcing the multifaceted nature of its potential role in schizophrenia.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs11060877 was linked to the immune checkpoint regulation, specifically relating to the DNAM-1 and the TIGIT/PVRIG/TACTILE axis in natural killer (NK) cells. This finding was contextually relevant to cancer immunotherapy, suggesting its potential implications in enhancing NK cell responses against cancers like triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC), as reported by Sanchez-Correa et al. in their 2019 study.
title: Microfluidic system-based time-course tracking of physical proximity between cells and its effect on gene expression for elucidating live single cancer-immune cell interactions

finding: The rs11062091 SNP was recognized as a sQTL affecting the splicing of DCP1B transcripts, contributing to associations with obesity. Its minor A allele disrupted Z-RNA formation, affecting transcript stability and promoting adiposity.
title: Z-Flipon Variants reveal the many roles of Z-DNA and Z-RNA in health and disease

finding: The SNP rs11178649 at the TSPAN8 locus was in complete LD with rs3763978, which was a missense variant linked to asthma and had a 'probably damaging' prediction from PolyPhen.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: While this SNP had a weaker association, it was recognized in GWAS as one of 37 'longevity SNPs' suggesting a small effect on human lifespan. This aligns with findings in the study where meQTL.5a was proposed to contribute modestly to lifespan variation through epigenetic mechanisms.
title: Pleiotropic Influence of DNA Methylation QTLs on physiological and aging traits

finding: The SNP rs11060761 was linked to mitochondrial ion channels, contributing to chemotherapy resistance in cancer cells. The study highlighted that genetic variations in this locus could affect cancer cells' susceptibility to chemotherapy.
title: Monitoring extracellular ion and metabolite dynamics with recombinant nanobody-fused biosensors

finding: The SNP rs10846742 was influenced jointly by sex, BMI, and urban status, indicating a complex interaction affecting LDL cholesterol levels.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs3763978 was in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs11178649 and was a missense variant causing a glycine to alanine substitution. It was associated with asthma as part of the TSPAN8 locus.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SNP rs11059921 influenced the expression of SLC15A4 in pDCs and highlighted the module's relevance in linking genetic risk factors of SLE to disease pathogenesis.
title: Autotaxin may play a Critical Role between the Genetic Risk Factors and Pathogenesis of SLE in Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cells

finding: The index variant rs10735079 was significantly associated with needing intensive care during SARS-CoV-2 infection, where it was found to reduce the risk of needing care by approximately 22%, suggesting a protective role in severe COVID-19 cases.
title: A genetic variant protective against severe COVID-19 is inherited from Neandertals

finding: The SNP rs11060819 was associated with findings related to the inhibition of WEE1 kinase in cancer studies. Specifically, a study by Serpico et al. in 2019 revealed that inhibition of WEE1 rather than PLK1 occurred at therapeutically relevant concentrations of the compound AZD1775, indicating a potential role of this SNP in understanding the efficacy of WEE1 inhibitors in cancer treatment.
title: Wee1 inhibition decouples Cdk1 and Plk1 activities: a role for gradual Cdk1 activation throughout G2 phase

finding: The SNP rs11111726 had been previously associated with the expression of Stat5b. In the context of the study, Derlin-1 deficiency led to decreased expression of Stat5b, which in turn affected adult neurogenesis, seizure susceptibility, and cognitive function. Thus, the finding reinforced the significance of Stat5b regulation in neurogenesis and provided a direct link between the SNP and the observed phenotypes.
title: Homeostatic Regulation of Seizure Susceptibility and Cognitive Function by ER Quality Controller Derlin-1 through Maintenance of Adult Neurogenesis

finding: This intronic variant in CCDC77 was connected to mean reaction time, reinforcing the genetic influence on cognitive abilities.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The intronic variant rs12301915 in PTPN11 was associated with cognitive performance, outlining its role in synaptic plasticity and memory formation.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The SNP rs11111628 was found in the context of glutamine metabolism in brain tumors and highlighted in a similar study exploring metabolic pathways. It was correlated with potential modifications in metabolic pathways that could affect treatment response in GBM, consistent with the overall findings about metabolism and treatment resistance in brain tumors.
title: Reciprocal links between methionine metabolism, DNA repair and therapy resistance in glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs2283290 was found to have a significant role in triggering diabetic cataract, based on a study that recruited 2,501 Scottish cases and 3,032 controls. This finding established a clear association between this SNP and the development of diabetic cataract, thereby underscoring a genetic link between type 2 diabetes and cataract.
title: The putative causal effect of type 2 diabetes in risk of cataract: a Mendelian randomization study in East Asian

finding: The KLRB1 gene expression was altered due to the rs4763655 SNP, and a study by Søndergaard et al. in 2011 suggested an association between this SNP and multiple sclerosis.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: The intronic SNP rs10506151 of the LRRK2 gene was associated with neurodegenerative diseases and type 2 diabetes in a study conducted by Huang et al. in 2021.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: The rs34637584 SNP was specifically linked to the LRRK2:G2019S mutation, recognized as the most common genetic cause of both autosomal dominant familial and sporadic Parkinson's Disease (PD) as well as Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD). Genotyping analysis aimed to exclude individuals with this mutation to establish a clear understanding of its role in the pathogenesis associated with PD and IBD, highlighting its significance in the study of their epidemiological connections.
title: Peripheral Blood Immune Cells from Individuals with Parkinson’s Disease or Inflammatory Bowel Disease Share Deficits in Iron Storage and Transport that are Modulated by Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs

finding: The SNP rs11111783 was identified in the context of targeting integrins in cancer nanomedicine. This research highlighted its relevance to cancer diagnosis and therapy, showcasing the implications of genetic variations in influencing the effectiveness of therapeutic strategies in malignancies.
title: Hypoxia-inducing cryogels uncover key cancer-immune cell interactions in an oxygen-deficient tumor microenvironment

finding: Noted at the ALDH2 locus, this SNP exhibited significant association with T2D in East Asian males, displaying clear sexual dimorphic effects.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: Found in association analyses, this variant is positioned at the ALDH2 locus and was shown to contribute to T2D risk specifically in males.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: The SNP rs11050660 was associated with the histone H3 mutation G34R, which showed reduced H3K36 trimethylation and acetylation, increased genomic instability, and replicative stress, culminating in defective homology-dependent DNA damage repair. These findings highlighted the mutation's role in aggressive pediatric glioma and demonstrated how distinct mutations at the same residue in histone H3 could lead to varying phenotypes related to DNA damage response in cancer.
title: Surprising Phenotypic Diversity of Cancer-associated mutations of Gly 34 in the Histone H3 tail

finding: The SNP rs10774671 was reported as a significant finding related to the antiviral immune response, specifically in its association with flavivirus infections and neuroinvasive diseases such as WNV. The A to G change in a splice acceptor site led to the generation of the protective p46 isoform of OAS1, which inhibited WNV replication. This finding indicated that the G allele was protective, suggesting a mechanism of reduced susceptibility to neuroinvasive disease.
title: Neuroinvasive flavivirus pathogenesis is restricted by host genetic factors in Collaborative Cross mice, independently of Oas1b

finding: The SNP rs10848025 was associated with the lincRNA LINC00936 in CD14+ monocytes, supporting its involvement in monocyte differentiation processes.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs2292665 showed an association with lincRNA RP11-290F20.3, which is known to influence gene regulation in specific cell types.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs113315762 was noted as an intergenic variant located between HRK and FBXW8, associated with eosinophil counts in a multi-ancestry GWAS. While it was not the lead eQTL for these genes in the JHS dataset, it appeared in the secondary credible set for FBXW8. The finding is significant as it also indicated a potential regulatory role on FBXW8 expression. Similar to rs10173412, this variant had a higher MAF in African populations (45.9%) relative to European populations (10.7%), emphasizing that its functional implications may be more pronounced in individuals of African ancestry.
title: Gene Expression and Splicing QTL Analysis of Blood Cells in African American Participants from the Jackson Heart Study

finding: The SNP rs2650044 was analyzed and reported to have the median per-locus FST estimate of approximately 0.0961 among loci with a minor allele frequency of at least 10%. This finding was derived from the Human Origins datasets, which included 244 subpopulations. The analysis demonstrated that the allele frequencies at this locus displayed strong geographical correlation, indicating that the human population structure does not align with the independent subpopulations model.
title: FST and kinship for arbitrary population structures I: Generalized definitions

finding: The rs42447 SNP located on chromosome 7D was associated with novel sources of leaf rust resistance. It does not correspond to any previously identified resistance genes (Lr19, Lr29, Lr34) or known QTLs, which indicates its potential utility in enhancing resistance through breeding programs.
title: Identification of novel leaf rust seedling resistance loci in Iranian bread wheat germplasm using genome-wide association mapping

finding: The SNP rs7957197 was shown to have pronounced effects on transcriptional activity in beta cells, supporting its role as a functional variant in T2D.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The SNP rs12304921 was linked to several candidates with MPRA activity effects, demonstrating its significance for further exploration as a putative causal SNP.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The SNP rs2596144 in the HPD gene was positively linked to elevated tyrosine levels in neonates, which is critical since HPD is associated with type III tyrosinemia, indicating significant metabolic effects.
title: A genome-wide association study of neonatal metabolites

finding: The SNP rs10674957, found intronically in the TRHDE gene, was associated with age-dependent changes in white matter cerebellum volume. TRHDE encodes an extracellular peptidase, impacting neuropeptide activity in the central nervous system.
title: Dynamics of Brain Structure and its Genetic Architecture over the Lifespan

finding: The SNP rs3184504, located near the SH2B3 gene, was associated with coronary heart disease (CHD) as a causal trait. It was among the two outliers identified, contributing to 15 putative causal traits for CHD. These findings highlighted the connection between higher systolic blood pressure (SBP) and increased CHD risk.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The SNP rs653178 was detected as an outlier and associated with 14 candidate traits influencing coronary heart disease (CHD). This included connections to anthropometric measures such as hip circumference and cholesterol levels, underscoring its relevance in understanding the relationship between urate levels and CHD.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: SNP rs590429 was linked to the gene ADAMTS with a q-value FDR ≤ 0.11. This finding was based on its connection to the cis-association with OLR1, demonstrating its role in the network of genes responsive to glucocorticoid exposure.
title: Causal Network Inference from Gene Transcriptional Time Series Response to Glucocorticoids

finding: The SNP rs4329754 was associated with the gene OLR1 and further extended its relationship to the gene ITGAV, yielding a q-value FDR ≤ 0.13. This association indicated its involvement in metabolic syndrome and atherosclerosis, linking immune and metabolic pathways.
title: Causal Network Inference from Gene Transcriptional Time Series Response to Glucocorticoids

finding: The rs11057401 variant in CCDC92 was reported to profoundly impact fat distribution, with the minor allele showing reduced visceral fat and an increase in leg fat mass. Specifically, the association indicated that this variant was linked with lower abdominal fat mass (β = -0.065, p = 3.5E-8) and visceral fat mass (β = -0.063, p = 1.3E-7), highlighting its unique role in contrasting fat deposition patterns.
title: Regional fat depot masses are influenced by protein-coding gene variants

finding: SNP rs7132434 was associated with the ITPR2 locus and was found to overlap with an ATAC-seq peak in mesenchymal stem cells. It had a deltaSVM z-score indicating increased chromatin accessibility and was proposed as a causal SNP for T2D due to its predicted interactions with AP-1 motifs.
title: Human and rat skeletal muscle single-nuclei multi-omic integrative analyses nominate causal cell types, regulatory elements, and SNPs for complex traits

finding: The SNP rs10860964 was identified as a tag SNP in loci associated with schizophrenia (SCZ) and demonstrated interactions with the gene Ascl1, which was found to engage with cEnhancers overlapping SCZ credible set SNPs. This finding indicated a potential link between fetal regulatory elements and the expression of SCZ-associated genes.
title: Integrative analysis of the 3D genome and epigenome in mouse embryonic tissues

finding: The rs3217893_C>T variant was shown to have a significant association with medications gliclazide, used in Type 2 diabetes treatment, suggesting its role in the treatment context for this phenotype.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The study indicated that MDM2 (rs2279744) showed relationships with colorectal cancer risks among Asians and Africans under a recessive model, based on stratification analysis. This finding pointed to the significance of this SNP in assessing colorectal cancer susceptibility.
title: Genomic analyses identify significant molecules and biological processes in colorectal cancer cells with DNA damage

finding: The SNP rs192592111 C>A in the gene PAH was found to have a carrier frequency of 2.5% (1 in 40) in the Vietnamese population and its allele frequency was reported to be 9 times higher than in the East Asia population, linking it to phenylketonuria.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs199475650 G>T in the gene PAH also had an allele frequency that was 9 times higher in the Vietnamese population, further contributing to a carrier frequency of 2.5% (1 in 40) associated with phenylketonuria.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: This SNP was linked to rheumatoid arthritis and showed significant co-expression QTL interactions with RPS26 in monocytes, revealing 1,701 co-expression QTLs identified in the unstimulated condition.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals widespread personalized, context-specific gene expression regulation in immune cells

finding: This SNP significantly affected the co-expression of CLEC12A, which showed prominent co-expression relationships after 3h of pathogen stimulation, indicating the influence of IFN regulatory factors.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals widespread personalized, context-specific gene expression regulation in immune cells

finding: At the SH2B3 gene locus, the variant rs762349492 was found to have a risk association with T1D, contributing to the overall understanding of how gene regulation in autoimmune contexts can influence disease.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The SNP rs1006737 was identified in the context of its association with schizophrenia. The research highlighted that the CACNA1C gene, which this SNP relates to, was implicated in neurobiological mechanisms relevant to schizophrenia.
