Specifically, it pointed to the role of L-type Ca2+ channels (LTCCs) in synaptic strength and signaling pathways modulated by norepinephrine, indicating that genetic variations at this locus could influence the functionality of these pathways in the context of psychiatric disorders.
title: α1 adrenergic receptor - PKC - Pyk2 - Src signaling boosts L-type Ca2+ channel Cav1.2 activity and long-term potentiation in rodents

finding: The enhancer variant rs147730268 was predicted to affect the expression of HCAR2, and was implicated as a likely causal variant associated with BMI, integrating significant prior evidence of its association.
title: A Unifying Statistical Framework to Discover Disease Genes from GWAS

finding: The variant rs3897102 demonstrated a high PPA linked to the association with metabolic regulations and was thought to correlate with BMI-related pathways.
title: A Unifying Statistical Framework to Discover Disease Genes from GWAS

finding: The SNP rs11060818 was associated with the regulation of the RhoB gene, which was identified as part of signaling pathways modulated by miR-375 in heart muscle. This finding related to the implications of Rho-GTPases in heart diseases, suggesting potential avenues for understanding tumorigenesis and aging processes.
title: From miRNA target gene network to miRNA function: miR-375 might regulate apoptosis and actin dynamics in the heart muscle via Rho-GTPases-dependent pathways

finding: The top eSNP (rs1131017) for RPS26, located in its 5' UTR, was a cis-eQTL for SUOX in resting and stimulated T cells. Moreover, its trans-effects involved mediation through RPS26, indicating its regulatory link between these genes in T cells.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: rs4765905 was involved in an amplicon that drove significant RNA transcript expression in the MPRA, marking it as part of an enhancer component linked to psychiatric disorders.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: The intronic polymorphism rs10506151 of the LRRK2 gene was associated with type 2 diabetes, demonstrating its interactive effect on neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The polymorphism rs2292239 in the ERBB3 gene was associated with an increased risk for type 1 diabetes mellitus, indicating its potential impact on autoimmune diabetes risk.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The involvement of SNP rs6332 in NTF-3 was associated with the onset time of Alzheimer's disease, representing its potential role in the disease progression.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The T allele of SNP rs6489630 was found to exhibit a protective role against Alzheimer's disease, suggesting its potential as a therapeutic target.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The OAS1 gene variant rs1131454 was pointed out as a significant genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease, showcasing its relevance in neurodegeneration.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs11060750 was associated with the gene <italic>Ldh</italic>, which is essential in mediating the Warburg effect observed under conditions of impaired mitochondrial fusion. This finding was originally presented in the context of the study on mitochondrial dynamics and neurodegeneration, indicating that variations at this SNP may influence neuronal survival by impacting lactate metabolism in aging neurons.
title: Chronic mitochondrial fragmentation elicits a neuroprotective Warburg-like effect in Drosophila neurons

finding: The SNP rs117238625 was identified in association with sVCAM-1 levels and is located in the 5' UTR region of HSP90B1, which might affect transcription factor binding, indicating a potential regulatory role affecting sVCAM-1 concentration.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies seven novel loci associating with circulating cytokines and cell adhesion molecules in Finns

finding: This SNP, which is in linkage disequilibrium with rs117238625, was also associated with sVCAM-1 concentration, reinforcing the regulatory potential of variants in the HSP90B1 locus in modulating sVCAM-1 levels.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies seven novel loci associating with circulating cytokines and cell adhesion molecules in Finns

finding: The SNP rs10847864 was identified as a trans-eQTL for the gene SYNJ1 in the adult brain cortex. This finding merged observations from familial studies and GWAS, underscoring SYNJ1's potential importance in Parkinson's disease (PD) pathogenesis.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: The rs76904798 SNP was discovered as an eQTL that upregulated LRRK2 expression in 19 peripheral tissues, indicating its relevance to PD, notably absent from CNS tissues.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs11111675 was associated with the expression of voltage-gated sodium channels in carcinomas, as demonstrated in a study by Djamgoz et al. (2019). This finding indicated that genetic variations at this locus contributed to the functional characteristics of cancer cells, particularly in their ability to generate membrane potential fluctuations that enhance metastatic potential.
title: Membrane voltage fluctuations in human breast cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs34637584, known for the G2019S variant in the LRRK2 gene, was included in the analysis as a significant risk variant for PD and has been of interest in previous polygenic risk score analyses due to its large effect size in the context of Parkinson's disease.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: At locus 12q13.13, the SNP rs3842942 was associated with a cluster of 20 keratin genes affecting the integumentary system. Among these, 6 genes were identified to influence hair and scalp phenotypes, including KRT71, which was the closest gene to the index SNPs.
title: MendelVar: gene prioritization at GWAS loci using phenotypic enrichment of Mendelian disease genes

finding: SNP rs7961185 was also located at locus 12q13.13 and, similarly to rs3842942, it was linked to the same cluster of keratin genes with relevance to hair and scalp conditions, further supporting the original findings of candidate gene prioritisation.
title: MendelVar: gene prioritization at GWAS loci using phenotypic enrichment of Mendelian disease genes

finding: The rs1861494 SNP was identified as being associated with IBD disease severity. This association was linked to functional changes in both the methylation of IFNG and its protein secretion. This finding highlighted the relevance of the IFNG gene in the context of inflammatory bowel disease.
title: Helicobacter hepaticus as disease driver in a novel CD40-mediated model of colitis

finding: The SNP rs11111634 was associated with findings related to the bromodomain protein BRD9 in the context of tumorigenesis. It was reported that PIK3CA cooperated with KRAS to enhance MYC activity, which in turn is associated with increased tumorigenic potential through mechanisms involving BRD9. This implicates rs11111634 in pathways of cancer development.
title: BRD9-containing non-canonical BAF complexes safeguard cell identity and prevent reprogramming

finding: The SNP rs11060750 had a positive original finding relating to its role as a metabolic link in tumors, as described in the context pertaining to the regulation of lactate dehydrogenases in the tumor microenvironment. This study highlighted the importance of this SNP in understanding metabolic interactions between tumor and stroma, which parallels the findings related to metabolic control in retinal pigment epithelium reprogramming.
title: DISTINCT METABOLIC STATES DIRECT RETINAL PIGMENT EPITHELIUM CELL FATE DECISIONS

finding: This SNP, a synonymous variant in the WASHC3 gene, was significantly associated with activation strength in both right VTA (R-VTA) and left VTA (L-VTA) regions. The G-allele was identified as the risk allele linked to increased activation.
title: Gene Set-Based Analysis of the Endosomal Sorting Processes Cargo Selection and Membrane Tubulation with Human Reward System Reactivity

finding: The SNP rs80019710 was linked to HMGA2 via intergenic Tier-1 SNPs, implicating it in bone biology through non-coding RNAs and chromatin interactions.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs17101510 was associated in a cluster with other Tier-1 SNPs near HMGA2, suggesting a significant role in bone mineral density through regulatory mechanisms.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs12296417, alongside rs80019710 and rs17101510, was part of a cluster linked to HMGA2 with regulatory implications in osteoporosis susceptibility.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: SNP rs428073 demonstrated a variant-disease association with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus, obtaining a VDA score of 0.7, which indicated at least one curated source linking this variant to the disease.
title: Comprehensive assessment of Indian variations in the druggable kinome landscape highlights distinct insights at the sequence, structure and pharmacogenomic stratum

finding: The SNP rs11060837 was associated with the expression regulation of the HOX cluster miRNAs, particularly impacting miR-196b, in the context of Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML). The study indicated that the deletion of HOTTIP, which is linked to this SNP, led to a significant reduction in miRNAs, consequently promoting apoptosis through elevation of the FAS gene expression. This relationship provided insights into how genetic variations could influence the pathogenesis of AML.
title: A coordinated function of lncRNA HOTTIP and miRNA-196b underpinning leukemogenesis by targeting Fas signaling

finding: The lead common variant rs10774625 was previously shown to tag a haplotype block encompassing the entire SH2B3 gene and was strongly associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) through Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS). It acted as a significant expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL), thereby linking SH2B3 expression levels to SLE risk.
title: Rare SH2B3 coding variants identified in lupus patients impair B cell tolerance and predispose to autoimmunity

finding: The missense variant rs3184504 was identified in proximity to the SH2B3 gene, exhibiting a high linkage with the lead variant rs10774625 (r2 = 0.92). This association further reinforced the connection between SH2B3 and the pathogenesis of systemic lupus erythematosus by suggesting that variants like rs3184504 may influence the protein's function in a way that predisposes individuals to B cell development abnormalities and autoimmune responses.
title: Rare SH2B3 coding variants identified in lupus patients impair B cell tolerance and predispose to autoimmunity

finding: The SNP rs653178 at the ATXN2 locus exhibited strong evidence for selection linked to phenotype expression but specific phenotypic associations were not detailed in the abstract. Nevertheless, it reinforced the notion of ongoing selection pressure in contemporary European populations.
title: Ancestral contributions to contemporary European complex traits
